She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to continue to invest in her pork selling business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Aydita

texts.es: Aydita tiene 40 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos en la casa propia que lograron adquirir. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas, pues a raíz del fracaso de su tienda optó por vender cerveza dentro de su domicilio pues es mucho mas rentable, sobre todo los fines de semana donde todas las personas descansan y tienen muchas celebraciones. Gracias a su carácter y experiencia en el comercio puede manejar las situaciones difíciles con clientes pasados de copas. Pero Aydita quiere reabrir su bodega, para vender todos los días, adicional a la venta de  bebidas, pues con la ayuda de sus hijos podría atender estas dos actividades, dejando las bebidas solo para pedidos y distribución, para ello, seguirá ahorrando y trabajando esforzadamente. Aydita viene trabajando con Microfinanzas PRISMA hace más de 6 años, este es su quinceavo préstamo y todo este tiempo ha podido entrelazar amistad con las personas de su localidad, gracias a su grupo solidario. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas para cubrir sus próximos pedidos en los próximos meses.
texts.en:
Aydita is 40 years old. She lives with her spouse and her children in her own home that she was able to acquire. She works selling drinks, under the risk of the failure of her store she opted to sell beer from her home, which is much more profitable, over all the weekends when all the people are resting and there are many celebrations. Thanks to her character and experience in sales she is able to manage the difficult situations with drunk clients. But Aydita wants to reopen her corner store, in order to sell every day, adding the sale of drinks, and with the help of her children be able to do both these activities, leaving the drinks only for orders and distribution, and thus continue saving and working hard. Aydita has been working with Microfinanzas PRISMA for more than 6 years; this is her fifteenth loan and in all this time she has made intertwined friendships with the people in her area, thanks to the solidarity group. The money that she is asking for would be invested in the purchase of drinks to cover the next orders in the coming months.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Edgar Ignacio

texts.es:
Edgar es soltero, tiene 32 años.  
Su familla es confeccionista  de jeans, de niño vivió en ese mundo el aprendió ahora sigue los pasos de su padre, tiene un taller de confecciones de jeans, el cose, traza y vende las prendas, en provincia. 
Desde que esta en Finca agradece los créditos que le dan, por que no conseguía quien le dé crédito y en Finca encontró una oportunidad, paga puntual, y es responsable para mantener invicto.  
Solicita un crédito de 1400 soles, para la compra de dos rollos de tela jeans. 
El sueño de Edgar es  comprar una maquina de bordados y  tener su tienda para vender lo que confecciona.
texts.en:
Edgar is single and he is 32 years old. His family makes jeans. He grew up in a jean-making world. He learned to follow in his father's footsteps. He has a workshop where he makes jeans. He sews, designs, and sells the clothing in provincial areas. Since he's been in the group Finca he has been grateful for all the loans they have given him. Before joining Finca, he was not able to get loans for his business. With Finca he has been given an opportunity to receives loans. He pays on time and he is responsible with his reputation as a borrower. He is requesting a loan of 1,400 Soles so that he can buy large rolls of fabric to make jeans. Edgar's dream is to buy and embroidery machine and to have a store to sell his jeans out of.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He is requesting a loan of 1,400 Soles so that he can buy large rolls of fabric to make jeans.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Bancomunal Jesús de Praga.
Olga es casada, tiene 22 años, una hija de 2 años  
La familia de Olga  confecciona, ella aprendió por que trabajaba en el taller de sus padres, hace   dos años se caso y con su esposo tiene un taller de confecciones, y un puesto de ropa con su cuñada.   
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a ser  solidaria, a tener amigas, aprendió a valorar lo que tiene, le gustan las charlas de negocio que se da en las reuniones del Bancomunal.
Olga necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de tela Taslan sintético para hacer playeros.  
El sueño de Olga es  tener mas maquinas, mas personal y  comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the communal bank Jesús de Praga. Olga is married and she is 22 years old. She has a two year old daughter. Olga's family works in the tailoring business. She learned this craft in her parents' workshop. Two years ago Olga got married to her husband and they started a tailor shop together and a stand where they sell clothing with her sister-in-law. Since Olga has become a member of Finca she has learned to be supportive and loyal to her fellow members, to have friends, and to appreciate what she has. She like to go to the lectures on business that are held at the communal bank. Olga needs a loan of $375 (1,200 Soles) to be able to buy nylon to make bathing suits. Olga's dream is to have more sewing machines and to purchase her own house one day. (Translated by Vitorio of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Olga needs a loan of $375 (1,200 Soles) to be able to buy nylon to make bathing suits.

loans.name: Titi

texts.en: Titi L., 35 years old and married with three children, sells tailoring materials and sews clothes. Her husband is a mechanic. She is requesting the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. Titi says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Caciana

texts.es:
La socia Caciana, vive en la comunidad de Tambo real en el distrito de Zurite de la provincia de Anta, está ubicado a 1 y 40 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco; la socia tiene 48 años de edad, ella tiene 5 hijos de, 30, 27, 20, 15, 13, años.

Nuestra socia y sus 02 hijos mayores quieren iniciar su propio negocio en la venta de lácteos, para lo cuál ella solicita el préstamo para comprar 03 vacas y así juntarlas con las de sus hijos, y hacer una empresa familiar, para que de está manera todos juntos puedan seguir  apoyando a los menores que aún están estudiando.

La socia desea ver a toda su familia trabajando con ella y designándose tareas dentro de la empresa familiar; mejorando su calidad de vida y soñando con un futuro digno y de dicha para cada uno de sus hijos.

Nuestra socia reconoce y valora el esfuerzo de los prestamistas y agradece gentilmente el apoyo brindado y promete la devolución del préstamo en el plazo correspondiente.
texts.en:
Caciana lives in the Tambo Real community in the Zurite district of the Anta province, which is located 1 hour and 40 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 48 years old and has 5 children who are 30, 27, 20, 15 and 13 years of age. She and her 2 older children want to start their own business selling milk products, for which she is requesting the loan so she can buy 3 cows and add them to her children's cows to thus make a family business. In this way, all of them together can continue to support the young ones who are still studying. She wants to see her whole family working with her and designating tasks within the family business, improving their quality of life and dreaming of a worthy future and happiness for each of her children. She recognizes and values the effort of the lenders. She kindly thanks them for their support and promises to repay the loan in the specified time period.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows and begin a business to sell milk products.

loans.name: Yarkin's Group

texts.en: This is the Bulmaga Mihail group, and its members, all related and living in the same district, are farmers. Mihail works very hard every day and is a very responsible family man. He and his brother Racila A. manage a store where they sell vegetables that they grow, together with others, on 20 hectares of land inherited from their parents. Mihail is hoping that through this loan, his profits will increase and he will be able to grow his business. Mihail suggested to his relatives that they apply for a loan to open one more store in the wholesale market, and they agreed because sales are going so well that they will be able to repay the money without any problems.

loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina A. is a fifty-one-year-old married woman with two children, both girls. Both of her daughters are in junior high school. Augustina’s husband is a commercial driver. He conveys goods and people to and from Berekum and Sunyani. She lives with the husband and their children in their own house, earned with much toil and trouble, in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Berekum is a busy business centre about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Augustina is a food vendor. She cooks ‘banku’ in her house and sells on the street. "Banku" is a local food prepared from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. Augustina buys bags of maize and other ingredients directly from the farmers in the surrounding villages where the cost is competitive. Augustina has been in business for over twenty years. Apart from the food-selling business, Augustina also sells drinks and biscuits. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure bags of maize and other goods in bulk.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Presentación

texts.es:
La socia PRESENTACION, es natural de la comunidad de Tambo real en el distrito de Zurite de la provincia de Anta, está ubicado a 1 y 40 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco; la socia tiene 44 años de edad, ella tiene 5 hijos de, 26, 24, 22, 18, y 16 años.

La socia tiene 15 vacas, y desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de 04 vacas holstein, para incrementar su producción, ella se dedica entre sus actividades domésticas a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y a la producción de lácteos y derivados.

Ella es una mujer muy activa, y reconocida como una mujer trabajadora dentro  de la comunidad de Tambo real; es una mujer muy carismática y llena de mucho optimismo, pese a las dificultades que le tocó vivir, ella sigue día a día, con mucho optimismo y con fe y ve que poco a poco todos sus sueños se van haciendo realidad y ahora con la ayuda de esté préstamo ella podrá terminar de construir su vivienda, con lo que le generé la producción de sus vacas.

Esta socia agradece gentilmente el préstamo otorgado comprometiéndose así a pagar la deuda total en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Presentación is from the Tambo Real community in the Zurite district of the Anta province, which is located 1 hour and 40 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 44 years old and has children who are 26, 24, 22, 18 and 16 years of age. She has 15 cows and wants to invest the loan in the purchase of 4 Holstein cows. In order to increase production, among her domestic activities she buys and sells cattle and produces milk products. She is a very active woman and known as a very hard worker within the Tambo Real community. She is a charismatic woman and full of optimism, despite the difficulties that she has suffered. She continues day after day filled with much optimism and faith. She makes sure that, little by little, all her dreams come true. Now, with help from this loan, she will be able to finish building her house with the money generated from her cattle's production. She is very thankful for the loan and commits to paying the total debt in the determined time period.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase her capital.

loans.name: Talalatou

texts.fr: Cette dame a pour activité la vente de charbons de bois et des ustensiles de cuisine, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1999, elle habite le quartier d’agoè logopé, actuellement son stock de marchandises est épuisé et elle sollicite un prêt de wages pour s’acheter 18 sacs de charbons de bois ,08 séries d’assiette et 08 séries de casseroles pour se réapprovisionner. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants.
texts.en:
This is a lady who sells charcoal and kitchen utensils. She has been in this business since 1999. She lives in the Agoè Logopé district. Currently, her stock of merchandise is exhausted, and she’s requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 18 sacks of charcoal, 8 sets of plates, and 8 sets of sauce pans in order to resupply herself. She is married and the mother of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha Adjei-F. is forty-eight years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to four children, two boys and two girls. She says some of her children are in senior high school and others are in junior high and primary school. Martha lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. ,P>

Martha’s husband is a professional teacher while she is a school proprietress. Martha has established a basic school in her community. Currently, she has up to basic stage five. "Jesus Preparatory School" is the name of Martha’s school. She wants a loan to procure writing desks for the pupils. Martha aspires to develop the school to at least the junior high level. According to her, she has qualified teachers as a staff. She has been a proprietress for six years now.

loans.use: To buy school desks

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena B. is fifty-five years old. She is a widowed mother of four children, a girl and three boys. She says some of her children have completed senior high school and are hoping to continue while others are in junior high and primary school.

Abena lost her husband some years ago. She lives with the children in a rented apartment in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Abena works very hard to meet the demands of the family, and most importantly, the children’s school fees. She sells cereals such as beans, maize, etc. Abena buys her goods all the way from Techiman and sometimes directly from the farmers in the surrounding villages to beat the high cost. She sells in the local market, mostly to food vendors. Abena has been in business for over thirty years and is full of experience. She says it is necessary to be in business to make some income to support her children in school. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure bags of cereals in bulk.

loans.use: To procure cereals

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Claudia es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Claudia se dedica a la agricultura de papa en sus terrenos de Manallasac, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, sus productos los comercializa en la ciudad de Lima.
Claudia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de remedios.
Claudia sueña con tener una tienda en su casa e implementar una ferretería.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the communal bank "Capuli". She lives with her husband and four children. She makes a living with her husband by growing potatoes on the land they own. She sells the potatoes in the city of Lima. Claudia needs 1,000 Soles that will be used to buy medicine. Claudiea dreams about having a store in her house and about starting a hardware store also.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Julia es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Julia tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir, en donde confecciona faldas, centros y ropa típica, sus productos los comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad. Además julia se dedica a la agricultura de trigo, papa.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas y para el pago de los peones.
Los sueños de Julia son que sus hijos obtengan su titulo profesional y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Capuli communal bank. Julia is married, 48 years old and has four children. Julia owns a workshop where she tailors clothes, such as skirts, large belts, and typical clothing. Her products are sold in the markets around the city. Additionally, Julia farms wheat and potatoes. Julia needs a 2000 Soles loan in order to purchase fabrics and pay workers. Julia’s dreams are for her children to obtain professional degrees and to improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and pay workers

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana T. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and the mother of two children, both boys. She says both of her children are in the basic school. Diana’s husband is a motorcycle fitting mechanic. He has his workshop located at a strategic point. Diana lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Diana sells footwear. She procures a variety of footwear (shoes, slippers, etc. for both men and women), from nearby cities and sells the goods in the local market. She also treks to nearby towns to sell. Diana has been in this business for six years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more goods. It is Diana’s desire to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy footwear for re-sale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 41 años, vive con sus dos hijos, pues está separada de su pareja. De joven estudió cosmetología y al concluir sus estudios instaló un centro de belleza en el mercado de su ciudad, donde viene trabajando desde hace 7 años, gracias a la gran diversidad de productos de belleza que ofrece en  este mercado, las personas nunca dejan de visitarla al realizar sus compras. Gloria trabaja todas las mañanas haciendo maquillajes y peinados, que es lo que más disfruta, sobre todo a fin de año por la cantidad de fiestas escolares que hay en la ciudad, generando mayores ganancias. Pero lo que no le gusta realizar son los cortes para varones porque no son creativos, a diferencia de los peinados de las mujeres. Ella  está dispuesta a instalar un salón de belleza en su casa y así dejar de pagar el alquiler del local, dinero que invertiría en la ambientación de su propio local. Gloria viene trabajando junto a PRISMA 7 años, tiempo que le ayudó a reforzar su capital de trabajo y entrelazar lazos de amistad con las socias de su grupo. Con los 2 mil soles desea comprar materiales para equipar su negocio con lo último en tecnología y hacerlo más competitivo.
texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old. She lives with her two children, and is separated from her husband. As a young woman, she studied cosmetology and at the end of her studies she got a spot in a beauty salon in the market in her city, where she has worked for 7 years. Thanks to the great diversity of beauty products that she offers in the market, the people never stop coming to make purchases from her. Gloria works every morning making combs and brushes, and she really enjoys this, above all during the end of the year because of the number of school parties that there are in the city, which generate a larger income. But she doesn’t enjoy doing haircuts for the men because they are not creative, as compared to the haircuts for the women. She wants to install a beauty salon in her home and so stop paying rent for her location, money which she would invest in the ambiance of her own shop. Gloria has been working with PRISMA for 7 years, time that has helped her reinforce her working capital and enter into friendships with the members of her group. With the 2000 soles, she wants to buy materials to equip her store with the latest technology and make it more competitive.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools for her salon

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Gabriela es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Gabriela vende ropa en las diferentes ferias de la región, sus productos los compra en la ciudad de Lima. Además Gabriela vende miel en la ciudad de Lima.
Gabriela necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de casacas, pantalones.
Los sueños de Gabriela son educar a sus hijos, tener mas capital y tener un local estable.
texts.en:
Gabriela belongs to the Capuli community bank. Gabriela is 29 years old. She has three children and is in a common-law relationship. Gabriela sells clothing at the various regional markets; she buys her goods in the city of Lima. In addition, Gabriela sells honey in Lima. Gabriela needs a 2,000 soles loan to invest in the purchase of jackets and pants. Gabriela dreams of educating her children, having a better income and a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jackets and pants for resale

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia SOLEDAD; Está situada en la comunidad de Tambo real en el distrito de Zurite de la provincia de Anta, está ubicado a 1 y 40 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco; la socia tiene 24 años, tiene 1 hijo de 8 años de edad.

Nuestra socia alterna sus obligaciones como madre, con la actividad ganadera, ella tiene junto a su conviviente 10 vacas holstein; las cuales le permiten a ella la elaboración casera de productos lácteos como yogurt naturales, manjar blanco, quesos y quesillos, y la distribución de leche fresca natural; la socia quiere invertir el préstamo solicitado en la construcción de su nueva casa, quiere terminar de comprar puertas, marcos, vidrios, entre otros acabados, para mudarse a su casa propia.

Esta socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y ratifica su compromiso de pagar el préstamo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Soledad lives in the community of Tambo Real in the district of Zurite, Anta province, one hour and 40 minutes from the city of Cusco. Soledad is 24 years old and has an 8-year-old son. Soledad is both a mother and raises livestock. She and her partner have 10 Holstein cows from which she makes milk products at home: natural yoghurt, manjar blanco (caramel spread), cheeses. She also distributes fresh natural milk. Soledad wants to invest the loan she is requesting to build a new home: she wants to finish buying doors, doorframes, window panes, among others so that she can move into her own home. Soledad is grateful and appreciates the loan she has been given and reaffirms her commitment to repay the loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy doors, doorframes, window panes for her new home.

loans.name: Irma Raquel

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Irma es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Irma vende miel de abeja de manera ambulatoria en la puerta de una tienda. Además Irma junto a su esposo venden artefactos, cubrecamas, en las diferentes ferias de la región.
Irma necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de DVD, licuadora y cubrecamas.
Los sueños de Irma son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una tienda estable de venta de artefactos.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Capuli community bank. Irma is in a common-law relationship; she is 33 years old and has two children. Irma is a street vendor selling honey at the doorway of a store. Irma and her husband also sell artifacts, bedspreads at various regional markets. Irma needs a 3,000 soles loan which she will invest in the purchase of DVDs, a blender and bedspreads. Irma's dream is that her sons have careers and to own a stable store to sell artifacts.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy DVDs, a blender and bedspreads.

loans.name: Briginda

texts.es: Briginda tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos menores de edad en la casa de sus padres, pues aún está en construcción el terreno que compraron con su pareja. Ella esta dedicada a embellecer a las personas, pues hace 20 años encontró su vocación en la cosmetología, desde entonces se preparó para instalar su salón de belleza, logrando hacerlo realidad hace 10 años, tiempo que logró adquirir un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad, donde  la venta es buena debido a la concurrencia de las personas, quienes con el tiempo se han ido convirtiendo en fieles clientes de doña Briginda. Se levanta de madrugada para terminar  sus deberes como madre y esposa, para luego movilizarse a su puesto donde atiende todo el día, pues sus clientes sienten un gran cariño por ella debido a su trato cordial y el carisma que posee. Sin embargo, en el futuro ella desea tener un salón de belleza más amplio, con el fin de brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes y que pueda vender productos de belleza. Briginda está con MFP hace 4 años, este es su 7 séptimo préstamo, y espera seguir trabajando continuamente con las socias, quienes están muy contentas por el bonito grupo que formaron. Con los 3 mil soles que solicita podrá adquirir algunos materiales e instrumentos útiles para su salón de belleza y así estar acorde con la competencia.
texts.en:
Briginda is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and her three young children in the house of her parents, because the land that she bought with her husband is still under construction. She works beautifying people, for over 20 years ago she found her calling in cosmetology, and since them she has prepared to open her beauty salon, which became reality 10 years ago, time when she was able to acquire a stall in the market of the city, where the sales are good thanks to the number of people, who with the time have become loyal clients of Ms. Briginda. She gets up at dawn to finish her chores as a mother and wife, and later she goes to her stall where she works all day. Her clients feel a great tenderness for her thanks to her cordial manner and the charisma that she has. Without doubt, in the future she wants to have a bigger beauty salon, with the goal of providing better attention to her clients and so she could be able to sell beauty products. Briginda has been with MFP for 4 years, this is her 7th loan, and she hopes to continue working with her group members who are very happy with the good group they have formed. With the 3,000 soles that she is asking for she would be able to acquire some materials and useful tools for her beauty salon and so be able to provide cuts with competence.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools for Briginda's beauty salon

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en:
Mamuna I. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and the mother of two children, a boy and a girl. She says her son is in the in the basic school while her daughter is in junior high school. Mamuna’s husband owns a corn mill in their community. He has hired workers who run the business daily. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Mamuna trades in footwear, textiles, jewelry and other fashion accessories. She procures a variety of these goods from Accra and other cities. She says she learnt this business from her aged mother. She sells in the local market and also treks to nearby towns to sell. Mamuna has been running this business for about twenty-five years and is endowed with rich experience. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more goods. It is Mamuna’s desire to help her husband give their children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy textiles, footwear, jewelry, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 40 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la casa que vienen construyendo. Ella es una mujer que podemos ver trabajando en las calles ofreciendo diversas prendas de vestir a muy bajos precios, actividad que viene desempeñándo desde hace 6 años. Gracias a la acogida que tiene por su zona pudo aumentar sus ventas y ahora  busca un puesto donde pueda vender su mercadería, por lo pronto espera seguir satisfaciendo la demanda de las personas de bajos recursos, pues es lo más agradable dentro de su labor como comerciante, ya que ayuda a las personas poniendo al alcanse de sus bolsillos lo necesario para su vestido. Lo que no le agrada es exponerse varias horas bajo el ardiente sol, que algunas veces le impide seguir su labor. Ella espera seguir creciendo como comerciante, ayudando a las personas de su zona  a tener acceso de diversos  productos que por la distancia son muy escasos. Yolanda es cliente de MFP desde hace 6 años, tiempo en que inició su negocio como comerciante. Con el dinero que solicita comprará uniformes, ya que la época de campaña escolar es muy rentable, para ello invertirá 1500 soles.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 40 years old. She lives together with her husband and her two children in the home that they are constructing. She is a woman who we can see working in the streets offering various things to wear at very low prices, an activity that she has been doing for 6 years. Thanks to the welcome that she has in her neighborhood she was able to increase her sales and now look for a stall where she could sell her merchandise. More immediately, she hopes to continue satisfying the demand of people with small resources, as it is nicer to do her work as a businesswoman, and to help the people, putting within the reach of their pockets what is needed to dress. What she doesn’t like is to be exposed for many hours to the hot sun, which several times has kept her from her work. She hopes to continue growing as a businesswoman, helping the people in her area have access to various products that because of the distance are very scarce. Yolanda has been a client of MFP for 6 years, time in which she has grown her business. With the money that she is asking for she would buy uniforms, as the time for school is very profitable, and so she would invest 1500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for school time

loans.name: Antonieta Graciela

texts.es:
Antonieta es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Antonieta es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Antonieta venD. pollos y derivados que procesa en su casa, como hamburguesas, carne molida, entre otros productos dependiendo D. la demanda. Sus ventas lo realiza en su puesto del mercado Magdalena.
Antonieta necesita un préstamo D. 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. pavitas y embutidos.
Antonieta sueña con tener el dinero suficiente y culminar los acabados D. su vivienda.
texts.en:
Antonieta is a member of the Capuli community bank. Antonieta is married, 50 years old and has four children. Antonieta sells chickens and and chicken by-products which she processes in her home, such as hamburgers, ground meat and other products depending on the demand. She sells from her stall in the Magdalena market. Antonieta needs a 1,800 soles loan to invest in the purchase of young turkeys and cold cuts. Antonia dreams of having enough money to finally put the finishing touches on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy turkey and cold cuts

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila tiene 42 años, tiene casa propia donde habita junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos.  Ella es una mujer con muchas ganas de progresar, pues se dedica a múltiples actividades, pero la más importante es la venta de bebidas y comida que realiza en la puerta del mercado desde  hace 2 años, gracias a una oportunidad que le brindaron instaló su puesto y tiene grandes ganancias, ya que está ubicada en una zona muy transitada. Ahora, por temporada de verano las personas concurren con más frecuencia a los mercados, pero para estar a las horas de mayor concurrencia Lucila tiene que preparar desde temprano los refrescos y la comida para  instalarse en su puesto y comenzar a vender hasta el medio día, para luego retornar  a su hogar muy cansada pero contenta por la labor realizada. Ahora tiene proyectado abrir un pequeño, de venta de jugos para así no tener que  trasladar sus cosas de un lugar a otro y brindar tranquilidad y los servicios necesarios a sus clientes. Lucila viene trabajando con MFP desde hace 6 años, ella está muy contenta de formar parte de un grupo tan bonito dentro de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que requiere instalará un puesto de jugos en el mercado y así hacer menor su carga laboral.
texts.en:
Lucila is 42 years old, has her own home where she lives with her husband and 4 children. She is a woman with great desires to succeed, so she holds various jobs but the most important is selling beverages and food at the entrance of the market, something she has done for 2 years. Thanks to an opportunity that they provided her she installed her stand and has large earnings, as she is located in a very highly frequented area. Now, in the summer, people are going to the market more frequently, but to be there the greatest number of hours Lucila has to prepare her refreshments and food early in order to be in her stand and start selling at midday, to then return home very tired but content because of the work she has completed. Now she pans on opening a small juice stand so she doesn’t have to move the items in her home from one place to another and provide tranquility and necessary services to her customers. Lucila has been working with MFP for 6 years, she is very content to be part of such a beautiful group within her communal bank. With the money that she needs she will open a juice stand in the market to make her work easier.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a juice stand

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana O. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and the mother of two children, a boy and a girl. She says her son is in the basic school while her daughter is in junior high school. Christiana’s husband sells a variety of gadgets such as video decks, mobile phones, television sets, radio sets, etc. Christiana lives with her children and husband in a family house in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Christiana runs a poultry farm. She procures day-old chicks and feed from the surrounding big poultry farms. She says food vendors and retailers come to buy her chickens. Christiana has been running this business for five years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more chicks. It is Christiana’s desire to help her husband give their children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure more day-old chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene un hijo mayor de edad, todos ellos viven en su casa, que con mucho esfuerzo lograron construir. Desde muy joven se dedicó al comercio, con el tiempo pudo obtener un puesto propio, con el paso de los años fue creciendo y hace 15 años se consolidó como una de las tiendas más concurridas de la zona, ahora requiere de la ayuda de una tercera persona para atender su negocio de lubricantes. Ella está segura de que su negocio  seguirá creciendo, pues acaba de invertir en la compra de repuestos que son muy dificiles de encontrar y son muy necesarios para las reparaciones de todo tipo de vehículos, convirtiéndose así en proveedores de algunas mecánicas que ubicadas en su distrito. Carmen tiene la proyección de llegar a prestar servicios de mantenimiento a cualquier auto, pues cuenta con todos los instrumentos necesarios, sólo requiere de personal y de un local adecuado donde instalarse. Carmen inició sus préstamos en MFP hace 7 años y piensa que la instituición es una opción de desarrollo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de repuestos, los cuales son muy costosos e invertiría en ello 3500 soles, para incrementar su ganancias y tener cada vez más cerca la realización de sus metas como empresaria.
texts.en:
Carmen is forty-three years old, married, and has one, grown, son. Carmen, her husband, and her son, all live in their house -- which, with much effort, they have built. Carmen has been in merchandise since she was very young, and in time was able to get her own stall. As time wore on, Carmen’s business grew. Fifteen years ago, she consolidated her business, just as many of the very busy stores in the area have done. Now she needs a third person to help out with her lubricant business. She is sure her business will continue to grow. She just purchased some hard-to-find replacement parts that are necessary for the repair of any kind of vehicle, so that she could supply local mechanics. Carmen could service any vehicle. She has all the necessary tools, and now all she needs is an employee and a good location in which to set up shop. Carmen started her loans with MFP seven years ago, and she thinks that the institution is an opportunity for the development of her business. With the money she requests, Carmen will purchase lots of replacement parts, which are very expensive (she will spend 3500 soles on them) to increase her income and grow closer to her goals as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris Y. is thirty years old. She is a married woman with three children, all of whom are boys. She says all of her sons are in the basic school. Doris’ husband is a carpenter and a cocoa farmer. She lives with her husband and the children in a rented apartment in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Doris enjoys selling foodstufs. She sells maize and dried pepper. She procures bags of maize and the dried pepper directly from the farmers in the surrounding villages where it is cost-effective. Doris treks to other markets to sell her goods, mostly to food vendors. She says retailers also come to buy from her.

Doris has been in business for seven years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure bags of maize in bulk and pepper in bulk.

loans.use: To procure maize and dried pepper in bulk

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.es: Brigitte tiene 37 años, tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposo y su hijo de 13 años. Su carisma y su alegría hicieron de ella una experta vendedora de cosméticos, pues no hay cliente que no quiera trabajar con tan alegre dama, gracias a ello viene trabajando hace 5 años con diversas lineas de cosméticos, las cuales le otorgan catálogos que reparte a sus clientes, quienes solicitan sus pedidos cada mes. Brigitte encontró en las ventas una buena fuente de ingresos económicos, pues los cosméticos son muy rentables en la zona, ya que las mujeres suelen ser muy detallistas en su imagen y realizan sus pedidos constantemente. Sin embargo lo mejor que encontró en su negocio es el compartir con las personas  momentos gratos. Ella espera que en el futuro pueda abrir un bazar donde exhiba sus productos y ser una buena consultora de belleza. Brigitte trabaja con PRISMA hace 6 años, donde aprendió mucho en cuanto a ventas, pues supo desempeñarse bien como miembro de la directiva  dentro de su grupo. Ahora espera invertir 3 mil soles en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos, pues durante las ofertas y campañas que ofrecen las líneas de belleza son donde más productos se puede obtener y a bajos costos.
texts.en:
Brigitte is 37 years old; she owns her home, where she lives with her husband and 13-year-old son. Her charisma and her joy make her an expert cosmetics seller: who is the customer who wouldn't want to work with such a happy woman. Thanks to this she has been working for the past five years with various cosmetic brands which give her catalogues to hand out to customers who place orders with her every month. Brigitte has found her sales to be a good source of income as cosmetics are very profitable in her area as the women want to be very meticulous with their image and constantly place orders with her. However, the best part of her business is sharing pleasant moments with others. She hopes to open a bazaar in the future to showcase her products and become a good beauty consultant. Brigitte has been working with PRISMA for six years and has learned much about sales and she has done well as a member of the leadership committee of her group. She now wants to invest 3 thousand soles to buy bulk quantities of products as during the special offers and sales campaigns is the best time to obtain more products at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her stock of merchandise

loans.name: María

texts.es: A sus 47 años, María tiene una casa propia donde vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Su dedicación en el trabajo fue ofreciéndole grandes oportunidades de desarrollo, como instalar un pequeño restaurante frente al mercado de su localidad, que hace 10 años atiende durante todos los días, ocupándose desde la madrugada, pues sale a realizar sus compras, para luego preparar el menú que ofrece a sus clientes a partir del medio día. Sin embargo, también la podemos encontrar vendiendo en las noches, pues ofrece deliciosas cenas. Para incrementar sus ventas trata siempre de variar el menú diario, mejorando en el trascurso del tiempo, ya que es una actividad muy rentable debido a la buena sazón que heredó de su madre. Ahora gracias a este gran don tiene proyectado comprar una cocina industrial, pues así agilizaría su trabajo en la preparación de los alimentos y tendría mayor cantidad de clientes satisfechos. María viene trabajando con MFP, institución que la ayudó a mejorar su negocio y donde se siente muy bien por los lazos amicales que formó con sus compañeras de grupo. Con el dinero que requiere comprará una cocina industrial, la cual está valorizada en 1500 soles, la cual le sería una herramienta muy útil para su trabajo como cocinera.
texts.en:
At 47, María owns her home where she lives with her husband and three children. Her dedication to her work has been the source of great development opportunities, such as installing a small restaurant in from of her local market, where she has worked daily for 10 years from daybreak when she goes out to purchase what she needs to when it is time to prepare the meals she offers her customers from midday. Despite this, she can also be found selling at nighttime when she offers delicious suppers. In order to increase her sales she also tries to have a new menu plan daily, making improvements over time as this is a very profitable enterprise due to her ability to season her dishes well, an ability she inherited from her mother. Now, thanks to this great talent she is planning to buy a industrial stove as this will allow her to spped up her work preparing the food and she will have more satisfied clients. María has been working with MFP, an institution which has helped her improve her business and where she feels very comfortable because of the bonds she has formed with her fellow group-members. She will use the loan to buy a industrial stove valued at 1,500 soles and which will be a very useful tool for her work as a cook.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an industrial stove

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: Ysabel tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa que aún está en construcción. A ella siempre le gustó las ventas y sobre todo desde muy joven tuvo el anhelo de vender productos de belleza, lo que logró hace 8 años, ahora puede dedicar su tiempo a una de las actividades que más le agrada. Ysabel se muestra siempre muy entusiasta cada mañana al salir de su hogar en busca de sus clientes, las cuales le tienen gran estima porque las atiende de la mejor manera posible, ofreciéndoles diversos productos de muy variada calidad y con precios al alcance de su bolsillo, pues ella conoce las necesidades y condición económica de sus clientes y por ello trabaja con varias líneas de belleza, que van desde las más caras hasta las que ofrecen precios más cómodos. En el futuro desea tener un bazar donde pueda ofrecer diversos productos de belleza y juntamente instalar una pequeña librería aprovechando la ubicación que tiene su casa junto a la escuela de su distrito. Ysabel está en su quinceavo préstamo con MFP, y todo este tiempo le ha servido de mucho, ya que junto a su grupo todas aprenden muchas cosas para mejorar su calidad de vida. Con el dinero solicitado desea iniciar el proyecto de su bazar y los 3500 soles serán invertidos en la compra de algunos muebles y mercadería necesaria.
texts.en:
Ysabel is 43 years old and lives with her husband and son in her home, which is still under construction. She has always enjoyed being in sales and from a young age has wanted to sell beauty products, which she began doing eight years ago. Now she can spend her time doing one of the things she enjoys the most. Ysabel is always very enthousiastic when she leaves her home every morning to find her customers, who have great respect for her because she treats them in the best possible manner, offering them a variety of products at a variety of qualities and at prices within their reach. She knows the needs and finances of her customers and because of this she works with a variety of beauty companies, from the most expensive to the most affordable. In the future, she would like to have a bazaar where she could offer a variety of beauty products as well as a small bookstore, taking advantage of the location of her home, next to the district school. Ysabel is on her 15th loan with MFP and this relationship has helped her greatly as she and her group have learned many things to improve their quality of life. She will use the loan to open her bazaar and the 3,500 soles will be invested in the purchase of some furniture and merchandise she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open the bazaar business she wants to start

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es: Giovanna tiene 39 años, es casada  y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Es una mujer muy activa, pues va cambiando de productos de venta, según la temporada que hay en el trascurso del año, dedicándose ahora a la venta de dulces y bebidas heladas en las calles de su localidad, pues encontró un espacio donde todos los días instala su puesto, sale a partir de la 8 de la mañana a ofrecer las diversas bebidas y dulces para las personas que transitan por ahí, tornándose un actividad muy cansada, ya que todo el día atiende a sus clientes que acuden a comprar sus antojitos al puesto de Giovanna. Sin embargo, ser ambulante no le ayuda a mejorar su negocio, es por ello que desea instalar una tienda en su casa y dejar de salir todas las mañanas a exponerse al sol. Giovanna esta trabajando con MFP hace más de 10 años, este en su quinceavo préstamo, el que permanezca durante tanto tiempo en la institución es producto de una buena organización y consolidación de su grupo. Ella requiere 1500 soles para la compra de mercadería y surtir su pequeño puesto de venta con variados productos.
texts.en:
Giovanna is 39 years old, married and lives in a house she owns with her husband and two children. She is a very energetic woman who changes the goods she sells depending on the season. For now, she is selling candies and cold drinks in the streets of her neighbourhood. She has found a spot where she sets up her stall every day, leaving at 8:00 in the morning to offer her various refreshments and candies to passers-by. This is a very tiring activity as all day she attends to her clients who come to buy her snacks. Nevertheless, been a street vendor does not help her improve her business and because of this she wants to open a store in her home so that she no longer has to leave home every morning to spend the day exposed to the sun. Giovanna has been working with MFP for more than 10 years; this is her 15th loan. Anyone who remains for such a long time with the institution [MFP] has shown they are a good organizer and work well with their group. She needs 1,500 soles to buy merchandise and stock her little stall with a variety of goods.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Diola

texts.es: Diola es casada y vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos adolescentes. Ella posee un gran carisma y muchas ganas de progresar, lo cual se ve reflejado en el trabajo que realiza desde hace 10 años, el cual consiste en vender artículos metálicos como las bases de sombríllas o paraguas, las que elabora junto a su socio, dentro de el taller que tiene instalado en el segundo piso de su casa; pero para elaborar estos diversos instrumentos tienen que comprar diversos materiales, es por ello que salen de madrugada a las tiendas de metales para  adquirir lo necesario y así cuando llegan a su taller se ocupan en diseñar  grandes cantidades, los cuales después serán vendidos en diversos lugares de la selva, donde Diola suele viajar. Para el futuro ella y su socio desean abrir un taller de metales en un local cercano a las zonas comerciales, pues hay más demanda y mayores opciones de hacer crecer su negocio. Ella viene trabajando con MFP más de 10 años y este es su quinto préstamo, lo que demuestra la fidelidad que ha tenido con la institución  y con el grupo de amistades con quienes está muy contenta de trabajar. Con los 1500 soles que solicita comprará grandes cantidades de materiales, pues cada fin de mes tendrá que viajar a la selva para  atender los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Diola is married and lives with her partner and two teenage children. She has great charisma and strong desires to grow, which is reflected in the work she has been doing for 10 years, which is selling metal articles such as the bases of sunshades or umbrellas. She makes them with a colleague inside the shop she has installed on the second floor of her home. But in order to make these various items she has to buy a variety of materials. So she leaves early in the morning to the metal stores to acquire what is needed and in this whay when they arrive at her shop she busies herself in designing large quantities, which later will be sold in various places in the jungle where Diola usually travels. In the future she and her colleague wish to open a metal shop in a locale close to the commercial zones, as there is more demand and greater options to grow her business. Sh ehas been working with MFP for more than 10 years and this is her 5th loan, which demonstrates the commitment she has had with the institution and with the group of friends with whom she is very happy to work. With the 1500 soles that she is seeking she will buy large quantities of materials, as every end of the month she will have to travel to the jungle to take care of the orders that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a large quantity of materials for her business

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia baji is a 50-year-old married lady and has been a citizen of a city called Kot Radha Kishan for the past 20 years. Kot Radha Kishan is famous for its livestock because mostly people work at this business to support their families.

Razia baji is married to a man whose name is G. A. and he has a dairy business. He has been in this business for the past 15 years. Razia baji is the mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son is also involved with his father’s dairy business.

Razia baji is a very supportive lady. She helps her husband in his dairy business. She gets up early in the morning and gets milk from the buffalo and fills the milk pots. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband’s dairy business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their dairy business

loans.name: Terencio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega el señor Terencio V. se dedica a su actividad agrícola de siembra de maíz el cual al momento que se da la cosecha él lo extrae en grandes sacos los cuales después son vendidos. La situación que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado el señor Terencio es que en su comunidad no poseen energía eléctrica por ser una zona muy alejada y es por este motivo que decidió solicitar un crédito a Ceprodel para la compra de un panel solar para su casa el cual tenga acceso por lo menos a dos lámparas para alumbrarse por la noche y llevar a cabo su actividad agrícola.

Al haber adquirido el panel requiere cancelar dicha deuda y por esto espera en que Ceprodel le beneficie con un crédito para la compra del panel y de esta forma continuar con el mantenimiento de su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus dos pequeños hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles la educación escolar que ellos requieren.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Chinandega city Mr. Terencio V. farms corn. Currently it is the harvest and he harvests the corn in large sacks that will later be sold. The situation that Terencio has faced for a long time is that in his community they don’t have electrical power because they are in a distant zone, and because of this he decided to solicit Ceprodel for a loan in order to buy a solar panel for his home so he may have the use of at least two lamps to provide light at night and enable him to finish his farming. Upon acquiring the panel he will need to pay the bill so he hopes that Ceprodel will provide him a loan to help purchase the panel and in this way continue to support his family which consists of his wife and two small children for whom he has to provide the education that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel for his home

loans.name: Safia Begum

texts.en:
Safia Begum baji is a 41-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Kot Radha Kishan for the past 15 years. She completed her education up to 5th standard. Her husband's name is S. A. and he is a fruit seller by profession. He has been selling fruit for the past 10 years.

Safia baji is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son helps his father in his fruit-selling business and her younger son is in 2nd standard. Her daughter is in 5th standard.

Safia baji is a very hard-working lady. She knows her responsibilities. She knows that it's difficult for a single person to meet the family's expenses and for this reason she sews clothes and charges US$ 2 per dress. She is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruit for her husband’s fruit-selling business.

loans.use: To buy fruit for fruit-selling business

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen baji is a 38-year-old married lady and has been a citizen of a city called Kot Radha Kishan for the past 17 years. Kot Radha Kishan is famous for its livestock because mostly people do this business to support their families. Parveen baji completed her education up to 5th standard; she couldn’t study further because she belongs to a family of farmers and she had to work in agriculture.

Parveen baji married a man whose name is M. A. and he is a driver by profession. He has been driving for the past 10 years. He uses his vehicle to deliver different items (fruit and vegetables and construction supplies) from one place to another. Parveen baji is the mother of six kids: five daughters and one son. All of her children are getting an education from a school located near their house.

Parveen baji is involved in a shawl-selling business. She buys the shawls from a famous city called Multan and sells them in her native city. She does this work to pay the school fees for her kids because she has a dream to give her children a good future. She has successfully repaid three loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s vehicle (a type of truck called “Shahzore”) so that he will be able to continue his work and earn an income.

loans.use: To repair her husband's vehicle used for his transport work

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida baji has been a citizen of a city called Kot Radha Kishan for the past 15 years. Kot Radha Kishan is famous for its livestock because mostly people work in this business to support their families. Zubaida baji is married to a man whose name is M. A. and he is involved in a dairy business. He has a buffalo at his house.

Zubaida baji and her husband get up early and get the milk from the buffalo and then fill the milk pots. Her husband is very happy with her supportive behavior. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband’s milk-selling business.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for milk-selling business

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia baji has been a citizen of a city called Kot Radha Kishan for the past 15 years. Kot Radha Kishan is famous for its livestock because mostly people do this business to support their families. Rabia baji’s husband's name is Z. I. and he is a wood seller. He has been selling wood for the past 10 years. He chose this work because people used to come to him to buy wood to burn in their stoves for cooking meals for their families.

Rabia baji helps her husband by selling wood in the community. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more wood to sell.

loans.use: To buy wood to sell

loans.name: Maria Monica

texts.es:
La microempresaria María Mónica C. M. ha trabajado en la costurera por más de 30 años, y hace 8 años empezó con su propio taller de costura.  Ella ya ha recibido varios préstamos y tiene una historia como clienta buena.  Sobre los años, ha usado los préstamos para aumentar su negocio.  Actualmente, tiene siete máquinas de coser de varios estilos y capacidades, como una que forra botones, algunas eléctricas y una mecánica, esta última le permite trabajar cuando no hay energía eléctrica.  Además, ella tiene una empleada y su hija trabajando por ella y tiene una base de clientes establecida que la conocen y vienen a pedir ropa y cosas como mosquiteros.  

María tiene 58 años y es madre soltera de 8 hijos ya grandes.  En general, la mayoría de su trabajo viene de los uniformes escolares.  Pero porque la época de uniformes ya pasó, ella pide este préstamo para seguir aumentando su negocio, y esta vez va a invertir en tela blonda para hacer mosquiteros de varios tamaños y colores.  Hay mucha demanda por los mosquiteros y ella quiere comprar 100 yardas de tela blanda a US$ 4.00 la yarda para ser preparada para la demanda alta del verano.
texts.en:
Small-businesswoman María Mónica C. M. has worked in sewing for more than 30 years, and 8 years ago she opened her own sewing shop. She has received several loans and has a good record as a client. Over the years, she has used the loans to grow her business. Currently, she has seven sewing machines of various styles and capabilities; such as one for covering buttons, some electrical, and one mechanical. The mechanical one allows her to work when there is no electricity. She also has an employee and her daughter working for her and she has an established client base of people who know her and come to her to request clothing and items such as mosquito nets. María is 58 years old and is a single mother to 8 children, all of whom are grown. In general, the majority of her work is for school uniforms. Even though the time of year for uniforms has passed, she is requesting this loan so that she can continue growing her business. This time she is going to invest in cotton fabric of various sizes and colors. There is a lot of demand for mosquito nets and she wants to buy 100 yards of fabric at $4.00 per yard so that she can be prepared for the high demand in summer.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 100 yards of fabric for mosquito nets.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr.Antonio Durè,es soltero tiene21 años de edad,vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
                 
                 Se inició desde muy  joven a  la actividad  de  macatero (venta  ambulante casa por casa ) como  una alternativa a la  falta de empleo y  buscando  una  forma de ayudar a sus padres  se animò a realizar este  trabajo  se iniciò por la  zona de San Bernardino y como consiguò  muchos  clientes mas adelante extendiò su  zona  hacia  la capital  este  trabajo  le resulta rentable  y  constituye  su fuente   principal de ingreso y es sosten  de su familia  

                  Con el crèdito  obtenido comprarà sobrecamas
texts.en:
Mr. Antonio D. is a single, 21 year old man who lives with his parents in Carapeguá city. From a young age he has worked as a house to house salesman as an alternative to the lack of employment and seeking a way to help his parents he enthusiastically began in the San Bernardino area and acquired many customers. He then extended his zone to the capital city. This work has been profitable and is his main source of income and the means of support for his family. With the loan he will buy bedspreads.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bedspreads

loans.name: Comite Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Quiindy en la Cñia Cmdte.Peralta distante a 21km de la oficina de Carapeguá uñas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa . 
Estas Señoras son activas la mayoría de ellas son costureras de pelotas,vendedora de chipa entre otras actividades ya mencionados mas arriba .Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar atravez del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida .
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual
texts.en:
In the city of Quiindy in the Compañía Comandante Peralta 21 kilometers from the Carapeguá office, a few women of scarce resources found out about the committee of Mujeres Emprendedoras, "Enterprising Women," and decided to join together to get more information about this program. These women are active; most of them sew balls, some sell typical corn bread among other activities already mentioned further down. They are looking for a little bit more help to increase their family incomes thanks to the loan and improve their quality of life. They need the loan to invest in their respective businesses and thus generate a sustainable growth allowing them to grow as a group and as individuals.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Most members of the group invested in their current businesses (clothing, noodles, sugar, tea, rice, beverages, starch, corn flour, imitation leather, thread to sew balls,  etc.).

loans.name: Maria Leonarda

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora María Leonarda le esta hacienda falta un cuarto, ella es madres soltera y  tiene solo un hijo que ya es mayor de edad y le ayuda en los gastos de la casa.
     Doña María Leonarda con mucho esfuerzo ya compro el block pero le falta la varilla, cemento y pagar la mano de obra, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder llevar acabo su mejora ya que la recamara es para su hijo que necesita su propio espacio. 
Planea pagar esté crédito con los ingresos que obtiene como limpieza de una casa particular.
texts.en:
Ms. María Leonarda's home needs an additional room. María is a single mother of one son, who is now an adult and helps her with the costs of keeping a home. María has already purchased the cement blocks, but she needs the rods, cement, and money to pay for labor. She is asking for a loan to cover these costs, so that she can finish the home improvement and provide her son with his own space. She plans to repay this loan with income from cleaning a private home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Begin construction of an additional room

loans.name: Real Group

texts.es:
Este banco se denomina “REAL”, es un grupo formado de 13 personas en su mayoría integran familiares, dentro de los cuales tenemos a  08 socias mujeres y a 05 socios varones.

Nuestros socios tienen sus reuniones en las oficinas centrales en la ciudad del Cusco; cada uno de ellos tiene diferentes actividades y desean anexar a estas un nuevo proyecto que es el de formar sus pequeñas y propias empresas.

Los socios son gente emprendedora, y está es su primera etapa en este banco, desean el préstamo para poder formar un poco más de capital y realizar sus pequeñas empresas,  04 socios abrirán un restaurante de comida local,(precisamente uno de los socios, dejo una carta poder debido a que viajó por motivos de salud a la ciudad de Lima, y no aparece en la foto) para lo cuál solicitan el préstamo y así poder cubrir con los gastos que genera la misma al inicio de toda empresa, otros 3 miembros abrirán un snack café en su barrio, 3 socios mas pondrán su pequeño negocio de comida rápida y venta de jugos, 2 socias pondrán su pastelería y comida rápida, 1 socia invertirá par sus estudios de ingles.

Estos socios están muy agradecidos con el apoyo que recibirán y desean manifestar su compromiso de pagar las cuotas en los plazos determinados, hasta cancelar el total del préstamo.
texts.en:
This bank is called "REAL"; it is made up of a group of 13 people who are mainly related to each other: eight women and five men. Our members hold their meetings in the downtown offices in Cusco. Each member has different activities and they wish to add to these a new project: creating their own small companies. The members are entreprising people; this is their first time in this bank. They are asking for a loan to have a bit more capital and open their small businesses. Four members opened a restaurant selling local food. (One of the members left a note that he had to travel due to health reasons to the city of Lima and he is not in the picture). They will use the loan to pay for the expenses incurred in starting up their business. The other three members opened a snack and coffee spot in their neighbourhood. Three other members opened their small fast-food business and toy sales business; two members opened a cake shop and fast-food place, one other member paid to take English courses. These members are very grateful for your help and want to express their commitment to making the repayments on schedule, until the loan is entirely repaid.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the security deposit on the snack bar lease, to buy dishes for the restaurant.

loans.name: Gloria Dolores

texts.es:
La señorita Gloria Dolores H. tiene poco que adquirió su vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental. A su casa le está haciendo falta la barda, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y realizar la mejora, ya que vive solo y cuando sale a trabajar no hay quien le cuide su casa y no está nada segura. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para llevar acabo la elaboración de la barda alrededor de la casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Gloria Dolores H. bought her home using a government loan. Her house is missing a fence, but she doesn't presently have the money to buy materials and complete the construction. She lives alone and when she leaves for work there is no one to look after the house, and this is not safe at all. Because of this Gloria is asking for a loan to finish building the fence around her house.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fence around her home

loans.name: Yahaira Adelina

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señorita Yahaira Adelina M. le está haciendo falta repara el techo del patio ya que el que tiene esta en muy malas condiciones. Desea repararlo lo más pronto posible antes de que se venga la temporada de lluvia, pero por el momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora. Es por eso que nos está solicitando un préstamo y planea pagarlo con los ingresos de su trabajo como gerenta de una tienda de empeño, de este empleo depende ella y su mama quien tiene bajo su responsabilidad ya que es una persona grande de edad. 
(En la foto aparece su mamá la señora Virginia U. ya que la señorita Yahaira Adelina estaba en su trabajo.)
texts.en:
Ms. Yahaira Adelina M.' home needs some repairs done to the roof of the patio, as it is in very poor condition. She would like to repair it as soon as possible, so as to complete the work before the rainy season starts. At the moment she doesn't have the necessary funds to complete the work. Because of this she is asking for a loan, which she plans to repay with her salary as a store manager. Yahaira and her elderly mother both depend on her earnings, as her mother works for Yahaira. (The photo is of Yahaira's mother, Mrs. Virginia U., because Yahaira Adeline was at work at the time of the photo)

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof of the back patio of her home

loans.name: Flor De Amapola Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado en el centro focal de Villa Adela,  a éste pertenece la asociación “Flor de amapola”, grupo formado por dieciocho  miembros que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad. Este grupo por lo general se dedica al comercio de diferentes productos; vende papa, comida, ropa, verduras, fruta, otras se dedican a la costura de ropa ligera, también realizan tejidos de mantas. 
Ahora ellas necesitan mayor capital para comprar mayor cantidad de productos para poder ampliar sus ventas de este modo sus ganancias serán también mayores y así poder generar mayores ingresos para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
The focal centre Villa Adela is located in the city of El Alto. The "Flor de Amapola" group belongs to this centre; it is made up of 18 members who work very responsibly. This group is generally made up of merchants who sell a variety of products: some sell potatoes, food, clothes, vegetables, fruit; others sew light clothing; some weave ponchos. They now need more capital to buy large quantities of products to increase their sales. This will give them more income and they will get higher profits for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large quantities of products to retail

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Juan Z. tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la venta de elotes preparados por las calles, esté es el ingreso de su familia. 
Entre él y su esposa la señora Leonor Pérez  son los que atiende el negocio. Desea comprar otro carrito y así tener otro ingreso y darle trabajo a otra persona que lo necesita. Es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para poder comprar un carrito nuevo para la venta de los elotes y así podrá crecer su negocio y ayudar a otros.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Z. has been selling grilled corn on the street for five years. This serves as his family's income. Juan and his wife, Mrs. Leonor Pérez, manage the business together. Juan would like to purchase another cart in order to have another source of income, and to give work to someone else who may need it. In order to do this, he is asking for a loan to buy the new cart for selling corn, in order to build his business and help others.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a new cart to sell grilled corn

loans.name: Rosas Lindas Group

texts.es:
En la zona de Alto Lima se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Germán Buch, a este pertenece la asociación “Rosas lindas”. Un grupo muy simpático y particular formado por trece  miembros que trabajan de manera organizada en todas sus actividades, cumpliendo mas de siete años de trabajo junto a Pro-Mujer.  Las actividades que realiza la asociación Rosas Lindas, son varias; Sabina y Anacleta confeccionan estuches especiales en cuero, para revolver y correas para estos mismos, otras realizan tejidos en fibra de alpaca.
Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de materia prima, están seguras que sus ventas aumentaran, de este modo obtendrán mayores ganancias y beneficios para sus familias.
texts.en:
In the neighbourhood of Alto Lima, there is a group called "Rosas Lindas" which is located in the Germán Buch focal centre. Thirteen members make up this very pleasant and special group. They are organized in all their activities, having spent more than seven years working with Pro-Mujer. The Rosas Lindas have a variety of enterprises: Sabina and Anacleta make special holsters from leather for revolvers as well as belts; others weave using alpaca fibre. They say they need capital in order to buy raw materials; they are certain their sales will increase so that they will be able to make more money and profits for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Ms. Julie S. is 51 years old and comes from Guintas, Hamtic, Antique, Philippines. She is married and blessed with eight (8) children. At the moment she has 2 students in elementary, 3 high school and unfortunately 3 are working already. Her husband supports them by working as carpenter.

Ms. S. received her loan amounting to P 20,000 on February 4, 2009 that she will be using to purchase 1 cow that will be an addition to her herd. Other sources of income of the family are vegetable vending, dressmaking, and poultry raising. She dreams that she will improve their business so that it will be a source of bigger income to pay for the studies of her son someday. She also plans to have a concrete house for the future.

Ms S. would like to thank ASHI for the great help in her business and for helping her learn the essence of saving.

loans.use: buying more livestock to raise

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Mrs. Donna G. was born in the province of Antique in the Philippines. She lives at Caridad 36 of Antique Southwest Branch. She is 35 years old, married and blessed with 4 children, two in elementary and one in high school. They help each other in running their business. But that doesn’t mean that her husband is jobless; sometimes he is a carpenter and sometimes a tricycad (bicycle with sidecar used as public transport) driver.

Ms. G. is engaged in livestock raising, more specifically hog and cow fattening. She received her loan amounting to P 24,000 on February 9, 2009 with a term of 100 weeks. She learned this business since she was young; that’s why she is knowledgeable in this business. This amount serves as additional capital to purchase 2 pigs and one cow. She dreams that soon she will have a durable and spacious pigpen and have additional cattle someday. She dreams also that she will send her children to school and see them finish their studies.

Ms. G. wants to thank ASHI for all its initiatives for the poor and the Kiva lenders who will sponsor this loan.

loans.use: buying more livestock to raise

loans.name: Wipala Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Wipala” pertenece a la familia de  Pro-Mujer hace más de dos  años. La mencionada asociación  pertenece al centro focal Villa Adela, ubicada  en la Av. Bolivia – ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con quince miembros, estos  han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación podemos decir que son comerciantes en su mayoría, por ejemplo venden medias, accesorios para el cabello, ropa interior, materia escolar, también venden verduras. La asociación Wipala precisa de créditos para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, para poder ampliar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The "Wipala" group has been part of the Pro-Mujer family for more than two years. This group is part of the Villa Adela branch, located on Bolivia Avenue in the city of El Alto. Today this group has 15 members who have shown that they are well organized with respect to their repayments and group activities. The members of this group have a variety of businesses. Most of them are merchants. For example, they sell socks, hair accessories, clothing, school supplies as well as vegetables. The Wipala group is asking for this loan to buy products in greater quantities in order to increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need to buy large quantities of products

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Mrs. Brenda F. was born in Hamtic, Antique, Philippines. She is 26 years old, married, and blessed with 2 children. She is engaged in hog-raising, Natasha Dealing (representing a direct sales company selling shoes etc.), and Tricycad Service (3-wheeled bicycle used for transport). These have been their businesses since the first year of her membership in ASHI.

The initial capital she used in starting up the businesses was P 5,000 only. She received her loan on February 10, 2009 amounting to P 23,000 as additional capital for Natasha Dealing, purchasing piglets and repairing of her tricycad.

Ms. F. dreams that she might have a tricycad repair shop and other shop-related projects so that she would have sources of capital for sending her children to school and to attain a higher level of education. She would like to thank Kiva lenders who will sponsor her loan.

loans.use: Tricycad, hog raising, Natasha Dealing

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Mrs. Annaliza G. comes from the beautiful province of Antique. She belongs to Caridad 36 of ASHI-Antique Southwest Branch. This 41-year-old woman is married and blessed with 5 children, 3 in preparatory and 2 in elementary school.

Ms. G. is engaged in tricycad (three-wheeled vehicle doing transport) services. The business was only an adventure for a year and was only a family service, but as time goes by, they have found that it is much better for this to be a business so that it will bring in an income. The people in the municipality of Hamtic serve as the passengers for her husband's tricycad.

Because of the effort, Ms. G. dreams that she will become a big-time businesswoman someday so that she will have her own lot and build a durable house to live in. She dreams also that her children will finish their studies. She is thankful to Kiva lenders who will sponsor her loan.

loans.use: tricycad transport services

loans.name: I Nyoman Switra

texts.id:
Usaha Beternak ayam potong Yang di tekuni I Nyoman Switra Sejak tahun 2005 . kini berkembang pesat .  Masa pertumbuhan ayam yang sangat cepat yakni berkisar 35 sampai 40 hari , dan harga pasaran cukup baik sangat memotivasi peternak untuk mengembangkan usaha ini.
