Harga per kilogram ayam saat ini mencapai Rp.12.500 . Sedangkan Jumlah peliharaan  I Nyoman Switra adalah 6.000 ekor ayam. Pendapatan bersih yang di dapat oleh I Nyoman Switra kurang lebih Rp. 8.000.000 / panen. Dibantu oleh istri serta seorang tenaga kerja yang di gaji sebesar Rp. 1.000.000,- per sekali panen, I Nyoman Switra dalam setahun bisa panen sampai 7 kali sedangkan waktu lainnya di pergunakan untuk sanitasi kandang serta memperbaiki kandang yang rusak. Resiko yang dihadapi I Nyoman Switra dalam mejalani usaha ini  juga cukup tinggi karena ayam jenis ini sangat rentan dengan serangan penyakit dan sangat terpengaruh pada suhu /cuaca , sehingga memerlukan lingkungan yang sehat dan juga modal yang cukup untuk persediaan obat-obatan ataupun vaksin. Dan untuk mengatasi/ menekan resiko tersebut I Nyoman Switra berencana melengkapi kandangnya dengan alat yang di sebut Blower ( sejenis kipas angin besar ) agar terjadi pertukaran udar yang lebih baik .Untuk Itu I Nyoman Switra sangat berharap mendapat pinjaman lagi untuk tahap yang kedua yang akan di pergunakan untuk membeli alat tersebut. 
Dengan tambahan modal ini I Nyoman Switra akn merasa lebih tenang dan berharap hasil yang di dapat akan semakin meningkat, mengingat biaya yang di perlukan untuk menunjang  pendidikan anaknya yang kini telah duduk di bangku kuliah dan satu lagi masih SMP semakin  tinggi

loans.use: buy feeds and blower

loans.name: Aun's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is made up of four members, all residents in Odom Bang Commune, Battambang Province. Mr. Y. has been selected to be group leader by the group member. He usually leaves his house with his wife, working as construction workers for a small firm, and they both can earn around US$ 8 per day. The couple currently has five children who all are single: three are students and the other two are employed.

Y. and his wife are working hard every day and they are planning to work independently, so they have decided to request a loan as capital to buy construction materials and will use them to provide a service building houses.

The other three borrowers are:

S. R., a building worker, who needs a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorcycle; T., a local construction worker who is asking for a loan to purchase vegetables to sell at the market; and . C., a beer dealer for a company, who is applying for a loan to decorate her house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: I Putu Agus Sumerta

texts.id: Setelah mendapat pinjaman sebelumnya  I putu agus sumerta semakin optimis dengan hasil yang di dapat dari usaha menjahit yang sedang di tekuni saat ini. Hal hasilpun cukup lumayan untuk membiayai hidup dua orang anaknya yang masih kecil . dalam sebulan tak kurang dari 700.000 ribu rupiah yang bisa di kumpulkan oleh I Putu Agus Sumerta . Namun Hasil ini dirasakan belum cukup untuk memenuhi biaya kebutuhan hidup yang kini kian meningkat belum lagi Dia harus menanggung biaya sekolah Intan anak sulungnya yang masih duduk di bangku SD.  I Putu Agus Sumerta masih memerlukan pinjaman modal dari Dinari untuk tahap berikutnya yang akan di pergunakan untuk membeli bahan baku seperti : kain, kancing dan sebagainya sehingga lebih memudahkan / memperlancar usaha menjahitnya. Dengan tambahan modal ini juga harapan I Putu agus sumerta untuk bisa meningkatkan penghasilan nya akan bisa terwujud.
texts.en:
I Putu Agus Sumerta is highly encouraged by the positive return of the first loan for his sewing business. The business profit was sufficient to afford expenses for his 2 infant children. I Putu Agus Sumerta managed to safe about $60 per month. However, he is not satisfied with his current result amidst rising living cost and business expenses. He needs to start paying for school tuition his first daughter, Intan, who is startin grade school. I Putu Agus Sumerta feels that he needs another help from DINARI to purchase more raw materials like clothes, buttons, etc. to grow his sewing business. He hopes that with the additional funding, I Putu Agus Sumerta can improve his earnings.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cloths, buttons, etc

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn T. is a rice grower. She and her husband till their 5 hectares of land which her husband inherited from his parents. She is 34 years old and has 4 children. She dreams of having all her children graduate from college so that when they are old, they can have better lives for their future children. Life on the farm is fun, Marlyn says when we have time to interview her. Everyday she goes out to their farm to check their crops and remove some of the weeds to ensure a quality harvest. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 13,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. Her family depends on their farm and the loan will help her increase her yield.

CEVI provides their clients with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage. Because of these services, more and more CEVI clients are able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita A. is a rice farmer. She is 38 years old and has 4 children. Her husband is also a farmer. Together, they work together to support their children. Their harvest is mai ly, intended for family use. The remainders are sold to the rice traders in their village and the income is what she uses to buy their other needs. Aside from planting rice, they also grow vegetables on their farm. She waters them everyday and enjoy the harvest of her other crops.

She is asking a loan of Php 11,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. In this way, she will be able to increase her yield for her family.

She is one of the active CEVI clients. She has access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase Urea fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio B. works on a farm. He has a small rice field which he tills to support his family needs. He is 58 years old and has 9 children. He started his farm business in 1991 using his 3-hectare land. His harvest benefited his family, especially his children, in paying their tuition and books. Her wife Eva also grows crops on their farm. Together, they work hard to provide their children a future.

Eusebio is asking for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for his farm. In this way, he believes he will increase his yield. When that happens, he will increase the support for his family.

CEVI provides Eusebio credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage. These help him grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel F. rents a rice field in their village. He grows rice, which he uses to support his family. He is 55 years old and has 4 children. The 4-hectare land he tills provides for their needs. During harvest, he saves more rice for the family's consumption, and the rest is sold to rice traders in their town. Rice is a commodity, and he thinks it is a good business venture.

He is requesting a loan of Php 55,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. He believes this loan will bring him a bigger harvest. The loan will truly help Samuel increase his yield.

CEVI supports Samuel to grow his business more. Now, Samuel has access to credit assistance, training, and the insurance coverage CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and other supplies.

loans.name: Emee

texts.en:
Emee D. owns a small rice field in her village. Her family truly depends on it. Her harvest is what she uses to feed her family. Now that she is 30 years old, she wants to expand her farm and achieve better rice yield in the next harvest season. Her husband, Jenulito, manages their farm. Aside from planting rice, they grow vegetables. Emee waters them everyday and sells fruit to buy goods for their other needs. 

She is asking a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. The loan will be a big help in increasing her yield. In this way, she could pay the school and book fees her children need.

CEVI gives Emee credit assistance for her farm business. They provide training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase potassium and urea fertilizers.

loans.name: Abner

texts.en:
Abner E. is a rice farmer. He started his business using a 2-hectare lot rented from his friend, Vicente Cabal, in their village. He is 38 years old and has 6 children. His life is on the farm. His parents taught him everything about how to plant rice and have a good harvest. Abner uses his harvest for family consumption. When he has extra rice he sells some of it to traders in their village.

He is asking for a loan of Php 11,00 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for his farm. He dreams of having his own farm some day. In this way, he could keep all the harvest for his family. The loan will help Abner increase his yield.

CEVI provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to all their clients. With these services, CEVI believes they have played an important part in society by improving people's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita O. grows rice for a living. She is 49 years old and has no children. She has always been a farmer.  Her parents grow rice too and the knowledge of farming was passed on to her and her siblings. Her husband is the one who manages their farm. Together, they grow rice to support their family's needs. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 11,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer. She is also interested in finding some other possible areas of income. In this way, she too could contribute to the family income.

CEVI provides their clients with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage. Because of these, CEVI believes that they have done important work in the society by improving people's lives.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Becky

texts.en:
Becky B. is a rice farmer. She has 2 hectares of land that provide enough harvest for the entire family. She is 45 years old and her husband, Artemio B., manages their farm. Usually every time they harvest rice they save some rice for family use and sell the rest to rice traders in their village. Because of her farm, she is able to pay the tuition fees and other book needs of her children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 9,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. In this way, she will be able to increase her yield and give more support to her children.

CEVI provides all their clients with credit assistance to maintain their business. They also give training and insurance coverage services. With these, CEVI believes, it has played an important role in society by improving people's lives.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of ammonium sulfate and other fertilizer

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru: Баротов Толиб 1965 года рождения , женат имеет  2 детей.  Семь лет торгует  на уличном  рынке мужской обувью.  Сотрудничает с Микроинвест с 2005 года.  Жена домохозяйка, поэтому помогает ему в торговле , когда Толиб уезжает за товаром  в другой город.
texts.en:
Born in 1965, Tolib B. is married and has 2 children. He has been selling men’s shoes at a street market for seven years. He also has been working with MicroInvest since 2005. Tolib’s wife is a homemaker and helps him with the business whenever he travels to a different city for goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Muyassarhon

texts.ru:
Ахмадова Муяссархон  1971 года рождения, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Первый кредит получила  прошлому году на животноводство. Дома содержит коров,  после откорма ее муж продает на рынке. Получившее молоко от коровы, также имеет хорошую прибыль, потому что идет на продажу, а также кисломолочные изделия. 
Муяссар сотрудничает с Микроинвест  1 год. Планирует продолжать сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Born in 1971, Muyassarhon A. is married and has 4 children. She received her first credit for animal husbandry last year. She raises cattle at home, and then, her husband sells them at a market. Milk and other dairy products also bring a good profit when these products are sold. Muyassarhon has been working with MicroInvest for 1 year and plans to continue the partnership.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.ru: Рахимжон Тангриев 1968 года рождения, женат имеет 3 детей. Жена домохозяйка, помогает по уходу за скотом. Дома и на даче есть коровы и бычки. На дачу ездит жена и ухаживает за скотом. Когда необходимо посылают детей отвозить корм или еще за чем либо. Сам Рахимжон кроме откорма скота и работает фермером в колхозе, но зарплату получает не деньгами а продуктами. С Микроинвест сотрудничает  около года. В дальнейшем планирует расширить свой коровник.
texts.en:
Born in 1968, Rahimjon T. is married and has 3 children. His wife is a homemaker and helps to care for livestock. They have cows and bulls at home and at the dacha (farmhouse). The wife travels to the dacha and takes care of the livestock there. When necessary, they send the children to bring livestock feed or to run other errands. Besides raising livestock, Rahimjon works as a farmer at a collective farm, but receives salary in food products, not money. He has been working with MicroInvest for about a year. He plans to expand his business in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Chheng's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of three people. Its leader, Mrs. P., 44, makes a daily income by cultivating rice and some fruit out of her house, earning approximately US$ 2 per day. To help with the family's food needs, P.'s husband works on a construction site and earns around US$ 4 a day. The couple has given birth to four children who are single; two of them are students and the other are employed. The family faces a problem; they are too tired and must take a taxi to work frequently. Thus, P. is asking for a loan to buy a used motorcycle to ride.

The other two borrowers are:

P., 54, who is a widow and a farmer; she's applying for a loan to buy more kinds of fruit to sell to earn a living; and

S., 40, a widow and a farmer who is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to sell.

The borrowers are people living in Battambang Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for riding

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.ru: Абдумажид Хайдаркулов  1968 года рождения, женат имеет 4 детей.  С Микроинвест  сотрудничает около года. Бизнес откорм скота, и продажа молока и молочных изделий. Кроме откорма скота он бригадир  в сельском колхозе . В будущем после плодотворной работы и хорошего дохода, планирует продолжить сотрудничать с Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Born in 1968, Adbumajid H. is married and has 4 children. He has been working with MicroInvest for about one year. His business is raising livestock and selling milk and dairy products. Besides his livestock business, Adbumajid is a foreman at a collective farm. In the future, after productive work and good profits, he plans to continue working with MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru: Мунавар Боишева женщина в возрасте 25 лет имеет двоих детей, муж работает электриком.Его доход на хватает на прожиточный минимум.Сама Мунавар занимается продажей козьей шерсти , дохох чего хватает лишь для ежедневных мелочных расходов( покупка хлеба,масла,мыла и.т.д.)Поэтому Мунавар вместе с мужем занимаются откормом и продажей скота.Сейчас у них 7 баранов.Мунавар решила получив займ прикупить ещё несколько баранов.
texts.en:
Munavar B. is 25 years old and has two children. Her husband works as an electrician, however his income does not even provide for an adequate living. Munavar sells goat wool, profits from which are enough only for minor daily expenses (buying bread, butter, soap, etc.). This is why Munavar and her husband are also in the business of raising and selling livestock. They currently have 7 rams. Munavar decided to obtain this loan to purchase additional rams.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо Хайдаркулова  1968 года рождения, замужем, имеет 4 детей. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2008 года. Кредит получает для откорма скота. В настоящий момент сезон покупки скота, на рынке скот дешевый, она купит и продаст через 3 месяца дороже. В продаже и покупки скота  помогает муж и дети. Зебо благодарна КИВА и Микроинвест, за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Zebo H. was born in 1968, is married and has 4 children. She has partnered with MicroInvest since 2008. She gets loans for raising livestock. At this moment is the season for purchasing livestock, at the market livestock is cheap, she will purchase it and resell it in 3 months at a more expensive price. Her husband and children help her in the sale and purchase of livestock. Zebo is grateful to KIVA and MicroInvest for their help and support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Qadseya

texts.en:
Qadseya lives in Kabul Afghanistan. She is married and has 7 children.  She is requesting  a loan for her husband's  general store. He wants to make his business larger and he needs more money for his business to increase his stock.
He has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for a term of 11 months.
Qadseya is very happy about the loan process in Afghanistan because it provides a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials and complete the stock for her husband's shop

loans.name: Shavkatjon

texts.ru: Шавкат Рахимбаев 1968 года рождения , женат имеет 2 детей. Жена домохозяйка, Сам он продает новые диски на большом рынке. Кредит получает в первые, обратился в Микроинвест по совету друзей и соседей по магазину. Понравились условия кредитования и решил получить кредит.В дальнейшем планирует сотрудничать, если получит хороший доход.
texts.en:
Shavkatjon R. was born in 1968, is married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. Shavkatjon sells new CDs at a big market. This is his first loan. He turned to MicroInvest based on advice from friends and neighbors of his store. He liked the credit terms and decided to take out a loan. In the future he plans to continue the partnership, if he makes a good profit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sulasmi

texts.id:
Begitu ulet dan tekunya Ni Nengah sulasmi dalam beternak sapi. Sapi sapi peliharaanya sangat gemuk dan sehat , Induk sapi  yang di pelihara kini telah punya anak  namun belum bisa di jual karena umurnya masih kecil .Untuk mendapatkan hasil  Ni Nengah Sulasmi harus bersabar menunggu dua/tiga bulan lagi hingga anak sapi itu siap di pasarkan . Meskipun begitu Ni Nengah Sulasmi sangat antusias bahkan dia kini menambah peliharaan sapinya dengan jenis pejantan yang di perolehnya dengan sistem bagi hasil ( Memelihara sapi orang ) .Hampir separuh waktu yang di miliki oleh Ni Nengah Sulasmi di habiskan untuk mengurus ternak sapi dan juga babi yang di miliki. Untunglah saat ini Dia Di Bantu oleh Putra Sulungnya yang sering membatu menyabit rumput karena telah menyelesaikan pendidikan tingkat SMU Nya. Kelangsungan Hidup keluarga Ni nengah Sulasmi Sangat Tergantung Pada Hasil Pertanian Dan Peternakan terutama ternak Sapi dan Babi.Sedangkan Suaminya mengerjakan tanah pertanian dan kadang –kadang ber buruh serabutan.     
Ni Nengah Sulasmi kini berencana membeli satu ekor Sapi pejantan lagi yang akan di gemukkan dengan harapan 5- 6 bulan kedepan dapat dijual , untuk itu Ni nengah Sulasmi Mengharapkan pinjaman lagi untuk tahap yang kedua dari Kiva Melalui Yayasan Dinari. Ini Merupakan harapan satu-satunya yang  bisa menunjang perekonomian keluarganya, mengingat biaya kebutuhan sehari-harinya semakin banyak karena kedua orang anaknya sangat membutuhkan Biaya untuk melanjutkan Pendidikannya
texts.en:
Ni Nengah Sulasmi is very diligent in farming her cows so that they are healthy and plump. Her breeding cow has produced two offspring that is not ready to be sold yet. To reap the reward, Ni Nengah Sulasmi needs to wait patiently for another 2 or 3 months for the little cows to mature and ready to be marketed. However, Ni Nengah Sulasmi is very enthusiastic about her business that she bought a share of a male cow to increase her farm's production. Most of Sulasmi's time is spent on farming her cows and pigs. She is fortunate that her eldest son that just finished high school starts helping in the farm by procuring grass for feeds. Ni Nengah Sulasmi's livelihood is dependent on her far,. Her husband works as a contract labor without steady income. Ni Nengah Sulasmi is planning to purchase a male cow that she plans to farm for 5-6 month to maturity and then sell for profit. So she is applying for a second loan from Kiva and Dinari for this purpose. She is very hopeful that the improving the farm's profitability may help her family's economic situation, especially with growing daily expenses and her 2 children needs fund to continue their education.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Ni Ketut Soli

texts.id: Kerja keras Ni Ketut Soli sebagai petani kakao belum memperoleh hasil yang maksimal .Tanaman kakao yang di kelola Ni Ketut Soli bersama Tamayana suaminya masih mengalami kendala berupa penyakit/ hama sehingga buah coklat yang seharusnya menghasilkan buah yang baik hampir 60 % mengalami gagal panen . Buah kakao mengalami penyakit yang oleh petani di bali dikenal dengan penyakit kanker.yang disebabkan oleh suatu hama yaitu lalat Buah . Meskipun begitu Ni Ketut Soli Dan Suami Tak Menyerah begitu saja karena dari hasil pertanian ini lah satu-satunya yang menjadi tumpuan kehidupan keluarga ini. Berbagi Upaya akan dilakukan Oleh Ni Ketut soli Dan Suami untuk dapat meningkatkan hasil termasuk dengan penyemprotan dengan anti hama dan pemupukan yang Rotin . Untuk itulah Ni Ketut Soli Sangat berharap mendapat pinjaman lagi dari Kiva Melalui Yayasan Dinari yang akan di pergunakan untuk membiayai perawatan tanaman Kakaunya. Membeli Obat-obatan  anti hama menjadi Prioritas sehingga setiap 2 minggu sekali bisa melakukan penyemprotan.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Soli's hard work as cocoa farmer has not reached its full potential yet. They are experiencing a 60% failed harvest as many of their cocoa trees are plagued with diseases this year. Cocoa trees in Bali area are experiencing diseases called "cancer" by local farmers. The disease is caused by fruit flies infestation.

However, Ni Ketut Soli and her husband are not giving up, as she depends on the farm for her livelihood. She is exploring all options to improve her farm, including increased insecticide and fertilizer treatments. She is applying for a second loan from Kiva for this purpose. It is her priority to purchase insecticide as soon as possible to start biweekly treatment on her farm.


Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase insectiside and fertilizer

loans.name: Khaitboy

texts.en:
Khaitboy A. is an active 56-year-old. He is a talented farmer, and his crops are sought after by many local women who would like to sell them. The income he earns from this business allows him to take care of his large family of 2 children, his parents, and his wife. He would like to increase his harvest in order to maximize his income, and to do so he needs to buy fertilizer, fuel, and lubricants. As he lacks the financial means to do so, Khaitboy is requesting a loan of $ 1000 USD to help him with this purchase.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer, fuel, and lubricants for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Ni Nengah Juni Astuti

texts.id: Setelah Mendapat pinjaman tahap pertama, warung kecil di depan rumah milik Ni Ngh juni astuti kian berkembang. Hal itu tak lepas  karena makin berpariasinya barang dagangan yang di jual. Disamping juga karena keramahan Ni Nengah Juni Astuti dalam melayani setiap pembeli yang datang dan berbelanja di warungnya.Meski lokasinya yang jauh dari perkotaan tak menjadikannya kendala dalam menjalani usaha ini justru sebaliknya merupakan peluang yang sangat bagus untuk meraih keuntungan. Dalam sehari yaitu mulai pukul 07.00 pagi Ni Nengah Juni Astuti membuka warungnya dan tutup pada pukul 18.00  keuntungan yang di peroleh semakin meningkat yaitu kisaran Rp. 35.000.- s/d 50.000 . Hal inilah yang membuat Ni nengah Juni astuti lebih semangat dalam mengembangkan warungnya dan Dia memerlukan tambahan modal lagi untuk tahap ke dua yang akan di pergunakan untuk membeli berbagi jenis barang dagangan lain yang belum tersedia di warungnya..Dengan tambahan modal ini Ni Nengah Juni Astuti lebih optimis hasil yang di dapat akan semakin bertambah sehingga bisa menunjang perekonomian keluarga dan biaya seorang anak nya yang masih balita.
texts.en:
Ni Nengah Juni Astuti's small food kiosk grew as result of her first loan from Kiva. She managed to increase the variety of her offerings. However, her success is also a result of Ni Nengah Juni Astuti's warm service to clients. Despite being far away from the nearest town, she still managed to grow the business. She starts opening her kiosk at 7 am each day and closes it at 6 pm. She makes about $3 to 4 profit each day. This makes her more motivated in growing her kiosk. She is seeking additional capital to increase the variety of her offering. With this funding, Ni Nengah Juni Astuti is optimistic that she can grow the business even more to support her family's economic condition and support her infant child.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Turgun

texts.en:
Turgun B. is 50 years old. He is married with four children. From the time he was young, Turgun was learning to work in a small business with his parents. With a lot of sacrifice, he became a main producer in agriculture in the area where he lived. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more. His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children, and see them as professional, ethical, and hard-working adults. For this reason he is asking for a loan of $ 1000 USD for purchasing cattle. Be an important part of the growth of Turgun’s business!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.en:
Zulkhumor E. is 38 years old. She is married and uses all the money she makes to care for her 4 children and provide for their education. Zulkhumor has an experience of 2 years preparing and selling dried apricots. She always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her.

Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today Zulkhumor requests 650 USD for a term of 9 months. She is going to spend the loan purchasing dried apricots with the purpose of processing them in order to increase the range of her goods. Zulkhumor expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots in order to increase the range of goods she has to offer

loans.name: Ni Luh Sutami

texts.id: Kerja keras Ni luh Sutami dalam beternak sapi. Kini telah mendatangkan hasil 2 Ekor induk sapi yang di peliharanya kini telah beranak , namun masih kecil kecil (3 bulan ) jadi belum bisa untuk dijual .Namun begitu semangat kerja dan optimisme yang di miliki oleh Niluh Sutami semakin besar . Dia sangat yakin 2 sampai 3 bulan kedepan nanti anak-anak sapinya Sudah bisa dijual dan hasilnya pun cukup lumayan . Untuk rencana kedepannya Ni luh Sutami berencana menambah satu ekor induk sapi lagi apalagi saat ini lagi musim hujan , rumput-rumput tumbuh dengan subur sehingga mempermudah Niluh Sutami untuk menyabit. Untuk Mewujudkan rencananya itu Ni Luh Sutami memerlukan pinjaman dana lagi yang akan di pergunakan untuk membeli induk sapi.Dengan tambahan satu ekor induk lagi , Niluh Sutami sangat berhap hasil yang akan di dapat semakin baik , karena hanya dari beternak sapi inilah kelangsungan hidup keluarganya di gantungkan.. .
texts.en:
Ni Luh Sutami works very hard farming her cows. Currently 2 of her mature cows have produced offsprings. However, since they are still too young (3 months), they are not ready to be sold yet. However, Ni Luh Sutami has developed strong work ethic and motivation. She is optimistic that in 2 -3 months, the little cows can be sold for satisfactory profit. She plans to purchase another breeding cow to take advantage of growing abundance of grass for feeding in the monsoon season. She is seeking additional funding to realize that plan. Ni Luh Sutami is hoping that with the additional breeder, she can increase the production of her farm, as it is the main source of her family's income.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy female cow

loans.name: Djura

texts.en:
Djura H. is 44 years old. She is married and has four children. Her family lives in Isfara, Northern Tajikistan. Djura sells clothes for children at the market. Djura has been in this business for many years. She has proven to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. Djura is hoping to take a loan of 800 USD to increase the variety of inventory in her store and keep her business running successfully. She promises to fulfill the loan term within 5 months. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the education expenses of her children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing her working capital with the purpose of business development

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat K.  is 33 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Shahodat started her business because she needed extra income to be able to pay for household and personal expenses, and she also needed her own income in order to afford her home. She began 6 years ago selling clothing for kids and shoes. As she had always liked sales, it went well after the business was started, and she has continued selling clothing since then. With the purpose of expanding her business, she is requesting a loan of 600 USD, which she is promising to repay over 9 months. This way, Shahodat hopes to earn more and to meet her children’s expenses.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for her business

loans.name: Zohidboy

texts.en:
Zohidboy M. lives in the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children. Zohidboy is a fixed-run taxi driver and he works between Khujand and B. Gafurov. It is hard work so he starts working early in the morning and comes back late in the evening. His oldest son helps him and works as controller.

Today Zohidboy rents the fixed-run taxi and he has to make the rent payment. It is not profitable for him so he has a low income and has to work very hard. Zohidboy is applying to KIVA requesting financial support in the form of a business development loan of 4100 STJ for 4 months to purchase a fixed-run taxi. He thanks KIVA for its support and help to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase a fixed-run taxi

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат женщина 33 лет , замужем имеет троих детей.Муж имеет свой бизнес,ларек по продаже продуктов питания.Малохат имеет две коровы которые дают молоко.У Малохат соседи покупают молоко и домашний кефир.Подруга Малохат посоветовала ей взять в кредит ещё две коровы.С которых она будет получать ещё дополнительное молоко.Для чего Малохат и обратилась в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Malohat is a 33 year old woman, she is married and has 3 children. Her husband has his own business – a kiosk selling food products. Malohat owns two cows that produce milk. Malohat’s neighbors purchase her milk and homemade kefir (yogurt). Malohat’s friend recommended that she take out a loan to purchase two more cows, from which she can get additional milk. For this, Malohat turned to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two cows

loans.name: Abdurakip

texts.en:
Abdurakip M. is 40 years old. He is married with four children, and the eldest is in second grade. Abdurakip comes from a very humble family. Starting from a young age, Abdurakip worked with his parents beginning early in the morning, to produce cottonseed oil. Now, Abdurakip works with his children in their oil-producing business.

On average he produces 15-20 liters oil which costs 4 USD per liter. Now Abdurakip hopes to increase their oil sales in order for their business to advance further. He is in need of this loan in order to expand his business and speed up their production and improve the quality of their products.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Expanding the family business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan R. is 41 years old. He and his wife, who is a housewife, are raising three children. For more than 15 years, Hasan has been repairing furniture. At the same time he is involved in producing office furniture for sale. Over these years, Hasan has become a real expert in his business. Since Hasan has a lot of customers, the business is very successful and brings in a stable and significant income, allowing Hasan to improve the living conditions of his family.

Today Hasan is requesting 1000 US Dollars for purchasing planks, glue, nails, screws and a lathe for production and repair of furniture. Hasan would to thank all supporting him and ensure everyone that he will repay the loan in 12 months.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing planks, glue, nails, screws and a lathe for production and repair of furniture

loans.name: Mansurboy

texts.en:
Mansurboy S. has got a mini-van and provides transportation. His usual itinerary is the Isfara-Khujand-Isfara route. Having been in this business for 2 years, he has gained much experience. The business is stable and generates the main income for Mansurboy’s family, allowing them to improve their living conditions. Currently his mini-van needs some repairs. That’s why he needs a loan of 800 USD for purchasing spare parts for his car. Mansurboy thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in 9 months with accuracy. The well-being of this family is in your hands!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: Purchasing spare parts to repair his mini-van.

loans.name: Nozim

texts.en:
“Responsible fatherhood” is a term that has been converted into concrete fact in Nozim’s life. He has always responded satisfactorily to his role as provider for his two children, for whom he cares with much love, in the company of his wife, who is always supportive of him.

Nozim works in agriculture and has some cattle. He cultivates potatoes, onions, carrots and other vegetables, subject to the season. At the moment, he is working intensively at his agricultural activities and taking care of his fields. His wife is helping take care of the cows and also sells their milk.

They do all this hard work because they want to give an education to each of their two children. They would also like to open a small business some day; until then they will continue working in their fields. To do this successfully, Nozim is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. Let’s support Nozim in his continuous efforts to provide for the well-being of his family!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: Purchasing  seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.en:
Ibrohim B. has been an active client of our loan progarmme since 2002. Ibrohim started his business practically from zero and, thanks to previous loans, he was able to build a profitable business. He is married and has 3 children.

Ibrohim is engaged in bringing in flour from Uzbekistan for re-sale, and he works also with direct suppliers. He has his own outlet selling flour. Ibrohim wants to import flour on a large scale to increase his business income so it is the best time for flour-selling. Ibrohim is asking KIVA for financial support in the form of a business support loan of 4100 STJ for 12 months. He thanks KIVA lenders for their support.

loans.use: large-scale flour selling

loans.name: Mukima

texts.en:
Mukima Y. is 41 years old. She works purchasing and re-selling cows with her husband. She has three children. She would like to request a loan of 850 USD for the term of 9 months in order to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demand. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and increase their income further. She plans to use the increased income to fund her children’s education. You could become an important part in Mukima family's life; she deeply appreciates the trust and support you give her!  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand the business

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sotri

texts.id:
Setelah menyelesaikan pinjaman periode yang pertama, Ni Wayan Sotri kembali melanjutkan pinjaman periode kedua. Hal ini dilakukannya karena ia masih memerlukan dana untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Dana pinjaman dipakai untuk melanjutkan usaha dalam menjual sarana sembahyang. Saat ini dana yang didapatnya digunakan untuk membeli bahan baku pembuatan Canang dalam jumlah yang cukup banyak karena Ni Wayan Sotri mendapat pesanan dalam jumlah yang banyak. Selain untuk persembahyangan sehari – hari, juga melayani sembahyang  besar / paket Otonan dan Odalan ( upacara agama Hindu di Bali ).
            Dengan bergabungnya dengan Yayasan Dinari, Ni Nengah Sotri tidak hanya memperoleh modal dana tetapi juga memperoleh pembinaan - pembinaan yang tentunya diharapkan dapat meningkatkan pengetahuan dan usahanya.
Keuntungan  bersih dalam sehari mencapai Rp. 40.000.- s/d 50.000.- Keuntungan tersebut dipakai untuk mencukupi keperluan keluarganya, ditabung dan untuk modal usaha.

loans.use: buy bamboo, young coconut leaf and many kinds of flower

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат женщина которая серьезно относится к погашениям кредита.По окончании первого займа у Малохат увеличился скот и улучшилась жизнь семьи. Следующий займ она хочет взять для закупа корма и прикупки глов мелкорогатого скота.Ей по уходу за скотом помогает её старший сын. С уст Малохат нам стало ясно что она довольна и хочет продолжать с нами сотрудничать.
texts.en:
Malohat takes repayment of loans very seriously. At the closing of her first loan Malohat had expanded her herd and improved her family's standard of living. She wants to use the next loan to buy feed and some head of small livestock. Her oldest son helps her with care of the animals. Malohat has expressed her satisfaction to us and wants to continue to work with us.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed and sale of livestock

loans.name: Ni Komang Sriani

texts.id:
Melalui  organisasi Tempek ( sebuah organisasi adat ) yang ada didesanya, Ni  Komang Sriani mendapatkan dana dari Yayasan DINARI untuk periode ke dua. Pinjaman pertama dirasakan sangat membantu usahanya, karena ingin mengembangkan usahanya, Ni Komang Sriani mengajukan permohonan untuk mendapatkan pinjaman yang kedua.  Dana tersebut sangat berarti dalam menambah modal usaha dalam usaha jual beli hasil pertanian. Dalam sehari Ni Komang Sriani dapat membeli coklat, pisang, kelapa dan hasil kebun lainnya. Esok paginya, Ni Komang Sriani akan menjualnya barang dagangannya dipasar ataupun beberapa pelanggan yang biasa membeli darinya. Keuntungan bersih dalam setiap hari dapat mencapai Rp. 25.000.- s/d 30.000.- 
Dari Usaha seperti inilah Komang Sriani dapat menggantungkan hidupnya bersama suaminya, Darma Kantun, yang tidak bekerja dan hanya mengandalkan hasil kebunnya sendiri.
texts.en:
Ni Komang Sriani is applying for second loan from DINARI foundation and Kiva through "Tempek," a traditional agricultural organization in her village. She felt DINARi/Kiva's first loan was very helpful in growing her business. this motivated her to apply for this second loan. The funding will be used to increase her business' working capital. She trades agricultural products like chocolate, banana, coconut and other products. She sells the products she purchased from farmers the next day in the local market. She usually can earn $2-2.50 per day. This business helps her supplement income from her husband, Darma Kantun, who is unemployed. Produce from his garden is his only source of income.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more trading goods

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Mrs. Genoveva B. hails from the beautiful province of Antique. She is 53 years old, widowed, and blessed with 4 children.

She is engaged in food vending business in front of her house. She is requesting a loan amounting to P5,000 as initial capital for purchasing 3 kilos pork, 2 sacks of rice, bananas and assorted vegetables. She will pay the loan in 50 weeks. She already established this business before but it stopped because of capital constraints. This loan is very importan in order for her to realize her dream of expanding her business in the future. She hopes that her children will finish their studies.
	
She is thankful to ASHI for giving the opportunity to have capital for her business and to the Kiva lenders who will support her loan.

loans.use: Buy and sell-Food

loans.name: Ni Luh Raini

texts.id:
Ni Luh Raini sangat bersyukur ketika ia mendapatkan pinjamannya untuk yang pertama kali. Semua pinjaman itu duipergunakannya untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Pinjaman itu dipergunakan untuk membeli barang dagangan untuk melengkapi barang dagangan yang sudah ada. Kini usaha warungnya sudah lengkap dengan semua kebutuhan masyarakat sehari – hari. Hal itu berimbas dengan banyak pelanggan yang dimiliki pleh Ni Luh Raini.
            Karena usahanya makin maju, Ni Luh Raini dapat melunasi pinjamananya yang pertama dengan baik. Untuk periode kedua ini, Ni Luh Raini berencana untuk merenovasi warungnya agar lebih luas lagi. Selain itu, Ni Luh raini juga berencana untuk membeli sebuah rak kaca untuk meletakkan barang dagangannya agar kelihatan lebih rapi dan menarik. Untuk mewujudkan hal itu, Ni Luh Raini mengajukan pinjaman sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.- Ni Luh Raini berharap, semoga ia segera bisa mendapatkan pinjaman tersebut agar semua impiannya bisa terwujud.
texts.en:
Ni Luh Raini was very grateful of her first loan from Kiva/DINARI that helped her grow her business. She used the loan to purchase merchandise to increase the variety of her merchandise. Now her kiosk has more complete offering for her community's daily needs. This also increased Ni Luh Raini's client base. Due to her business' growth, she managed to successfully paid off her first loan. For this second loan, Ni Luh Raini plans to renovate and expand her kiosk. She also plans to purchase a glass rack to showcase her merchandises. To realize her plans, she is applying for $425 loan. She hopes to obtain funding in time to realize her dreams.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: renovate her kiosk and buy glass shelves

loans.name: Kuvondik

texts.ru: Кувондик парень 23 лет , женат имеет одного ребёнка,жена работает в колхозе.Сам Кувондик парень недавно закончил курсы сварщика,и теперь выходит на заказ работать сварщиком.Помимо этого он занимается бизнесом животноводства.Сейчас у него дома три коровы за которыми ухаживает его жена.Для закупа корма коров и ремонта сарая.Фото снято в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Kuvondik is 23 year old man with a wife and one child. His wife works on a collective farm. Kuvondik recentley finished welding training classes, and is now working as a contractor, doing welding. In addition he has a livestock business. He currently has three cows which his wife takes care of at their home. He would buy feed for the cattle and do repairs on the barn. The photograph was taken on the day the loan was disbursed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed and sale of livestock

loans.name: Namutebi Rose Group

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years of age. She is divorced and has four children between seven and eighteen years of age. The father of her children gives them some assistance but not enough to meet all their needs. She rents a two-roomed house and that’s where she stays with her children. She does have access to electricity but she does not have piped water; she has to fetch her water from a well. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is tuition fees and food.

Roes sells matooke (bananas) to earn a living for herself and her family and she does her business at the market. She works six days a week and sells her bananas on a retail basis. She receives about thirty customers a day and they are mainly women who buy from her.

Rose has done this particular business for over three years and prior to that she was selling fruit. The challenge she faces in her business is that it is seasonal; she only sell a lot when the university students are around since her business is located near the university.

Rose has worked with MCDT for four years now and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because she needed some capital for her business. She will use this loan to buy more bananas for sale. She wants to continue expanding her business and also be able to educate her children from the money she generates from her business.

loans.use: buy more bananas for re-sale

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur M. is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was very young, Bahodur has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family.

The desire that Bahodur harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. He requests 2500 Somoni to buy more cattle so as to expand his business. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista has been a clothes seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 13 years. She belongs to Victoria Group (group code 2053). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 175. Every day she works at her business from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothing items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Felista is 37 years old, married, and has five children: ages 14, 11, 9, 7, and 3.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
Anvar is a hard-working person, and he makes an effort to give his four beloved children the best. He decided to stay in his homeland so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals.

With experience gained over 7 years in the purchase and sale of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. He would now like to purchase cattle that can create more income for his large family. For this reason he requests 2500 Somoni. Anvar thanks you very much for your love of the less fortunate.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Рохат женщина 34 лет, замужем имеет четырёх детей. Дети учатся в школе. Она уже много лет занимается продажей детских одежд. Рохат выходит торговать каждый день на рынок «Рохи Охан» города Душанбе. У нее очень большой и разнообразный ассортимент. Закупает она товар на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. В весенний сезон Рохат хочет получить займ в сумме 10000 сомони сроком на 9 месяцев и закупить еще детских одежд.
texts.en:
Rohat is a 34 year old woman with a husband and four children. The children are in school. She has been in the business of selling children's clothing for many years. She goes to the Rohi Ohan market in Dushanbe every day to sell. Her inventory is large and varied. She buys the goods at the Korvon wholesale market in Dushanbe. Rohat would like a loan of 10000 somoni for a term of 9 months to buy more children's clothing for the spring season.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's clothing for spring

loans.name: Ni Luh Murtini

texts.id:
Melalui organisasi di desanya Ni Luh Murtini mendapakan dana dari Yayasan DINARI.  Pada periode kedua dana pinjaman itu dipergunakan untuk menambah modal dalam usaha jual beli gula merah. Pada periode pertama, Ni Luh Murtini mendapat cukup keuntungan untuk kebutuhannya dan keluarga. Saat ini ia ingin mengembangkan usahanya dengan cara membeli lebih banyak gula merah dari petani sehingga ia akan mendapat lebih banyak keuntungan. Ni Luh Murtini sangat terbantu dengan adanya pinjaman ini karena dengan  dana ini ia  dapat melanjutkan usahanya. 
Suaminya sudah beberapa lama meninggal. Saat ini Ni Luh Murtini tinggal bersama dengan kedua anaknya yang masih sekolah tingkat pertama dan tingkat dasar.
Ni Luh Murtini sangat mengantungkan hidupnya dari usaha ini sebagai sumber pendapatan dalam keluarganya. Hampir setiap hari Ni Luh Murtini dapat memperoleh keuntungan bersih sekitar Rp. 40.000.- s/d Rp. 50.000.-  yang sangat berarti dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya.
texts.en:
Through an organization in her village, Ni Luh Murtini obtained her first loan from DINARI foundation. She plans to use the second loan to increase her working capital to purchase more "red sugar." In the first period, Ni Luh Murtini obtained enough profit to fulfill her family's need. Currently she plans to expand her business by purchasing more "red sugar" from farmers so she can increase her business profitability. Ni Luh Murtini benefited tremendously from the loan as her husband has passed away. Currently Ni Luh Murtini lives with her 2 children that are studying in grade school. Ni Luh Murtini depends on this business for her livelihood. Each day, Ni Luh Murtini gains net profit of $3.20 to $4 that helps a lot in fulfilling her family's needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 23 years old, living in with her common-law husband, and blessed with a 1-year old child. They reside in Madarag Ilaures, Bugasong, Antique. Her husband is a fisherman and sometimes she helps her husband. 
	
She is requesting a loan amounting to P 5,000 and she will pay it in 50 weeks. This will be a great help in her business because it will serve as an initial capital for her poultry and hog fattening business. She will purchase 25 chickens and 1 pig she will raise.  After 4-6 months she will sell these to the meat sellers in the market.

She dreams that her life will be successful and her child will finish studies and achieve their goals in life. She likes also to have a successful business someday.  She is thankful to ASHI for giving the opportunity to have capital for her business and she also would like to thank Kiva lenders who will support her loan.

loans.use: Poultry & Hog Fattening

loans.name: Mahmadi

texts.ru:
Юлдашев Махмади в возрасте 42 года, отец четырех детей. Уже шесть лет занимается продажей зелени: начиная  от укропа, петрушки, чеснока, редиски, щавеля.… Кроме того, у него в ассортименте имеются молочные продукты. По национальности он сам узбек, живет и работает в городе Вахдат.  Покупает свои зелени  в городе Душанбе. 
Махмади хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 2000 сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahmadi U. is 42 years old and the father of four children. He has been selling leafy green vegetables for the past six years, starting out with dill, parsely, garlic, radish, and sorrel. His inventory also includes milk products. He is of Uzbek nationality, and lives and works in the city of Vahdat. He buys the vegetables in Dushanbe. Mahmadi would like to participate in Kiva and take out a loan of 2000 somoni for 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru:
Махмуджонова Рахима 1957 года рождения, замужем, имеет детей. Год назад она при помощи сестры начала свою предпринимательскую деятельность. Она торгует овощами на рынке "Рохи Охан" города Душанбе. У нее много клиентов. Каждый день с ближайших районов приезжают клиенты, чтоб закупит у нее товар. В данный момент она продает морковь, картофель, лук... 
Для увеличения ассортимента и товарооборота, Рахима хочет получить займ в сумме 1000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.

 
 
Закуп овощей.
texts.en:
Rahima M. was born in 1957, is married, and has children. A year ago she began her own business with her sister's help. She sells vegetables at the Rohi Ohan market in Dushanbe. She has many customers. Everyday customers come from the surrounding districts to buy her goods. Currently she is selling carrots, potatoes, onions, etc. To expand her selection and sales, Rahima is requesting a 1000 somoni loan with a 6-month term for purchasing vegetables.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret L., age 31, is married with no children but she is living with her sister’s daughters, ages 16 and 14. She sells charcoal and fried fish. She started these businesses 5 years ago and works daily from 8am until 9pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 369.

This will be Margaret’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to start up the fish business and has repaid the loan successfully. She now hopes for a second loan to expand her charcoal business and to buy a big bucket of cooking oil for frying fish.

Margaret belongs to Songa group. The members of her group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her charcoal stock and buy a big bucket of cooking oil

loans.name: Ni Luh Werni

texts.id:
Semenjak bergabung dengan DINARI melalui organisasi didesanya Ni Luh Werni mendapat pembinaan dan mendapat kepercayaan sehingga memperoleh pinjaman dana. Dana pinjaman dipergunakan untuk melengkapi keperluan usaha warungnya. Pinjaman pertama dipergunakannya dengan bijaksana. Dengan membeli aneka barang dagangan yang baru, Ni Luh Werni melengkapi warungnya sehingga ia mendapatkan keuntungan yang lebih banyak dari sebelumnya. Dari keuntungan itu, kini Ni Luh werni bisa memperbaiki rumahnya. Dari dinding kayu, sekarang sudah bisa berdinding bata dan ia bisa meningkatkan kesehatan keluarganya.
Pinjaman kedua akan dipergunakan untuk menambah modal usaha. Warungnya perlu direnovasi agar kelihatan lebih baik. Untuk itu, ia mengajukan pinjaman sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.-. Semua dana tersebut akan dipergunakannya untuk meningkatkan usahanya.
texts.en:
Ni Luh Werni has been receiving technical assistance from DINARI foundation to improve her business skills. The foundation saw her potential so it provided her a business loan. She used her first loan from DINARI/Kiva wisely to improve her kiosk's offering. By increasing merchandise variety, she managed to increase the profitability of her kiosk. From that additional profit, she managed to renovate her home. Ni Luh Werni's home was made of wood, now it is made of brick wall. She also improved her family's well being. She plans to used the second loan from Kiva/DINARI to add her working capital. She plans to renovate her kiosk also to make it more attractive to customer. For those purposes, she is applying for $425 loan. All the proceed will be used to improve her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcahse more merchandise and renovate kiosk

loans.name: Nanfuka Edith Group

texts.en:
Edith N. is 45 years of age. She is single and has six children ages 13 to 23 years. She rents a one room house where she stays with her children.  Her greatest expense in a month is paying the tuition fees for her children.
Edith sells charcoal to earn a living for herself and her family. She works six days a week and does her business from the market. She has about twenty customers a day.
Edith has done this kind of business for six years. 
She has been a member of MCDT for four years and she has so far received eight loans. She has worked with her group for four years and she will use this loan to increase on her stock. Edith looks forward to expanding her business.

loans.use: increase on her stock

loans.name: Nakitto Plaxeda Group

texts.en:
Plaxeda is 37 years of age she is married with four children. Aged between 14years and twenty years they are all at school.
She stays in a six roomed house with electricity but no piped water. She fetches her water from the well.
She has two meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is feeding, school fees, and transport to her work place.
She sells matooke{ bananas} in the market where she rents a room to store her bananas 
She works four days a week and she receives about 50 customers a day. She sells both on retail and wholesale.
She has done this business for fifteen years now and the challenge she finds in her business is that at times she gets accidents on the way from collecting her bananas this is because she get her bananas from the village.
She has worked with MCDT for four years now and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because she wanted some capital to put in her business 
She plans to construct a rental houses to improve on her income.

loans.use: icrease stock

loans.name: Musodjon

texts.ru:
Мирбабаев Мусоджон родился 1987 года, еще не женат, живет с родителями. Год назад он открыл лавку, где продает хозтовары. В его ассортименте имеются часы, лампочки, батарейки, щетки, лак для обуви, включатели, … Товары закупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон». Мусоджон также является мастером по ремонту мобильных телефонов и  радио-телеаппаратуры.  Теперь его знают во всей округе как мастера своего дела. Для оказания своих услуг Мусоджон часто ездит в город Душанбе, где в фирме ООО «Голубой экран» закупает запчасти. Местом его деятельности является Центральный рынок города Вахдат.
Мусоджон узнав о программе Кива решил участвовать в ней и получить займ на сумму 3000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Musodjon M. was born in 1987, he is not married yet and lives with his parents. One year ago he opened a small shop where he sells household goods. In his assortment there are clocks, light bulbs, light switches, batteries, shoeshine. He buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Korvon. Musodjon also specializes in mobile phone and radio and telephone repairs. Now he is famous in his area as a professional in this field. Musodjon often travels to the city of Dushanbe to provide his services and to buy supplies and spare parts in the firm Blue Screen. The place of his business is the Central market in the town of Vahdat.

Musodjon found out about the Kiva program and decided to participate and apply for a loan for 3000 somoni (US$825) for a six months term.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy household goods

loans.name: Jikomboe Group

texts.en:
Angel Boniface has had her own small shop in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 9 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $300. Every day she works at her business from 6:00am to 9pm.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Angel is 29 years old, married, and has two children: ages 9 and 6.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Amina, Sophia and Maria. Each woman also has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Khidirali

texts.en:
Khidirali U. is a 37-year-old cattleman who is married with three children. Owing to his father, who was a farmer, Khidirali has been associated with this business since he was young. He purchases the cattle in the local market and then he breeds and sells them. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. Every day, Khidirali gets up early in the morning in order to feed his animals. And all day, until late at night, he is busy looking after the cattle. Khidirali says that he works with only one aim in mind - to provide his children with proper education. Now, Khidirali would like to expand his business and purchase two cows. For this purpose, he has applied for 2000 Somoni and with your help he hopes to reach his aim. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key place along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  cattle to expand his business.

loans.name: Masay Group

texts.en:
Consolatha has been a clothes seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business from 8am to 6pm.  Consolatha  is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Consolatha is 27 years old, married, and has two children: ages 10 and 4. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwanaidi and Asia. Each woman also has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima Baji is the wife of M. A. , who has had a clothes selling business for the past 10 years. Her husband has a variety of garments for both ladies and gentleman. Fatima Baji owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 12 years. Fatima Baji is the mother of seven children: six sons and one daughter. All of her children are getting an education. Fatima Baji and her husband are working really hard to give their children a better future. Fatima Baji makes sweets at home and sells them in the community, where the kids enjoy them. She successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her husband’s clothes selling business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
She is (Leah Barcelo V.) is 34 years old resident of Bugasong, Antique. She was married to a barangay Tanod and blessed with 1 child. They are happy with each other that’s why they wanted to established a business.

	She received her P 5,000.00 as initial capital to establish her buy and sell of rice and feeds. This capital will use to purchase sacks of rice and sacks of feeds to sustain the needs of her customer in the barangay.

       She dreams that this project will expand and will be successful in the future for the studies of her children. She's been dreaming for a good and sustainable life.

      She is thankful to ASHI for giving the opportunity to have capital.

loans.use: purchasing of 3 sacks of rice and 2 sacks of feeds

loans.name: Karima

texts.ru:
Мамасолиева Карима молодая, но уже преуспевающая предприниматель. Она родилась 1978 года, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Занимается продажей верхней одежды на рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. У нее 4 года опыта в этой деятельности и начала бизнес со своей подругой.  В его ассортименте большой выбор одежды для молодого поколения.  Она продает пальто, дубленки, кожаные плащи и головные уборы. Закупает она товар на оптовом рынке «Корвон», иногда заказывает поставщикам из Бишкека. 
Карима хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 5000 сомони для закупа женских пальто.
texts.en:
Karima M. is young, but she is already a successful entrepreneur. She was born in 1978, is married and has 2 children. She sells outer clothing at the Korvon market in Dushanbe. She has 4 years of experience in this area and she started the business with her friend. Her product assortment includes a large selection of clothing for the young generation. She sells coats, shearling coats, leather coats and hats. She purchases her products at the wholesale market Korvon and sometimes orders from Bishkek suppliers. Karima would like to participate in the KIVA program and to take out a loan of 5000 somoni for the purchase of women’s coats.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase women's coats

loans.name: Namubiru Amina Group

texts.en:
Amina is twenty years of age and married with one child who is two years old. She rents a one-roomed house where she lives with her husband and child. She has three meals a day and her greatest monthly expense in a month is food, since she has to buy everything they eat at home.

She has a retail shop that she rents and where she works seven days a week selling bananas. She receives about 20 customers a day she has done this kind of business for over six years now. Her main challenge is transportation since she buys the bananas from the village and has to transport them to town where she sells them.

She has worked with MCDT for two years now. The reason she chose to work with MCDT is because she wanted some capital to put in her business. She has worked with her group for two years and her goal right now is to have a successful business to be able to sustain her family.

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem Baji is the wife of A. L. and has resided in a city named Kot Radha Kishan for the past 21 years. Her husband is involved in a spice-selling business. He packs spices in small plastic packets and sells each packet for Pak Rs.5.

Naseem Baji is the mother of two daughters. Both of her daughters are getting an education from a local school. Naseem Baji is a very hardworking lady. She gets up early and do all the household work and then she milks her buffalo and goes to the milk shops to sell it. She sells milk to pay the school fees of her daughters. She successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy spices for her husband.

loans.use: To buy spices for selling

loans.name: Asrop

texts.id:
Asrop sudah terbiasa bangun pagi hari untuk mempersiapkan barang –barang yang menjadi dagangannya.
