Memasak nasi,sayur dan aneka lauk-pauk untuk berjualan dipasar pagi .kemudian bergegas menuju kepasar Jembrana dengan menbawa sepedaa motonya.Asrop biasa berjualan nasi bungkus di pasar pada pukul 5.00 sedang pulang dari jualan setelah barang dagangan sudah habis terjual,biasanya pada pukul 9.00 wita juga sudah ada dirumah untuk membatu kesibukan istrinya yang mempunyai usaha warung kecil dirumahnya.

Yang menjadi pelanggan warung nasi Asrop di pasar jembrana adalah sesama pedagang yang biasa berjualan bersama dipasar.
Setelah dapat melunasi pada pinjaman terdahulu kemudian Asrop kembali melanjutakan pinjamannya.Yayasan DINARI masih tetap melayani pinjaman sepanjang masih memerlukan dana untuk keperluan usaha warungnya. Dari hasil keuntungan usahanya Asrop dapat membiayai anaknya terakhinya yang sudah sekolah pada tingkat atas.
texts.en:
Asrop is used to getting up early to prepare goods for his trade. Cooking rice, vegetables and a variety of side dishes to be sold in the morning market then hurry to the market Jembrana using a motorcycle. Asrop usually sells wrapped rice in the market from 5 and return after having sold all his goods usually at 9, then back home to help his wife with the small stall at home. The customers of Asrop rice stall in the market Jembrana are his fellow regular traders in the market. After repaying the earlier loan Asrop once again continue her loan. DINARI foundation is still providing loan during the period when funding is required for his stall business. From the profit Asrop is able to pay for his youngest child’s education, now in high school.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: be the capital

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia Baji is 33 years old, married, and a citizen of a city named Kot Radha Kishan for the past 15 years. She owns a two-room brick house and lives in it with her family. Razia Baji is the mother of six children: five sons and one daughter. None of her children does anything. Razia Baji is married to N. A., a fruit seller by profession. He sells fruit on his cart by going to different areas of Kot Radha Kishan.

Razia Baji is a very caring and supportive lady. She is totally aware of the present economic situations and for that reason she started a sewing business. She takes order from her neighbors and her relatives and charges them $2 for per order. She saves some part of her income in a committee and used the other amount to pay off the education expenses of her daughters. She successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Paksitan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits for her husband’s fruit selling business.

loans.use: To buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Mrs Imelda I. hails from beautiful province of Antique. She is 37 years old, married to a fisherman, and blessed with 2 children. 

She is engaged in fish vending.  She sells the fish catch of her husband and buys more fish for sale from other fishermen as well. She requested a loan amounting to P 5,000 that she will be use to purchase 3 basin (100 kls. per basin) of fish. 

From the start they have good life and with their good business it may be the beginning of much better life.  She dreams that she will have better fishing gadgets in the future. She likes to raise her children in good values, send to school and to have a comfortable house they own.

She wants to thank ASHI for giving the poor an opportunity to have capital for the business. She also would like to thank Kiva lenders who will support her loan.

loans.use: To purchase 3 basin of fish

loans.name: Ni Komang Partini

texts.id: Biarpun sebagai istri seorang Guru, Komang Partini,sangat ulet bekerja, Partini membuka usaha kantin disekolahnya,dan juga membuka usaha warung dirumahnya.Partini ikut bergabung di Dinari masuk kelompok KWT Teratai Mekar sudah dua kali periode dan pelunasan di akhir periode. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,-, Partini menjual bermacam-macam barang dagangan, seperti jajan,nasi,buah-buahan,minuman dan lain-lain. Untuk dikantin sekolahnya Partini bergiliran dalam berdagang dengan istri-istri guru yang lain. Dalam satu bulan,Partini mendapat giliran berdagang sebanyak 1 minggu ,Partini mulai berjualan dari pagi hari sampai siang hari,selanjutnya Partini berdagang dirumahnya sampai sore hari dirumahnya Partini juga menyediakan bermacam-macam barang dagangan seperti makanan,minuman,soto,lontong dan lain-lain,juga dedak,konsendrat untuk babinya disediakan dirumahnya . Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.60.000,- perbulan. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya karena kedua anaknya sudah bekerja dan yang paling besar sudah menikah dan tinggal di Jawa. Rumahnya sudah diperbaiki dan sudah permanen.Dibangun sendiri ditanah mertuanya dan hidup berdekatan dengan semua keluarganya. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari,usahanya semakin maju dan berkembang.
texts.en:
Although a wife of a teacher, Komang Partini is willing to work, Partini runs a canteen in her husband’s school, and also operate a stall at home. Partini participate in Dinari joining KWT Teratai Mekar twice and repaid at the end of the period. With initial loan of Rp.1.000.000,- (about USD100), Partini sells a variety of goods, like snacks, rice, fruits, drinks and others. For the school canteen operation, Partini rotates it amongst the wives of other teachers. In a month, Partini gets to operate the school canteen for a week; Partini begins selling from the morning until early afternoon, after that Partini operates her stall at home until evening. Partini also prepares a variety of food, drinks, soups, cooked rice and others; also pig’s feed is prepared in the house. Profit attained amount to Rp.60.000,- (about USD6) per month. This profit is used to subsidize the family’s expenses as her 2 children is already working; the elder already married. And living in Jawa. Her house has been renovated and is permanent, self-built on the in-laws’ property and living close to relatives. Her hope is with this loan from Dinari, her business will advance and expand.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: be the capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Ni Komang Yudi Artini

texts.id: Hidup di desa membuat Komang Yudi Artini yang bekerja sebagai Guru TK juga mempunyai usaha sampingan yaitu beternak babi.Yudi sudah bergabung dengan Dinari sudah dua kali periode di kelompok KWT Teratai Mekar  dan pelunasan dilakukan diakhir periode.Setelah melunasi pinjaman yang pertama dengan penjualan babi , Yudi kembali meminjam di Dinari dan kembali membeli bibit babi 4 ekor, harga perekor Rp 350.000  Dengan modal Rp.1.400.000,-,Yudi memelihara babi  dibelakang rumahnya. Harga pakan yang mahal,membuat Yudi juga kebingungan dalam mencari modal,dengan bantuan Dinari ,Yudi bisa membeli pakan dan juga beberapa ekor bibit babi lagi. Yudi memberi makan babinya 2x sehari pada pagi dan sore hari,kandangnya juga dibersihkan sampai bersih, sebelum Yudi memberi makan ternaknya. Keuntungan yang diperoleh perekor Rp.80.000,- . Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga untuk biaya pendidikan anaknya yang duduk dikelas 5 SD. Anaknya yang pertama seharusnya kelas 3 SMA,tetapi karena kecelakaan,sudah meninggal 2 tahun yang lalu. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diberikan oleh Dinari usahanya semakin meningkat.
texts.en:
Living in the village urged Komang Yudi Artini who works as a teacher to have a side effort in rearing pigs. Yudi already worked with Dinari twice with KWT Teratai Mekar and settled at the end of the period. After repaying the first loan with the proceeds from the sale of the pigs, Yudi once again loan from Dinari and once again purchased 4 piglets, costing Rp.350.000,- (about USD35) each, with the funding Rp.1.400.000,- (about USD140). Yudi rears the pigs behind her house. The cost of feed is expensive causing Yudi to revert to obtain funding from Dinari, Yudi is able to purchase feed and several more piglets. Yudi feeds the pigs twice a day in the morning and late afternoon; the pigpen is also cleaned, before Yudi gives the feed. Profit from each pig is Rp.80.000,- (about USD8). This profit is used to support her livelihood and also cover her child’s education expenses currently in grade 5. Her first child would have been in grade 8 but due to misfortune, passed away 2 years ago. Her hope, with this loan from Dinari her effort will continue to be successful.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and it's feed

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sudarni

texts.id: Ketut Sudarni,seorang ibu yang ulet bekerja, untuk membantu suaminya I Gede Suparmita yang berpropesi sebagai dagang, Sudarni juga memelihara babi dirumahnya,yaitu babi penggemukan.Sudarni sudah dua kali periode ikut bergabung dengan Dinari, Sudarni masuk di kelompok KWT Teratai Mekar dan pelunasan di akhir periode. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.050.000,-,Sudarni membeli 3 ekor bibit babi,dan sekarang babinya sudah besar besar dan dipelihara untuk penggemukan .babi-babinya siap dijual dengan harga perekor dari Rp.800.000,--Rp.1.000.000,-. Sudarni memberi makan babinya 2x sehari,disamping dedak dan konsendrat, Sudarni juga memberikan makanan tambahan,seperti daun talas,daun pisang,batang pisang,dan lain-lain. Keuntungan yang diperoleh perekor Rp.80.000,-, keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya ,juga untuk pendidikan kedua anaknya yang duduk dikelas 5 SD dan 1 SD. Dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari,Sudarni akan membeli beberapa ekor bibit babi lagi dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan. Rumahnya dibangun sendiri dengan bangunan yang semi permanen.
texts.en:
Ketut Sudarni, a mother who is willing to work, to assist her husband I Gede Suparmita whose profession is a trader/merchant. Sudarni also rear pigs at home, pigs to be fattened. Sudarni had already participated in DINARI twice; Sudarni joined the KWT Teratai Mekar group and settled at the end of the period. With an initial capital of Rp.1.050.000,- (about USD100), Sudarni purchased 3 piglets, and the piglets has now grown and is fed to be fattened, these pigs can then be sold be between Rp.800.000,- to Rp.1.000.000,- (USD80 to 100). Sudarni feeds the pigs twice a day, besides feed and antibiotics, Sudarni also give additional food like taro and banana leaves and others. Profit earned each pig can be Rp.80.000,- (USD8), this profit will be used for the family’s expenses, also to pay for the two children’s education, in the 5th and 1st grade. With this loan from DINARI, Sudarni will buy several piglets again and the balance for payment of supplies. Her house is self-built using semi-permanent materials.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglet's and it's feeds

loans.name: Moul's Group

texts.en:
This loan is being requested by eight borrowers, all of whom are people living in BattambA. Province, Cambodia. The group leader, Mr. S., age 41, who is a Cambodia military policeman, gets a salary of $75 a month. He si married with three children who are still single. His wife's name is Soeum, 39, and she currently earns a living selling local vegetables in the market. S. is asking for a loan for his wife to use as capital to expand their business selling vegetables.

The other seven members who joined the loan are:

S. A. is a military policemen and he requests a loan to cultivate his rice crop.

P. is a rice farmer and she needs a loan for rice growing.

P. is a local rice planter and she asks for a loan to replace her old motorcycle.

S. sells groceries from home and she wants a loan to enlarge her business.

S. is a cultivator and she is applying for a loan to build a stall for raising chickens.

S. is a fish seller and she is requesting a loan to build a cow stall.

S. is a bean grower and she has applied for a loan for her business activities.

loans.use: To expand their business selling vegetable

loans.name: Muminshoh

texts.ru:
В нашей стране застолье не обходиться без лепешки. И поэтому этот продукт является самым важным в питании населения. Мамаражабов Муминшох 1976 года рождения, женат имеет 2 детей.  Он занимается производством лепешек. Его цех находиться в арендуемом помещении. В день выпекает до 1000 лепешек. Также часто поступают заказы на выпечку лепешек для торжеств и мероприятий. Муминшох часто ездит за покупкой сырья (муки) и это обходиться ему дорого за счет транспортных расходов.
 	Муминшох хочет получить займ в сумме 5000 сомони на 6 месяцев, чтобы оптом закупить 50 мешков муки.
texts.en:
In our country a dinner does not occur without flatbread. This is why this food item is the most important one in the diet of the population. Muminshoh M. was born in 1976, he is married and has 2 children. He makes flatbread. His shop is located in a rented location. He bakes 1000 flatbreads per day. He also often gets orders for the baking of flatbreads for celebrations and events. Muminshoh often travels to purchase raw materials (flour) and this is expensive for him due to the cost of transportation. Muminshoh would like to take out a loan of 5000 somoni for 6 months, in order to purchase 50 bags of flour at wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 50 bags of flour

loans.name: Ni Ayu Putu Astiti

texts.id: Di tengah himpitan ekonomi yang semakin sulit, Putu Astiti dituntut untuk dapat mempertahankan kelangsungan hidup keluarganya dengan cara bekerja lebih keras lagi. Salah satunya adalah dengan beternak babi dan bergabung dengan DINARI untuk meningkatkan modal usaha beternak babinya. Periode I sudah dilalui oleh Putu Astiti dengan hasil yang memuaskan dimana setelah melunasi pinjaman I ke DINARI, Putu Astiti memperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp.300.000,- per bulannya. Dengan hasil yang bagus itulah ia memutuskan untuk melanjutkan ke pinjaman ke II dengan jumlah pinjaman sebesar Rp.6000.000,-. Jangka waktu yang diambil adalah 6 bulan dan pelunasan akan dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman. Rencananya pinjaman ini akan dibelikan bibit babi sebanyak 8 ekor dengan harga per ekor Rp.350.000,- dimana beberapa diantaranya akan dipanen dalam waktu hanya 3 bulan untuk diolah menjadi daging babi guling yang biasanya dijual di restoran di Bali. Sisanya baru dipelihara untuk penggemukan selama kurang lebih 6 bulan. Pinjaman ini juga termasuk untuk membeli pakan babi selama masa pemeliharaan. Keuntungan kedepan diharapkan akan lebih banyak lagi karena usaha ini sangat membantu Putu Astiti dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya dan juga membantu suaminya dalam membiayai anak-anak mereka.
texts.en:
In the midst of the economic contraction, which has been increasingly difficult, Putu Astiti, is pressed to extend the continuity of the family’s livelihood by working more diligently. One of the ways is to breed pigs with support from DINARI to raise working capital for breeding pigs. Phase I was completed by Putu Astiti with satisfactory income, which after paying back loan I with DINARI, Putu Astiti generated profit of Rp.300.000,- (about USD30) per month. With this good yield, she decided to continue a second loan with an amount of Rp.6.000.000,- (about USD600). The period to take will be for 6 months with the repayment at the end of the period. The plan for this loan is to purchase 8 piglets with a cost of Rp.350.000,- (about USD35), where several amongst them will be harvested within 3 months to be processed into pork roll regularly served in restaurants in Bali. The balance will be reared and grown for about 6 months. This loan will also fund the rearing supplies for the period. It is hoped the future profit will be more, as this effort will aid to fulfill Putu Astiti’s family’s livelihood and assist her husband in their children’s expenses.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and it's feeds

loans.name: Ni Made Susana Dewi

texts.id: Sejak awal bergabung dengan DINARI, Ni Made Susana Dewi memang sudah memiliki usaha beternak babi di rumahnya. Karena dengan usaha ini Made Susana mampu menambah penghasilan keluarganya sehingga tidak hanya mengandalkan penghasilan suaminya yang seorang petani. Setelah melunasi pinjaman pertama dengan DINARI, Made Susana mampu memperoleh keuntungan bersih Rp.200.000,- per bulannya. Keuntungan ini sangat membantu untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari keluarganya. Selanjutnya Made Susana melanjutkan kerjasama dengan DINARI untuk melakukan pinjaman periode ke II dengan besar pinjaman Rp.6000.000,- jangka waktu 6 bulan serta pelunasan akan dilaksanakan pada akhir periode pinjaman. Pinjaman ini rencananya akan digunakan untuk membeli bibit babi sebanyak 8 ekor dengan harga per ekornya Rp.350.000,-. Nantinya bibit-bibit babi ini ada yang akan dijual per 3 bulan pemeliharaan saja untuk dijadikan daging babi guling. Dan sisa uang pinjaman tentunya untuk membeli pakan babi selama pemeliharaan. Dengan semakin besar pinjaman yang diterima diharapkan keuntungan yang didapat akan meningkat pada waktu panen berikutnya.
texts.en:
Since she started with DINARI, Ni Made Susana Dewi already raised pigs in her home. Since with this Made Susana was able to add to family income,so that it not only depended on husband's income as a tenant farmer.After completing the first loan DINARI, Made Susana was able to have a nett profit of Rp.200.000,- /mo (translator's note: 1US $ fluctuates beteween Rp 10,000-13,000). This profit very much helps daily family needs.Further Made Susana continues working together with DINARI for a second loan for Rp.6000,000,- for a period of 6 months, with full payment at the end of loan period.This loan is needed tobuy 8 piglets at Rp.350,000,-/piglet. These piglets would be raised and sold after 3 months to be then sold as 'babi guling' ( balinese baby roast pig specialty). The rest would be used to buy feed during raising. With higher received loans, it was hoped that profit would increased at the next harvest.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and it's feeds

loans.name: Kuch's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is requested by three members, all residents in Norea Commune, Battambang Province, Cambodia. Mrs. H. is 53 years old and she currently sells various kinds of fruits in the village, earning around $2 each day. She is married to Saveit, 50, who is a construction worker. They now have four children, two of whom are studying and the others are married. To make the family's transportation easier, H. has requested a loan to buy a motorbike for family use and for their children to ride to work.

The other two borrowers are:

S. is in the technician staff for a company and he is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle for riding to work.

K. is a local carpenter and he is applying for a loan for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family riding

loans.name: Ni Wayan Siki

texts.id: Dalam memenuhi kebutuhan sehari - hari beserta tiga anaknya yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah, penghasilan musiman dari bertani tidaklah cukup untuk memenuhinya. Untuk mengatasi itu semua Ni  Wayan Siki beserta suaminya memutuskan untuk ikut program beternak babi yang DINARI adakan untuk menambah pendapatan keluarga. Melalui DINARI yang memberikan pinjaman modal dan pembinaan, Ni Wayan Siki dapat membeli 2 ekor induk dan juga 3 ekor bibit penggemukan yang dipelihara selama 6 bulan. Dari pemeliharaan selama 6 bulan, induk babi bisa beranak 8 ekor  yang bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 250. 000.- per ekor setelah dipelihara selama 2 bulan. Hasil penjualan 8 ekor itu mencapai Rp. 4.000.000,- Selama enam bulan induk babi menghabiskan biaya sebesar Rp. 500.000,- Jadi dari 1 ekor induk dia mendapatkan tambahan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 500.000,- per bulan. Dengan tambahan pendapatan seperti ini maka Ni Wayan Siki tidak lagi merasa keberatan untuk mengatasi keadaan ekonomi seperti sekarang ini.
texts.en:
To fullfill daily needs with 3 school aged children and income from seasonal work as tenant farmer,which is not sufficient, Ni Wayan Siki and husband, decided to join pig farming done by DINARI to increase family's income. Through DINARI who gave loan and training, Ni Wayan Siki could buy 2 mother pigs and 3 fattening pigs to be raised for 6 months. After 6 months, mother pigs could produce 8 piglets, which could be sold for Rp. 250,000.- per piglets (translator's note: 1 US $ fluctuates beteween Rp 10,000-13,000) after being raised for 2 months. Sales of 8 piglets could reached Rp. 4,000,000,- Within 6 months mother pigs expenses could reached Rp. 500,000,- So from 1 mother pig she could profit Rp. 500,000,- /month. With that income, Ni Wayan Siki does not feel to bad to weather current economic condition.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglet's and it's feeds

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en: Marwan is a 27-year-old man living in Hay el Selloum in the Beirut suburbs. He is specialized in IT and computer repair in addition to his full-time job as an office helper. Marwan wants a loan of US$ 1,000 to buy new hardware and expand his passion.

loans.use: Buy new hardware

loans.name: Hawraa

texts.en: Hawraa is a 23-year-old woman living in Hay el Selloum in the Beirut suburbs. She is a home-based clothes distributor who has been in business for the past 2 years. Hawraa is now requesting a US$ 1,200 loan to purchase more merchandise for her business.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Ni Wayan Jendri

texts.id: Setelah mendapatkan hasil yang cukup lumayan dari pinjaman tahap pertama, Ni Wayan Jendri semakin semangat dalam mengembangkan usaha ternaknya karena pengetahuan tentang usaha ternak babi sudah dapat dimengerti dan dapat dilaksanakan berkat bimbingan dokter Hewan  dari DINARI. Ni Wayan Jendri bermaksud untuk melanjutkan pinjaman tahap kedua yang akan dipergunakan untuk membeli makanan ternak babi yang pada saat ini makanan babi cendrung bertambah mahal karena situasi saat ini semua harga harga semakin meniongkat termasuk juga makanan ternak. Dengan pinjaman tahap kedua diharapkan penghasilannya  meningkat sehingga dapat menambah penghasilan keluarganya guna mencukupi kebutuihan keluarga demi masa depan anak-anaknya.
texts.en:
After successfully getting returns from the first loan, Ni Wayan Jendri is now more determine to expand his pig farming with the knowledge from Dinari's Vetrinary. Ni Wayan Jendri intends to use the financial loan to buy more pig feedings. As prices of raw material has gone up, so has pig feedings. Ni Wayan Jendri hopes that with this round of financial assistance, she can increase the income of her family for the sake of her children.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more piglets and it's feeds

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en: Hussain is a 30-year-old married man, living in A. Shwaifat in Mount Lebanon. He has owned a barbershop for the past year, after working for 10 years in the field. Today, he wants to borrow US$ 1,000 to buy a new vapor machine for the hair and skin to satisfy his clients' needs.

loans.use: Buy a new vapor machine for the hair and skin

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Simpir

texts.id: Ni Nyoman Simpir, sudah menyelesaikan pinjaman tahap pertama. Pada pinjaman pertama Ni Nyoman Simpir memelihara Babi penggemukan dan juga memelihara induk babi yang setiap 6 bulan bisa melahirkan anaknya untuk bisa digemukan.                         Berkat  binaan staf dan Dokter Hewan DINARI dalam memelihara  babi pengetahuan Ni Nyoman Simpir  dapat bertambah Sehingga penghasilan dari pemeliharaan babi dapat meningkat. Oleh Karena keberhasilannya dalam pinjaman tahap pertama maka Ni Nyoman Simpir berniat untuk melanjutkan pinjamannya ke tahap kedua yang pinjamannya ini akan dipergunakan untuk membeli makanan babi. Juga dengan harapan bisa meningkatkan penghasilan keluarganya untuk bisa menabung untuk masa depannya.
texts.en:
Ni Nyoman Simpir has repaid her first round of loan. In her first loan, she succesfully rear a sow which produce new piglets every 6 months. Now with Dinari's assistance and knowledge, Ni Nyoman Simpir has increased her number of pigs. For the second round of loan, she intend to use it to buy more piglets and pig feedings. She hopes that her returns from this will be fruithful.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and it's feeds

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is a 38-year-old married man with two children, living in Ain A. Rimaneh in Beirut. He has been supplying and installing glass windows for the past 15 years, a profession that he inherited from his father. Jihad is now requesting US$ 1,000 to purchase merchandise to further expand his supply.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sudantri

texts.id:
Dari Pinjaman periode yang pertama yang telah diterima oleh Ni ketut Sudantri dan yang sudah dipergunakan untuk membeli anakan babi dan induk babi.Hasil yang didapat dari usaha ini cukup baik karena Ni Ketut Sidantri melakukan segala petunjuk cara pemeliharaan babi yang  bimbingan oleh dokter Hewan dan pembina dari DINARI.  Hasil yang diperoleh ini dipergunakan untuk menambah jumlah Anakan babi yang bisa dipelihara dan juga untuk membiayai uang sekolah anaknya yang masih bersekolah
Untuk pinjaman yang kedua ini Ni Ketut Sudantri akan mempergunakan  pinjamannya untuk membeli Anakan Babi yang akan dipelihara selama 5 bulan dengan harapan penghasilanya akan lebih meningkat.
texts.en:
From the first round of loan, Ni ketut Sudantri has use it to buy piglets and sow. It was fruitful as she was given guidance on rearing them from Dinari's Vetrianry. The profit was used to buy new piglets and as well for the use of her children who are still studying. For the second round of loan she intend to use it to buy more piglets and pig feedings and rear them for 5 months, and hopes that her profit will increase.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and it's feeds

loans.name: Sobhi

texts.en: Sobhi is a 53-year-old married man with two children, living in Borj Al Barajeneh in the Beirut suburbs. He has been providing transaction clearance for vehicle documents for three years, in addition to owning a taxi. Today, Sobhi wants to borrow US$ 600 to improve both his businesses.

loans.use: Improve both his businesses

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is a 19-year-old single man, living in in A. Msharafieh in the Beirut suburbs. He is an employee in a ventilation and air conditioning company in addition to home-based tailoring. Today he wants to borrow US$ 1,000 in order to buy additionA. tools and equipment for the tailoring business.

loans.use: Buy additional tools and equipment for his tailoring

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Swastiningsih

texts.id:
Ni nyoman Swastiningsih  istri dari I yang berprofesi sebagai seorang Bengkel.  Sebagai seorang Bengkel Belumlah cukup penghasilanya untuk mencukupi penghidupan keluarganya. Selanjutnya Ni Nyoman Swastiningsih berusaha beternak babi. Akan tetapi jumlah yang sedikit serta masih menerapkan pola tradisional berakibat pada hasil yang masih kurang maksimal.
Untuk mengatasi hasil yang kurang maksimal, Ni Nyoman wasiantini memilih DINARI menjadi  pendamping usahanya. Dari DINARI, Ni Putu Artini memperoleh pelatihan dan tunjangan modal usaha. Dengan pinjaman modal yang diperoleh dari DINARI sebesar  Rp. 4.500.000.- ia manfaatkan untuk pembelian bibit serta biaya pakan ternaknya. Ni Nyoman Wasiantini optimis dari usaha ternak babi yang ia lakukan akan memperoleh keuntungan yang nantinya kan dipergunakan untuk menunjang perekonomian keluarganya.
texts.en:
Swastiningsih started to rear pigs. But she learn her techniques in rearing them the old way, therefore is unable to get maximum yield. To overcome this, she sought Dinari for help. Dinari provided her with training and as well as a loan of Rp. 4.500.000, which will be used to buy piglets and pig feedings. Ni Nyoman is optimistic that this venture will increase her household income and lessen their burden.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and it's feeds

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.ru:
Бобоева Мукарам  1977 года рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей. Она торгует на рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе, материалами по пошиву национальной одежды. Мукарам закупает товар на оптовом рынке «Корвон». Благодаря разборчивости в тканях женской национальной одежды и ее 6-ти летнему опыту в этом бизнесе она завоевала доверие у многих постоянных клиентов. 
Мукарам хочет получить кредит для закупа ворсовых тканей, которые пользуются спросом в весенний период.
texts.en:
Mukaram B. was born in 1977, she is married and has 3 children. She sells fabrics for making traditional clothing at the Korvon market in Dushanbe. Thanks to her understanding of fabrics for traditional women’s clothing and her 6 years of experience in this business she has earned the trust of many regular clients. Mukaram would like to take out a loan for the purchase of velvet fabrics which are in demand during the spring season.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase velvet fabrics

loans.name: Floricita

texts.en:
Mrs. Floricita T., a 67 years old widow,  belongs to Ilaures Center 11 of Antique Central Branch. She is blessed with 9 children and 6 of them have their own families. She had only 1 child in high school that she likes to finish her studies.

She is requestin for a loan of P5,000 --  payable for 50 weeks -- as her initial capital for her rice trading and hog-raising businesses.  The people of her village will be her primary customers.

She dreams that her business will expand in the future so that it will help finance the studies of her child. She wants to thank ASHI for giving the poor an opportunity to have a capital for the business. She also would like to thank Kiva lenders who will support her loan.

loans.use: To purchase 1 pig and 2 sacks of rice

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: S. is 39 years and who resides in rural area of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She currently makes an income by selling fish at the local market, including dried fish and fish paste. She normally buys fish from a wholesale supplier at a low price and sells retail to earn a higher price. S. is married with three children who are attending the primary school, while her husband is assisting her selling fish. S.'s business is very profitable for the family, so she requests a loan of $400 in order to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Хушназаров Сухроб 1977 года рождения, женат имеет 3 детей. Жена домохозяйка, сам он недалеко от дома продает горюче-смазочный материалы: бензин, керосин, моторные масла. Кредит получает впервые, обратился в нашу организацию по совету друзей. Сухробу понравились условия кредитования, и решил получить кредит. 
	Хочет получить займ в сумме 10000 сроком на год.
texts.en:
Suhrob H. was born in 1977, he is married and has 3 children. His wife is a homemaker and he sells fuel: gasoline, kerosene and motor oil not far from home. This is Suhrob’s first loan, he turned to our organization on the advice of friends. Suhrob liked the credit terms and he decided to receive credit. He would like to take out a loan of 10,000 somoni for a one year period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fuel

loans.name: Alelumhe

texts.en: Alelumhe A. sells drinks and wine. She needs a loan amount of N80000 to purchase more wine to sell. She is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wine to sell

loans.name: Latifat

texts.en: Latifat A. is 36 years old and married with 4 children. She sells sarongs. She is requesting a loan amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Ayaovi Amenyona

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce depuis 2005 le commerce de vêtement, le commerce de vêtement marche bien à lomé, parce que les jeunes aiment beaucoup s’habiller à lomé, il a une clientèle élevée c’est pour cela qu’il s’adresse à wages pour obtenir un crédit en vue de satisfaire la demande. Il  est marié et père de trois enfants, c’est avec ce qu’il gagne qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who has been in commerce since 2005 selling clothing. Commerce in clothing does well in Lomé because young people like to dress up a lot in Lomé. He has a large number of customers. That’s why he is enquiring with WAGES for obtaining a loan, so as to satisfy the demand. He is married and the father of three. With what he earns, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin, 40 years old and married with three children, sells crates of drinks on both a wholesale and retail basis to her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N50000 to purchase additional crates of drinks for the business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more  crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Kafayat

texts.en: Kafayat, 30 years old and married with three children, wholesales and retails crates of drinks at the Ojoo Market in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more drinks for the business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Olutola

texts.en: Forty-year-old Olutola, married with four children, lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria, where she sells clothes at the Ojoo Market. She is requesting a loan of N50000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin, the 40-year-old mother of three children, is married to a commercial driver. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Wale

texts.en: Wale sells electronic spare parts. He is 45 years old and married with 3 children. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more electronic spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic spare parts to sell

loans.name: Thoang's Group

texts.en:
This small group loan is requested by three people, all residents of Battambang Province. Its leader, Mrs. P., 55, has a small family with other five members. She is a good homemaker who cooks delicious meals for her family and cares for the children. The family's daily expense is supported by P.'s husband, who works as a staff member of ECC Association and gets a salary $200 a month. The couple has four children: one is a student and the other three are married and live away from home. P. has a hard time cooking because her kitchen is small and ugly; therefore, she is asking for a loan to build a new kitchen.

The other two borrowers are:

D., age 46, raises animals from home for sale and she requests a loan to purchase piglets and chickens to raise.

C. is single, aged 27. He is staff member for an organization and he is asking for a loan to buy a computer to support his work.

loans.use: To build a new kitchen

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en: Lawal A. repairs and sells grinding machines. He is 47 years old and married with 4 children. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. He is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase one grinding machine and grinding machine spare parts. He says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase one grinding machine and grinding machine spare parts

loans.name: Akanji

texts.en: Akanji O. is single and he is 27 years old. He sells and repairs rechargeable phones. He hopes to expand this business. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phones. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phones to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther S. is 43 years old and married with 4 children. Standing close to her in the picture is her youngest child. She sells gift items and provisions. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more gift items and provisions to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and gift items

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is divorced and has two children. She sells women's shoes at the local market. Her average net income is 2,500 UAH per month.

Lubov started this business 11 years ago. At that time her husband left her and she had to raise two children herself. Lubov is a very disciplined person and pleasant to talk to. She believes that these two qualities have helped her to develop her business and become successful.

Lubov would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to purchase spring shoes. The additional income would be used for the family needs as well as for further business development.

loans.use: To purchase spring inventories

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday makes furniture. He is 32 years old and married with 4 children. He needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more materials to make more furniture. He says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make more furniture to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 38 years old and married with four children. She sells drinks to people in her community. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She needs a loan of  N140000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with one daughter. She sells clothing at one of the markets in Berdyansk city. Her monthly net income is 2,000 UAH. Ludmila has a good and caring family. Ludmila’s husband, Oleg, supports her in her business.

Ludmila has been in this business for 7 years. Good pricing policy, good client service, and a strong desire to go forward have helped Ludmila make her business a success.

Ludmila would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to increase the assortment she has to sell. The additional income would be spent on her family's needs: buying food, medicine, some clothing, etc.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothes for sale

loans.name: Bunmi

texts.en: Bunmi owns a provisions store where she sells provisions like sugar, milk, detergent, etc. She is 28 years old and married with two children. She is requesting a loan of N100000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en: Ronke is married with four children. She is 40 years old. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She needs a loan of N50000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two children. She sells clothing for children and teenagers at Obraztsoviy market in Melitopol city. She started this business 11 years ago because she just liked selling this kind of clothing. Ludmila changed several business locations and finally got a good one at one of the best markets.

Ludmila lives with her husband and their younger son, who is a college student. Ludmila helps her son cover his college tuition. Both her husband and son are very supportive of Ludmila in her business. They plan to remodel their house.

Ludmila would like to borrow 7,500 UAH to purchase spring inventories. She would spend the additional income for her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase spring inventories

loans.name: Bibifotima

texts.ru: Самадова Бибифотима является активной клиенткой Микроинвест. Ей 63 года, имеет 3 детей. Ее сыновья работают в России а сама Бибифотима занимается предпринимательством на местных рынках. Бибифотима получает от своих сыновей денежные переводы, и на эти деньги в прошлом году построила новую пристройку к своему дому. Часть денег которых не хватило она получила в виде займа Микроинвест. Сейчас она планирует покрыть крышу шифером и нуждается в небольшом займе, поэтому пришла в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Bibifotima S. is an active client of MicroInvest. She is 63 years old, has 3 children

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to remodel home

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 46 years old and married with four children. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria.

Joseph sells spare motor parts. He needs a loan of N140000 to purchase more spare motor parts to sell. He says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more spare motor parts to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 50 years old and married with four children. Ruth sells foodstuffs and provisions. She also makes egg roll. She needs a loan of N100000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mahamadou Dembelé  est âgé de 31 ans et vit avec ses 3 enfants et sa femme dans une famille élargie dans le quartier Torakabougou  de la préfecture de  Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, très vite il commença les activités économiques notamment la vente d’une boutique d’articles divers.  Il a appris cette activité auprès de son grand frère et cela durant des années.  Pour qu’il soit responsable c’est à dire assurer les dépenses de sa propre famille, son grand frère décida de lui donner un fonds de commerce depuis maintenant 6 ans. Monsieur Mahamadou Dembélé  maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité dans son quartier.    
Afin d’agrandir son fonds de commerce, Monsieur Mahamadou Dembélé  décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt indididuel. 
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter des articles divers  pour sa boutique à Bamako(capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Avec une clientèle composée de toutes les catégories sociales, il  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 37 500FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour agrandir sa boutique, rembourser les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie.
texts.en:
Mr. Mahamadou Dembelé, age 31, lives with his three children and wife in an extended family in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school, he quickly started in economic work, notably selling various goods in a shop. He learned this business from his older brother over a few years. For him to be responsible, that is to say, to ensure that the expenses of his own family are covered, his older brother decided to give him some seed money six years ago. Mr. Mahamadou Dembelé is mastering his work and is in high demand in this area.

To increase his working capital, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which he is on his first individual loan. This loan will be used to buy various goods from wholesalers to supply his shop in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali).

Having customers from all walks of life, he intends to realize a monthly profit of 37,500 francs CFA that he envisions using to expand his shop, to repay the loan interest, and to provide for his extended family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various good for the shop

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola A. sells drinks, and she has been in this business for long time. She is 40 years old and married with three children. She needs a loan of N100000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Mosurat

texts.en: Mosurat lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells electrical materials. She is 25 years old and married with a child. She needs a loan of N50000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical  materials to sell

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en: Romoke owns a patent store where she sells medicine. She is 35 years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en: Abosede sells tubers of yam at Ojoo Market in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She is 37 years old and married with four children. She needs a loan of N100000 to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Funmilola

texts.en: Funmilola is 35 years old and married with two children. She sells spare motor parts. She needs a loan of N100000 to purchase more spare motor parts to sell. She hopes to expand this business. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Omolola

texts.en: Omolola sells medicines. She is 36 years old and married with three children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She needs a loan of N80000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Sabali (La Sagesse) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sabali, avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 4 enfants  vivent dans des grandes familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies au quartier Santoro 1 de la ville de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues  à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent presque la même activité de production et vente  de pain. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité qu’elles ont apprise avec les grands parents. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Sabali a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son deuxième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de farine de blé et du bois de chauffe pour faire du pain et  revendre au comptant,  à la maison, au marché de San et environs. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 80 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenu.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Sabali (meaning "wisdom") average 32 years of age and 4 children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families in the Santoro 1 district of the city of San (Ségou region, Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community and family. They do almost the same work, producing and selling bread. The women are in high demand in this business, which they learned from their grandparents.

In order to satisfy the ever-growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding ones have been correctly repaid.

With this loan, the group members want to buy sacks of flour and some firewood to make bread and to make sales in cash, at the house, at the San marketplace, and in surrounding areas.

They hope to realize an average profit of 80,000 francs CFA over the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in the businesses. Their ambition is to diversify their commerce by embracing other income-generating work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and firewood

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Les   femmes du groupe Benkadi  sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne  45 ans,  5 enfants et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au village de kouroubadougou  dans la sous préfecture de Kimparana (région de Ségou, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent une activité qui est rare, la vente de feuilles de baobab séchées et la poudre de son  fruit qu’elles achètent avec celles qui  les cueillent. Elles fabriquent également  à base   de beurre  de karité et de la potasse du savon. Elles sont très sollicitées dans leurs  activités.  
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de leurs clientèles qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Benkadi a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier   prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, des sacs de feuilles et de la   poudre de  baobab. Ses condiments sont vendus au marché de kimparana   en détail, et  au comptant. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 55 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie. Elles ont pour ambition d’avoir un prêt élevé afin de diversifier leur activité  en vendant des pagnes provenant de Bobo.
texts.en:
The women of the group Benkadi (meaning "agreement" or "harmony") are all married. Averaging 45 years of age and 5 children each, they live in large traditional extended families in the village of Kouroubadougou in Kimparana sub-prefecture (Ségou region, Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community and family. They are in a rare business, selling dried baobab leaves and powdered fruit from the same tree. They buy these goods from women who gather them. The group members also make soap from karité butter (from the shea nut) and potash. The members are in high demand in their businesses.

In order to satisfy the ever-growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan (group loan).

With this loan, they want to buy sacks of leaves and baobab powder. These condiments are sold retail and in cash transactions at the Kimparana marketplace.

They hope to realize an average profit of 55,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to pay the loan interest and to provide for the extended family. Their ambition is to obtain a larger loan in order to diversify their work by selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) from Bobo.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Sabougnouma (La Bonne Cause) Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Sabougnouma  sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans, 6 enfants et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au village de kouroubadougou de la sous préfecture de Kimparana (région de Ségou, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent  presque la même activité de transformation de noix de néré en soumbala qu’elles ont apprise avec les mamans. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Sabougnouma a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier   prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de noix de néré et du bois de chauffe pour la fabrication. Le soumbala ainsi prêt est vendu à Kouroubadougou et au marché de Kimparana   en détail et au comptant. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 50 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition d’avoir un prêt élevé afin d’élargir la vente de soumbala en faire une grande quantité  pour vendre à Bobo et à Bamako.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabougnouma group are all married. On average, they are 44 years old with 6 children and live in large traditional extended families in the village of Kouroubadougou in the sub-prefecture of Kimparana (Ségou region, Republic of Mali). They know each other as neighbours and as relatives. They all engage in almost the same business, namely the conversion of néré nuts into soumbala, which they learned from their mothers. They are highly sought after for their work. In order to satisfy the needs of their clientele, which is constantly increasing, the Sabougnouma group decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are seeking their first solidarity (group) loan. They intend to use this loan to buy bags of néré nuts and firewood for the fabrication of soumbala. The soumbala thus made is sold in Kouroubadougou and at the market in Kimparana at retail and in cash. They each hope to earn an average profit of 50,000 FCFA during this loan term, which will be used to repay the loan and meet the needs of their extended families, with the remainder being invested in their businesses. Their ambition is to obtain a large loan in order to expand the sale of soumbala by making a large quantity for sale in Bobo and in Bamako.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy néré nuts and firewood

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Hugo Bazán, es soltero, actualmente vive en pareja y  ella tambien le ayuda en el negocio, tiene dos hijos, menores de edad. El negocio que es la despensa  lo tiene en su domicilio.
El señor Hugo Bazán, retira el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos o productos de primera necesidad como carnes, quesos, pollo, aceites, harinas y otros. A muy tempranas horas del dia inicia sus actividades aproximadamente a las 04:00 Hs A.M. A fin de comprar todo lo que necesita para su negocio. 
Uno de sus apiraciones es poder comprar un medio de transporte.
texts.en:
Hugo Bazán is not married; he is living with his partner and she also helps him with the business. He has two minor children. His business is a convenience store which is in his home. Hugo Bazán is borrowing to buy a variety of goods and staple foods such as meat, cheese, chicken, oil, flour and so on. He starts his day very early in the morning, at about 4:00 A.M. in order to buy everything he needs for his store. One of his goals is to buy some form of transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of products such as meat, chicken, cheese, flour, milk products, refreshments among others

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, son mari est à la retraite et ils habitent dans le quartier d’adidogomé dans la ville de lomé. Elle a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, comme son mari est à la retraite, elle l’aide avec ce qu’elle gagne comme bénéfice dans les charges du foyer. Actuellement son stock est insuffisant pour couvrir les charges du foyer c’est pour cela qu’elle demande à wages un crédit pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of two children. Her husband is retired, and they live in the Adidogomé district in the city of Lomé. Her income-generating work involves commerce in grocery items. Because her husband is retired, she helps him with household expenses with what profits she earns. Currently, her inventory is insufficient to cover household expenses. That’s why she’s asking WAGES for a loan, so as to acquire supplies.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Tiessiri (Soyons Courageux) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tiessiri est composé de huit femmes (6 mariées et deux célibataires), ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 5 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Médina Koura  de la  ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues à travers des liens  de voisinage. Elles exercent  plusieurs  activités qui vont  de la vente de bois de chauffe, du riz  aux oignons venant de Niono.
 Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Tiessiri a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des chargements de camions en bois de chauffe, des sacs d’ognons et des sacs de riz. Elles s’approvisionnent en bois de chauffe auprès des paysans  dans les  villages de Donina et Zangasso. Quant aux riz et  aux oignons, ils sont achetés dans le marché de Niono. Le bois est vendu à la maison, le riz et l’oignon  sont vendus en détail au marché  de Koutiala et à la  maison. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 70 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
 Elles ont pour ambition d’agrandir leurs activités en achetant des tonnes de riz et d’oignon pour devenir des grossistes.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group is composed of eight women (6 married and 2 unmarried), with an average age of 37 years and 5 children, living in large traditional extended families in the Médina Koura area of the city of Koutiala (in the Sikasso region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other as neighbours. They engage in several businesses ranging from the sale of firewood and rice to the sale of onions originating from Niono. In order to meet the demands of their clientele, which is constantly increasing, the Tiessiri group decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are seeking their first solidarity (group) loan. They intend to use this loan to buy truckloads of firewood, bags of onions, and bags of rice. They obtain their supply of firewood from small farmers in the villages of Donina and Zangasso. As for rice and onions, they are purchased at the market in Niono. The wood is sold at home, and the rice and onions are sold at retail in the market at Koutiala and at home. They each hope to realize an average profit of 70,000 FCFA over the course of this loan term, which will be used to repay the loan and meet the needs of their extended families, with the rest being invested in their businesses. Their ambition is to enlarge their businesses by buying tonnes of rice and onions in order to become wholesalers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, onions, and firewood

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: Ce dame habite le quartier d’adidogomé est une revendeuse de produits cosmétiques et de beauté dans son quartier,elle fait son commerce dans sa boutique qu’elle a appelée EXTENSION 3000, elle est divorcée de son époux , et elle a deux enfants. Avec ce qu’elle gagne et l’appui financier de son mari elle arrive à subvenir convenablement aux charges de ses enfants. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 1992, actuellement elle a besoin d’agrandir son stock de produits de beauté c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de wages un crédit qui est son premier
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Adidogomé district. She is a retailer of cosmetics and beauty products in her area. She does commerce in her shop she calls “EXTENSION 3000”. She has been in this business since 1992. She is divorce from her husband and has two children. With what she earns plus the financial support from her husband, she manages to provide for her children appropriately. Currently she needs to expand her stock of beauty products. That’s why she’s requesting from WAGES a loan, which is her first one.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Fawe Secondary School, Waterloo Group

texts.en:
These folks are teachers at the Forum for African Woman Educationalists (FAWE). This is a Junior Secondary School with classes I – III. It was built for girls in September of 2005 by FAWE, a local NGO, for the promotion of the girls' education. The school has a total number of 296 pupils and with a staff of nine teachers and two security guards.

Last academic year, the school sent thirty-three candidates for the Basic Education Certificate Examination (NPSE) and twenty-six candidates passed with flying colors. This was a very good result by national standards. FAWE, a donor-supported school, is the only school in Waterloo small-town that teaches basic computer skills to its pupils. However, to assist other schools, FAWE allows pupils from other schools to take computer lessons in their school.

Teachers and other professional workers come to SMT to seek loans for different reasons. For some, since salaries are usually very small, they are prompted to engage themselves in businesses to supplement their meager salaries. Others, however, can not directly do business themselves; rather, they will invest whatever little they have into their wives’ businesses. Some seek a loan in order to pursue further studies or to pay school fees for their children. And others want a loan in order to buy pieces of furniture like chairs or a bed. Some want to either start building a house or continue with a house-building project they have already begun. It is for some of these reasons that teachers from FAWE have come to SMT to seek a loan.

Aminata Victoria L. (first row, second from right) is the acting principal of the school. She has been in the teaching profession for thirty-three years. She was born in Songo, about eight miles from Waterloo. She is fifty-five, a widow with five children. Two of her children are grown-ups, one is in his second year in Fourah Bay College, University of Sierra Leone, the next is in Port Loko Teacher’s Training College and the last is in secondary school. With this loan, Mrs. L. will pay for her two children in college. This will make her a happy woman as she was having sleepless nights wondering where to get the money to pay her children's fees.

Note: SMT has just opened a new branch in Waterloo and teachers of FAWE are the first individuals to collect a loan from this branch. Waterloo is twenty miles (32 km) from Freetown.

loans.use: Pay college fees for children

loans.name: Sda Primary School, Waterloo Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Seventh Day Adventist Primary School. It was founded in 1950 by the Seventh Day Adventist Mission. Very recently, the school has been divided into Lower and Upper Primary Schools. The Lower is made up of the nursery and classes I – III. And the Upper Primary School is made up of classes IV – VI. It is a co-educational school with a total of 767 pupils and a staff of twenty teachers. Last year, the school sent 124 pupils for the National Primary Schools Examination (NPSE) and ninety of these pupils passed. By national standards, this was a very good result for the school. In sports, such as football (soccer) and athletics organized by the Ministry of Youths and Sports, the school also usually does well.

With the loan, some of the staff members will start a small business, and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan in their businesses. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children's education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in building a house (buying building materials).

Government salaries are usually quite small for teachers, thus maK. teaching an unattractive profession for many whose primary motivator is money. Many choose other jobs over teaching because of the small salary, thus starving the field of qualified personnel to teach the children. The few who remain in the classrooms have to find alternative means of maK. ends meet. The vast majority of them engage in either business or agriculture or they provide extra tutorial classes for the children (although this is a practice the government is trying to stop). Needless to say, loans from SMT are a great help to the teachers in order to boost their businesses or invest in something productive. Many want to go to school but could not afford the cost. Some will want to buy pieces of furniture, but their monthly salaries are not enough to let them do so. With a loan, they will be able to meet some of these needs. And with their monthly salaries, they can repay easily via a payroll deduction type of system.

Sixty years old, Josephine A. S. (first row, second from left) is the Head Mistress of the Lower Primary school. She is a widow with four children, all of whom are now grown-ups. Mrs. S. was born and bred in Waterloo. She has been in the teaching profession for thirty-five years. At home, Mrs. S. is also a businesswoman. She has a small stall where she sells market food. With this loan, she will buy items like onions, palm-oil (the most popular cooK. oil), peppers, salt, etc. to add to her business.

Note: SMT has just opened a new branch in Waterloo. SDA Primary School is the second institution to receive a loan from SMT at this branch. Waterloo is twenty miles (32 km) from Freetown.

loans.use: Invest in her business by adding more market food

loans.name: Comite Villa Concepcion Group

texts.es:
El comité “ Villa Concepcion” se formó  gracias al deseo D. sus integrantes D. generar mas ingresos para sus hogares y ayudar al sustento D. la casa  , reciben un crédito promedio D. 800.000 y lo utilizaran para diversas opciones D. compra como ser: compra D. insumos para la fabricacion D. comestibles, compra D. leche azucar,yerba,harina,sal panificados y verduras para su posterior venta, compra D. ropas D. ocasión para la venta , compra-venta D. calzados , compra-venta D. productos cárnicos, compra-venta D. lácteos,compra-venta D. huevos etc, todas estas actividades según manifestaciones D. las señoras les ayudan a paliar D. alguna manera las diversas necesidades con que cuentan sus hogares , a la vez anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, tea, oil, flour, bakery, meat, cassava, sweet potatoes, for later resale, purchase of ingredients for the manufacture and sale of foods such as: sausage, sausage, tortillas, empanadas, croquettes, etc, selling drinks such as soda, wine, beer, soft drinks, and ice cream, buy fabric for garments

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: This is Nana K., a local entrepreneur in the city of Makeni. She is 40 years old, and has lived her whole life in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children. This is her second loan from SMT. With her first loan, she was able to expand her business. Nana has seen a vast improvement in her business as a result of the first loan. Having repaid it successfully, she is now requesting a new loan to further strengthen her business. Nana sells items like sprays, chains, jeans, lace, cottons, and shoes.

loans.use: Increase her stock of goods

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She has a restaurant where she sells drinks and pepper soup. She is a LAPO client. Doris needs a loan of N60,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says "thanks" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a traves de la Sra.Daniela B. Lezcano, quien se entero acerca de la Fundacion y del programa a traves de una persona que es cliente de la Fundacion del Programa de Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Podemos hablar de la Sra. Angela R., tiene 54años, tiene 5 hijos ella es una mujer sacrificada y sola su esposo habia fallecido en accidente, desde ese momento ella asume la responsabilidad de ser mamá y papá, ella vende mate y terere en la terminal de omnibus de Asuncion.A las 4:00 de madrugada se va al mercado a traer los remedios yuyos para su mate y terere, hace 15 años que esta en el mismo puesto este trabajo lo realiza desde las 5:00 hasta hasta las 11:00 de la mañana. Su hijo mayor le ayuda y prepara para el almuerzo para los miembros de su familia.
Por la tarde ña Angela hace torta y lo vende en los almacenes de su barrio,y dice que grcias a este programa ella esta saliendo adelante.

Nombre y Apellido	Actividad
Daniela B. L.	Vta de Ropa
Myrian M. C.. 	Vta de Remedio Yuyo
Cynthia R. L..	Vta de Cosmetico
Felicita R. G. 	Vta de Ropa
Natalia R.R. 	Vta de Ropa

Edith Y. R. G.	Vta de Lenceria 
Angela R. M.	Vta de Mate y Terere
Diana A.C. G. 	Vta de Lenceria
Wilma G. S. 	Vta de Bijouteri
Marta N.G. de B..
	Vta de Comida.
Susana M.Y. de S. 	Vta de Frutas
Ramona C.R. N.	Copetin
Delcy G.B. R.	Vta de Zapatilla

texts.en:
This group was created by Daniela B. Lezcano who heard of the Fundacion and the programme from someone who is a client of the Fundacion del Programa de Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras [Foundation for the Enterprising Womens' Group Programme]. We can tell you about Angela R. who is 54 years old and has five children. She is a self-sacrificing woman who on her own - her husband having died in an accident - had to assume the responsibility for her children and become both mother and father to them. She sells mate and terere [both are traditional herbal teas or drinks] at the omnibus terminal of Asuncion. At 4:00 A.M. she goes to the market to bring her herbal remedies for her mate and terere. She has been in the same spot for 15 years now, working from 5:00 A.M. to 11:00 A.M. Her eldest son helps her and prepares breakfast for the other members of the family. In the afternoons Angela makes pie and sells them in the stores of her neighbourhood. She says that thanks to this programme she has been able to make progress. Name Activity Daniela B. L. sells clothing Myrian M. C.. sells herbal remedies Cynthia R. L.. sells cosmetics Felicita R. G. sells clothing Natalia R.R. sells clothing Edith Y. R. G. sells lingerie Angela R. M. sells mate and terere (herbal drinks) Diana A.C. G. sells lingerie Wilma G. S. sells jewelry Marta N.G. de B. sells food Susana M.Y. de S. sells fruit Ramona C.R. N. sells snacks Delcy G.B. R. sells sneakers Gisela C. U. C. sells jewelry Maria A. P. de S. sells food Elizabeth G. E. sells newspapers

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: clothing such as shirts, blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, snack sales: sandwiches, pie, tortilla, seafood and drinks; shoe sales: shoe designs and multicolored shoes

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth has a fashion home where she makes dresses for her customers.  She also sells tailoring materials and sarongs. She is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She needs a loan of N60,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell. She says "thanks" to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: Aurelia cuenta con 39 años de edad, lleva viviendo por más de 17 años con su pareja, y tiene 7 hijos con los cuales vive en su casa. Su esposo trabaja en el campo de sol a sol, siembra papa y olluco en chacras temporales y en chacras de riego; mientras que Aurelia en horas de la mañana se dedica a las labores de ama de casa. Nos comenta que su actividad inicia con el lavado de los pañales de su bebé, y en seguida se dedica a cocinar para el almuerzo, luego lleva al campo a sus vacunos, y al regresar carga el almuerzo para llevárselo a su pareja, y finalmente lo apoya en la chacra hasta las 6 de la tarde. En todo este tiempo sus sembríos de papa y olluco en las diversas temporadas solo les alcanzó  para el sostenimiento de su hogar, porque a veces no tiene una buena producción por la falta de abonar con mayor cantidad de fertilizantes, y no poder cubrir todas sus siembras, por ello sus cosechas no cubrieron las expectativas del mercado, por ser productos picados por los gusanos.  Pese a sus carencias económicas, Aurelia y su esposo no dejan de sembrar, el crédito que ahora solicitan los alienta a seguir sembrando, con anhelos de progreso en esta actividad. Ella es muy activa en su banco comunal, el ciclo pasado tenia el cargo de vocal, encargada de pasar los  comunicados del analista de crédito. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar con responsabilidad sus cuotas programadas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de pesticidas y fertilizantes, para que vuelva a sembrar en sus chacras de regadío, y los fertilizantes para el abonado de sus chacras temporales que necesitan de abonado.
texts.en:
Aurelia is 39 years old. She has been living with her partner for more than 17 years and has seven children with whom she lives in her house. Her husband works in the fields from morning til night: he sows potato and olluco [a root vegetable] in temporary fields and irrigated fields while Aurelia takes care of the home in the morning. She says that her work starts with washing her baby's diapers and then cooking breakfast. Later, she brings her livestock to the fields and on her return she brings her partner his breakfast. Finally, she helps him in the fields until 6:00 P.M. In all this time her potato and olluco plantings in different seasons have only served to sustain her household because sometimes she does not have a good harvest due to a lack of fertilizing enough and she is not able to cover her entire sowing area which has resulted in poor harvests and could not be sold at market as the vegetables were riddled by worms. Despite her financial problems, Aurelia and her husband continue to sow. The loan they are requesting will allow them to continue to sow with the goal of making progress in this enterprise. She is very active in her community bank. In the previous loan cycle, she was the spokesperson, in charge of communications with the loan officer. This is her second loan with MFP; in all this time she has proven that she is very responsible in her repayments. The money she is requesting will be used to buy pesticides and fertilizers so that she can return to sowing her irrigated fields, and to buy fertilizers to improve her temporary fields which need fertilizing.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es: Cipriano tiene 48 años de edad, está casado hace 30 años con la madre de sus dos hijas, las cuales no están a su lado, actualmente viven con su nieto de 8 años en su casa. Él es un hombre de campo, el único trabajo que conoce es el labrado y el cultivo de sus chacras, todo este tiempo las ganancias obtenidas en esta actividad le sirvieron para cubrir las necesidades y la educación de sus hijos. En esta oportunidad ha sembrado en mayor cantidad habas, seguido por arverjas y otro tanto de papas. Cipriano dice que sembrar habas es muy económico para él, porque siembra en las chacras cultivadas de papa, y así aprovecha los fertilizantes que ya se abonaron para esa siembra. De 12 kilos de habas su producción es de 12 sacos de habas, cuando siembra sin fertilizantes químicos, pero de abonar sus cosechas la producción se incrementa, siendo la venta de cada saco a 40 ó 50 soles. Cipriano en todo este tiempo ha trabajado conjuntamente con su esposa, quien lo ayuda y por lo que se siente muy satisfecho, sus planes siempre están ligados a incrementar sus siembras, pero ahora está tratando de sembrar diversas verduras para incrementar sus ganancias. Cipriano es el presidente de su banco comunal, en el cual cumple todas sus funciones con mucha responsabilidad, este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser un cliente muy activo y responsable en sus cuotas. El crédito que ha solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes para el abonado de su chacra de papas.
texts.en:
Cipriano is 48 years old He has been married for 30 years to the mother of his two daughters who no longer live with him as they live with his 8-year-old grandson in his home. He is a rural man. The only work he knows is to labour and to plant his farm. All this time, the money he has made from this activity has gone to pay for the needs and education of his children. This time, he has sown a large quantity of broadbeans, followed by peas and potatoes. In this way he can take advantage of the fertilizers which are already added for this sowing. Twelve kilograms of broadbeans sown produces 12 bags of broadbeans when he sows without chemical fertilizers, but with the additional fertilizer his production increases. He sells each bag for between 40 to 50 soles. Cipriano has worked all this time with his wife who helps him. He feels very satisfied. His plans always involve increasing his sowings but now he is trying to plant a variety of vegetables to increase his income. Cipriano is the president of his community bank and accomplishes all his duties with great responsibility. This is his second loan from MFP and in all this time he has proven himself to be very active and responsible in his repayments. He will use the loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer to improve his potato fields.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena cuenta con 53 años de edad, se casó hace 22 años, tuvo 12 hijos de los cuales fallecieron 3, actualmente vive con 4 de sus menores hijos en una casa que tiene en el campo. Las manos agrietadas de Elena son la muestra, de que labran la tierra en su afán de lograr que le den una buena cosecha, para que de ese modo pueda captar mayores ingresos a su economía familiar y así cubrir los gastos de sus menores hijos. Está muy contenta con su siembra de papa y más aún con la de habas, ya que de una arroba (12 kilos), logra cosechar de 70 a 80 sacos, los cuales vende a 30 ó 40 soles dependiendo del mercado, por ello Elena y su esposo no dejan de sembrar, ya que le es muy rentable, mayormente en el mes de mayo que es donde se elevan los precios, por ser utilizados en la sierra para la preparación de la “Pachamanca” (plato típico que se cocina en un horno bajo tierra), mientras que en la costa son muy cotizados en la época  de verano. Elena comenta que su mayor dificultad es la compra de fertilizantes, ya que los precios son muy elevados y las cosechas de sus productos no compensan la inversión realizada, pese a estas dificultades, nunca ha dejado de sembrar en sus chacras. Elena es una cliente muy callada en cada una de las reuniones de su banco comunal, y no quiere recibir ningún cargo porque dice no creer estar preparada por no saber leer ni escribir, pero lo que resalta en ella es su responsabilidad de pago para cada una de sus cuotas, este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y se siente muy identificada con la institución. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para el abonado de sus chacras, tanto de papas y de habas. Ella está muy agradecida con los préstamos que ha recibido durante este tiempo, ya que le han permitido trabajar y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
