Elena is 53 years old. She has been married for 22 years and has 12 children of whom three died. She is now living with four of her minor children in a home she owns in the countryside. Elena's chapped hands are the proof that she works the land in her eagerness to manage to get a good harvest, because that is how she is able to make more income for her family and so pay for her minor children's needs. She is very happy with her potato sowing and even more happy with the broadbeans as from one arroba (12 kilograms) she manages to harvest 70 to 80 bags which she sells for 30 to 40 soles depending on the market. Elena and her husband are always sowing as it is very profitable, especially in the month of May when prices rise as they are used in the mountains to prepare "Pachamanca" (a traditional dish cooked in an oven underground), while on the coast they are in very high demand in summertime. Elena says that her greatest hardship is the difficulty of buying fertilizers as these are very expensive and the harvest does not compensate for the investment in fertilizers. In spite of these difficulties, she has never stopped sowing her fields. Elena is a very quiet person in each of her community bank's meetings and she does not want to hold any position in the bank because she does not feel able to do so as she does not know how to read or write. What stands out is her responsibility towards repaying on time. This is her second loan from MFP and she identifies with the institution. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy fertilizers to improve her fields, both for potatoes and broadbeans. She is very grateful for the loans she has received as thanks to them she has continued to work and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her fields

loans.name: Cangallo Corazon Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Cangallo Corazón, es parte del proyecto Wari I, Las socias son D. la provincia D. Cangallo, que esta ubicado a 110 kilómetros D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, tiene una población aproximada D. 600 habitantes, las actividades principales D. la comunidad son la producción D. frutales como palto, tuna y la agricultura D. cereales.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es el caso D. Marlene que es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo D. 9 meses, Marlene venD. ropa en las ferias, inicio este negocio porque necesitaba generar ingresos para su hogar, desD. que empezó en el Banco Comunal su negocio esta mejorando, Marlene esta ahorrando para la educación D. su hijo e implementar su casa.
Por otro lado Celia es casada, tiene 2 hijos D. 9 y 4 años, Celia venD. comida, negocio que inicio con la ayuda D. su esposo, Celia sueña con mejorar su negocio e implementar un restaurante, Celia esta ahorrando para comprar mesas, sillas para implementar su restaurante.
Mientras que Aldy es casada, tiene 4 hijos, Aldy vendía ropa y como no le generaba buenas ganancias decidió cambiar D. negocio por la venta D. combustible, sus ventas están mejorando, con el préstamo que obtendrá piensa invertir en la compra D. mas lubricantes. Aldy esta ahorrando para seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Community Bank Cangallo Corazón is part of the Wari I project. The partners are from the Cangallo province, located 110 kilometers outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho. The town has approximately 600 inhabitants, and the community's economy relies on growing fruits such as avocados and pears, as well as grains. The partners have various businesses. For example, Marlene lives with her partner and her son, who is nine months old. She sells clothing at markets, and began her business because she needed to generate income for her home. Since the Community Bank started, her business has been improving. Marlene is saving for her son's education and to build a home. Celia is married and has two children, who are nine and four years old, respectively. She sells food, and began her business with help from her husband. Celia dreams of improving her business and starting a restaurant. She is saving to buy tables and chairs for her future restaurant. Aldy is married and has four children. She previously sold clothing, but because she didn't generate good earnings she decided to change industries and sell fuel. Her sales are now improving. With this loan she's thinking of investing in lubricants. Aldy is saving to continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing, rice, sugar, oil, livestock, fuel, and grains.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene un puesto de venta en la localidad de Mallasa (a 15 minutos al sur de La Paz) y también trabaja como asistente de abogado, es la única que genera ingresos en su familia ya que cuenta con una hija en edad universitaria.
Vive en la zona de Villa San Antonio Bajo de la Ciudad de La Paz, en alquiler 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo ( compra de pasankalla, refrescos, tarjetas de llamadas telefónicas y dulces).
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005.
texts.en:
Sonia has a retail stall in Mallasa (located 15 minutes south of La Paz) and she also works as a lawyer's assistant. She is the only one that generates income for her family as she has a college-aged daughter. Sonia rents her home which is located in the Villa San Antonia Bajo zone in the city of La Paz. This loan will be used as working capital to purchase pasankalla corn, soft drinks, phone cards and candies. This is the third time that she receives a loan with IMPRO and her credit history qualifies her as a client 1 which means that she has a good record of repaying her loans. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2005.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, phone cards and candies for resale at her stall.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 26 years old and single. She sells hair extensions and hair cream. She hopes to expand this business. She needs a loan of N60,000 to purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions and hair cream

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja hace 11 años y medio, es madre de 2 hijos con los que vive en su casa. Sus padres fueron agricultores y ella heredó sus tierras de cultivo con la responsabilidad del labrado de la tierra, siendo su única fuente para generarse ingresos económicos y para el sostenimiento de su familia. En consecuencia Norma se levanta cerca de las 5 de la mañana para preparar los alimentos para que a las 8 de la mañana pueda llevar su ganado al campo y así le alcanze el tiempo para llevar el almuerzo a su esposo, el cual trabaja en la chacra, ayudándolo, con la siembra de habas, papas y maíz. Pero algunas veces se le presentan dificultades; como la rancha (plaga que se ocasiona por la exesiva lluvia, ocasionando que el gusano afecte directamente el fruto), por ello tiene que estar verificando constantemente sus cultivos y de ese modo tratar de contrarrestar los males que acechan su chacra y así salvar sus cosechas. A Norma le agrada la agricultura aunque no siempre gane tanto como se lo propone, sus planes a corto y largo plazo están basados en las ganancias de su producción. Norma tiene el cargo de vocal en el banco comunal al que pertenece, este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita es para comprar abono, nitratos y demás pesticidas para contrarrestar al gusano que asecha su chacra de habas y así logre obtener su producto en buen estado para que sea atractivo para la venta.
texts.en:
Norma is 28 years old and has lived with her husband for 11.5 years. She is the mother of two children who live in her home. Her parents were farmers and she inherited their land along with the responsibility to work that land, being the only her only source to generate income for herself and support her family. Consequently Norma gets up around 5 in the morning to prepare meals so that at 8 in the morning she can take her cattle to pasture and in this way have enough time to take her husband lunch. He works on the farm, helping with the planting of beans, potatoes, and corn. But sometimes they have difficulty; as when the mold from excessive rain causes the worms to affect the crop, so he has to be constantly checking his crops and in this way attempt to prevent the pestilences that can affect the farm and in this way save his crops. Normal likes farming even though she doesn’t always earn as much money as she hopes. Her short term and long term plans are based on her earnings from her crop production. Norma has the spokesperson position in her communal bank. This is her second loan with MFP and in all this time she has demonstrated great responsibility with her payments. The money she seeks is to buy fertilizer, nitrates, and other pesticides to counteract the worm that affects her bean crop and in this way be able to have her products be good quality and attractive for its sale.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 44 years old, married, and has 6 children. She sells drinks and she has been in this business for a long time. She needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase drinks to sell. She says "thanks" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía recibe una renta mensual del Magisterio ya que es profesora jubilada. Es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta.
Vive en la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz, en anticrético
El crédito será destinado para el aumento de un anticrético (Anticrético es una figura legal por la que el dueño de casa, a cambio de una suma estipulada de dinero, concede una habitación, o un departamento completo, o toda la casa a un inquilino que podrá vivir por un lapso de dos años en dicho inmueble y al cabo del tiempo del contrato, el dueño de casa se compromete a devolver el dinero original) y poder ampliar su vivienda y sus condiciones de habitat.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Sofia receives a salary from the university because she is a retired professor. This is the only source of income on which she counts on. Sofia lives in the Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz in "anticretico". ["Anticretico" is a legal arrangement by which the owner of a house, in exchange of a stipulated sum of money, grants a room, an apartment or a home to a renter who is allowed to live there for a period of two years and at the end of the contract term the owner of the house promises to return the original sum of money] The loan she is requesting will be used to increase the "anticretico" to allow her to expand her home. This is the second time that Sofia requests a loan from IMPRO. Her credit history qualifies her as a client 1 which means that she has a good record of repaying her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of money for an "anticretico" contract.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is 41 years old and lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Hussein has been selling new and used spare parts. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and tools for his business. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.
His previous loan helped him improve his income. Hussein is special in his work because of his good reputation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Hussein will use the loan to purchase merchandise and tools for his business.

loans.name: Ramez

texts.en:
Ramez is a 62 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife. Ramez has owned a grocery store for a few years. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. Ramez has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always repaid his loans on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his business as well as his financial situation. Ramez is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and he also stays open until late in the evening. In the future, he plans on improving and expanding his business.

loans.use: Ramez will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos, y es la única que genera ingresos ya que esta separada de su esposo.
Vive en la zona de Villa San Antonio Bajo de la Ciudad de La Paz, en alquiler 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo ( compra de perfumes y cosméticos), para continuar con su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con este crédito tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Janet dedicates herself to the sale of perfumes and cosmetics. She is the only one that generates income because she is separated from her husband. She rents her home which is located in the Villa San Antonio Bajo zone in the city of La Paz. The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase perfumes and cosmetics to carry on her business and obtain better profits. This is the first time Janet requests a loan from IMPRO. With this loan she will have the opportunity to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more perfumes and cosmetics for resale in her business.

loans.name: Sol Naciente De Paccha Group

texts.es:
El Banco Sol Naciente de Paccha es parte del proyecto Wari I, las socias son de la comunidad de Pacchacc, distrito de Vischongo, Provincia de Vilcashuaman, la comunidad se encuentra a una altitud de 3230 m.s.n.m. tiene aproximadamente 60 familias, la actividad económica mas primordial es la agricultura y también se dedican al comercio de animales y cereales.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es el caso de Marlene que es casada, tiene 4 hijos, Marlene se dedica a la crianza de cuy y también la compra y venta de animales menores como el cuy, el préstamo que obtendrá será para aumentar su mercadería y comprar medicina para sus cuyes, los sueños de Marlene seguir trabajando para brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
Por otro lado Luisa es casada, tiene 6 hijos, Luisa tiene una tienda de abarrotes, Luisa es docente jubilada, tiene una hija que estudia para Cheff y es quien le genera mas gastos, Luisa espera que su hija culmine sus estudios e implementar un restaurante, el préstamo que obtendrá lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio.
Mientras que Carmen es casada, tiene 4 hijos, Carmen se dedica a la  venta de coca y también a la venta de pollos para crianza, con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara mas pollos y hoja de coca, los sueños de Carmen es que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Sol Naciente de Paccha Bank is part of the Wari I project. The partners are from a community in Pacchacc,in the Vischongo district of the Vilcashuaman province. The community is at an altitude of 3230 meters above sea level and has approximately 60 families. The basic economic activity is agriculture, including livestock and grains. The partners have various businesses. Marlene is married and has four children. She raises guinea pigs and also trades in other livestock. She'll use this loan to increase her merchandise and buy medicine for her guinea pigs. Marlene dreams of continuing to work in order to provide her children with a good education. Luisa is married and has four children. She is a retired teacher, and now owns a grocery store. One of her daughters is studying to be a chef and she generates the most income for the family. Luisa hopes that her daughter can finish her studies and open a restaurant. She'll use the loan to invest in merchandise for her store. Carmen is married, with four children. She sells coca, and chicks to be raised for eggs and meat. She'll use this loan to buy more chickens and coca leaves. Carmen dreams of her children continuing their studies and becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cuy, medicine, coca, chicken, rice, sugar, noodles, and oil.

loans.name: Las Mujeres Unidas De Fernando Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas D. Fernando” lleva trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya  mas D. un año, sus integrantes ya realizan una actividad productiva, reciben un crédito promedio D. 600.000 y lo utilizaran para ampliar y diversificar lo que ya estan realizando como ser: la compra D. hojas D. palma en el caso D. las artesanas , compra D. insumos para la fabricacion D. comestibles, compra D. leche azucar,yerba,harina,sal panificados y verduras para su posterior venta,compra venta D. bebidas como refrescos , gaseosas ,cervezas, vinos etc. 

Nombre y Apellido	Actividad
Roque León	Vta D. mercaderías  varias
Francisca D. A. 	Modista
Maria Irene M.	Vta D. carbón
Aurelia B.	Vta D. cosméticos
Sonia V.	Vta D. artesanias
Olga D. S.	Vta D. artesania
Mercedes V.  	Vta D. ropas
Daniela U. 	Vta D. artesania
Salvadora V.	Vta D. comestibles
Merarda D. S.	Vta D. merceria
Mirna V.	Vta D. Chipas
Limpia D. R.	Vta D. comestibles
Gissela S.	Vta D. ropas
Sofia N.	Vta D. chipas
Regina A.	Fca y venta D. productos D. limpieza
Teresa P.	Vta D. comestibles
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas D. Fernando” committee has been working with the Fundación Paraguaya for more than a year. Its members are productively working, each receives a loan averaging 600.000 and it will be used to expand and diversify what they are doing, such as: artisans buying palm leaves, buying materials to make food, buying milk, sugar, tea, flour, salt, baked goods and vegetables to resell, buying beverages such as soda pop, beer, wine, etc. Name, Activity Roque León, Sell general merchandise Francisca D. Acostal, Seamstress Maria Irene M., Sell fuel Aurelia B., Sell cosmetics Sonia V., Sell artisan products Olga D. S., Sell artisan products Mercedes V., Sell clothing Daniela U., Sell artisan products Salvadora V., Sell food Merarda D. S., Sell merchandise Mirna V., Sell “chipas” (a traditional bread) Limpia D. R., Sell food Gissela S., Sell clothing Sofia N., Sell “chipas” (a traditional bread) Regina A., Sell cleaning supplies Teresa P., Sell food

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients, supplies and merchandise for their respective businesses

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino es chofer asalariado, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, y su esposa es costurera y trabaja a domicilio.
Vive en la zona de Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa en anticrético.
El crédito será destinado para el mantenimiento y la compra de repuestos para su vehiculo.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con este crédito mejoran su calidad de vida ya que es con la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta porque su esposa gana  poco.
texts.en:
Marcelino is a salaried driver. He has two school-age children. His wife is a seamstress and works from home. Marcelino lives in the Llojeta zone in the city of La Paz in "anticretico". [Translator's note: "Anticretico" is a legal arrangement by which the owner of a house, in exchange of a stipulated sum of money, grants a room, an apartment or a home to a renter who is allowed to live there for a period of time and at the end of the contract term the owner of the house promises to return the original sum of money.] This loan will be used for spare parts and cost of maintenance for his car. This is the first time that Marcelino has requested a loan from IMPRO. With this loan he will improve his quality of life since his car is the only source of income for his family as his wife earns little.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and purchase of spare parts for his car which he uses in his job as a driver.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: Raúl tiene 40 años de edad, está casado hace 16 años, siendo padre de 7 hijos, de los cuales 5 viven en su casa. La agricultura es parte de las buenas costumbres que le heredaron sus padres, en todo este tiempo ha tratado de sembrar mayor cantidad arvejas y habas, aunque éstas en menor cantidad por ser de menor ganancia. Raúl procura alquilar chacras donde ya hayan crecido papas anteriormente, esto facilita la siembra de arvejas, ya que de un saco de granos de arvejas, llega a cosechar de 50 a 60 sacos, esto lo realiza 3 veces como máximo en la misma chacra. Pero no todo es bueno, ya que Raúl en ciertas oportunidades se ve amenazado por las plagas que se implantan en las chacras por la excesiva lluvia, y tambien la helada (clima helado), sabiendo que si la rancha ataca a sus cultivos, se puede contrarrestar con funguicidas y pesticidas, pero con la helada no hay solución alguna para salvar los cultivos. Raúl está muy feliz con sus cultivos de arvejas, pese a las dificultades que tiene, los precios lo alientan a seguir sembrando, ya que son muy rentables para él. Él es secretario de su banco comunal, en cada una de las reuniones está encargado de redactar todos los acuerdos, este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo viene pagando puntualmente sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para sembrar nuevamente arvejas y con la venta de ellas comprar semillas. Raúl nos comenta su alegría por habérsele otorgado el crédito, lo que le permite seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Raúl is 40 years old, married for 16 years, and is the father of 7 children, 5 of whom are still at home. Farming is part of the good habits he inherited from his parents, he has always tried to grow a large quantity of peas and beans, even though these in smaller quantity products smaller profits. Raúl was able to rent farms where they previously grew potatoes, and this facilitated growing peas, as from one sack of pea seeds he can harvest 50-60 sacks, and this he does at the most 3 times on the same farmland. But not all is well, as Raúl has been threatened by various plagues on his fields because of excessive rain, and also frost (in this cold climate), knowing that if a pestilence attacks his crops, he can use fungicides and pesticides, but with the frost there isn’t a way to save his crops. Raúl is very happy with his pea crops, despite the difficulties that he has, the prices support him continuing to grow this crop as they are very profitable for him. He is secretary of his communal bank; at each of the meetings he is in charge of recording all the agreements. This is his 2nd loan with MFP, and all this time he has been punctual with his payments. The money he seeks is to buy fertilizer for his next pea planting and with the sales of his peas buy seeds. Raúl tells us he is happy to be given a loan as it enables him to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children. He produces sheets of aluminum roofing. He needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase a cutting machine. He says "thanks" to the Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase a cutting machine

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos maneja un microbus que es de propiedad de sus padres y trabaja de lunes a domingo ya que es la única fuente de ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares porque esta casado y tiene a cargo un hijo en edad universitaria.
Vive en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz, en la casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de repuestos y mantenimiento del microbús.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. El análisis del flujo de caja permite ver que Carlos no tendrá problemas en el repago del crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos drives a minibus that belongs to his parents. He works Monday through Sunday because this is the only source of income to pay for his family's expenses. He is married and supports his son who is in college. Carlos lives in the Alto San Pedro zone in the city of La Paz in his parents' home. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase spare parts and for maintenance of his minibus. This is the first time that he requests a loan from IMPRO. The analysis of his cash flow demonstrates that Carlos will not have problems repaying the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts and maintenance of his minibus.

loans.name: Yessi

texts.es: Yessi tiene 21 años de edad, está separada hace un año de su pareja, tiene un niño con el cual actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres, que es donde realiza su negocio. Desde muy pequeña apoyó a sus padres en el cultivo de sus chacras, y desde que decidió formar una nueva familia empezó a dedicarse a la agricultura. Paralelamente se dedica a la atención de su bodega, la cual hace 2 años le trasfirieron sus padres, desde entonces Yessi está tratando de incrementar su mercadería, en cuanto a la adquisición de bebidas y abarrotes, ya que están resultando muy rentables más que la venta sola de abarrotes. Este negocio le encanta porque su dinero está en constante movimiento, esto le alienta a seguir en este negocio, por ello le pone todo el empeño a abrir antes de las 6 de la mañana y se queda hasta las diez, ya que ha esas horas realiza el cultivo de sus plantas. Asimismo ayuda a pastar los ganados a su madre.  Sus miras a futuro son incrementar la mercadería de su negocio y sembrar arvejas y demás productos en grandes cantidades, para de ese modo convertirse en una prospera comerciante. Yessi es muy activa en su banco comunal llamado “Campo Verde”, tiene el cargo de tesorera. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo demostró responsabilidad en la labor encomendada y en los pagos que viene realizando sin caer en mora. El dinero que solicita es para surtir su bodega con abarrotes y demás golosinas. Yessi está agradecida con las personas que hacen posible este préstamo porque le permite seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Yessi is 21 years old and separated from her husband one year ago. She has a son and together they live in her parent's house where Yessi has her business. Since she was little, Yessi has helped her parents in the fields and since she decided to form her own family, she has dedicated herself to agriculture. At the same time, she also attended to her store which she has run for the last two years since her parents transferred it to her. Yessi tried to increase the merchandise in the store, including acquiring more drinks and groceries which has resulted in better sales and profits than just groceries alone. Yessi loves this business because money is constantly in motion and this encourages her to keep with the business. For this reason she opens the store before 6 am every day and stays until 10 pm (at which time she cares for her plants). At the same time, she helps her mother graze cattle. Yessi's hops for the future are to increase the inventory in her store, plant peas, and sell more products in greater quantities so that she can become a prosperous businesswoman. Yessi is very active in her village bank, called "Campo Verde", where she is the treasurer. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and in this time she has shown her responsibility through the work in this position and by making her payments on time. The money she is soliciting is to stock her store with groceries and candies. Yessi is grateful to the people that make this loan possible because it allows her to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Kusi Ayllu Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Kusi Ayllu que significa Familia Alegre en quechua, pertenece al Proyecto Wari I, las socias son del distrito D. Vilcashuaman, se ubica a 3400 m.s.n.m. la comunidad cuenta con un aproximado D. 700 habitantes, la comunidad se dedica a la venta D. animales, abarrotes, también a la agricultura, ganadería, siendo los cultivos primordiales el maíz, papa, trigo, cebada.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es el caso D. Graciela que es casada, tiene  6 hijos, Graciela venD. abarrotes en su casa, además venD. loceria, en el banco comunal esta aprendiendo a ahorrar, el préstamo que obtendrá será invertido en la compra tazas, platos, Graciela sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, y esta ahorrando para comprar una casa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Por otro lado Berta es casada, tiene 5 hijos, Berta se dedica a la venta D. comida en las diferentes ferias, con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara arroz, azúcar, fideo por sacos, los sueños D. Berta son mejorar su negocio y tener una restaurante.
Mientras que Celestina es casada, tiene 4 hijos, Celestina se dedica a la venta D. carnes en un kiosco del mercado vecinal, los animales los compra D. las comunidades y los beneficia ella misma. Celestina en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, Celestina con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara animales, los sueños D. Celestina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio sea granD..
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Kusi Ayllu, which means Happy Family in Quechua, belongs to Project Wari I, the members are from Vilcashuaman District, which is located 3400 meters above sea level. The community has approximately 700 inhabitants and the community is engaged in the sale of animals, groceries, also agriculture, livestock, the primary crops being corn, potato, wheat and barley. The members have various businesses, as is the case with Graciela, who is married and has 6 children. Graciela sells groceries at home,she also sells chinaware. In the communal bank she is learning to save, the loan that she will obtain will be invested in purchasing cups and dishes. Graciela dreams of her children becoming professionals, and she is saving to buy a house in the city of Ayacucho. On the other hand Berta is married and has 5 children, Berta sells food at various markets, with the loan she will buy rice, sugar and bags of noodles. Berta's dreams are to improve her business and have a restaurant. Meanwhile, Celestina is married and has 4 children. Celestina sells meat in a kiosk in the neighborhood market, the neighborhood convenience store market, the purchase of animal communities and benefit them. Celestina learned to save at the community bank and the loan will be used to purchase animals. Celestina dreams that her children become professionals and that her business is great.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, milk, candy, dishes, cups, wheat, corn, animals.

loans.name: Oscar William

texts.es: El señor Oscar William L. habita en el Kilómetro. 16 carretera hacia ticuantepe junto a su esposa y hijos, el es comerciante de lácteos, la esposa trabaja como domestica en una casa privada para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones del negocio para obtener mejores ganancia. Los sueños del Sr. Oscar es llegar ser distribuidor de la empresa de Parmalat. El solicito un financiamiento  para poder comprar más productos ya que tiene una demanda y a la vez la entrega en pulperías cercanas.
texts.en:
Señor Oscar William L. lives with his wife and children at kilometre 16 on the Ticuantepe highway. He sells dairy products, and his wife works as a maid in a private house to help with their household expenses. Sr. Oscar’s plan is to improve his business and thus earn more money for his family. His dream is to become a distributor for the company Parmalat. He is asking for a loan to buy more products that are in demand, and as well, deliver them to nearby stores.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy products such as cheese, cream, milk etc.

loans.name: Tembiapora Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo de  la desintegracion de dos comites en la cual era integrantes la señora Rosa Maria B. y Teodora G.. .
El presente comité se encuentra, en su octavo ciclo. Podemos hablar de la Sra.Teodora G. 40 años , tiene 5 hijo que se queda con la hermana mayor en la casa mintras ella se  va a vender sus comidas por la calurosa zona de Viñas Cue alrededor de su barrio.Por la tarde tiene ventas de dulces que sale en compañía de su hijo menor llamado Carlos con venta de tortas caseras hecha por Doña Teodora.
Ella es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un dia a dia muy pesado  por que viene al abasto a hacer sus compras a las cuatro de la madrugada con su hijo de doce años y al llegar a su casa prepara sus empanadas , tortillas , croquetas para el desayuno de unos albañiles a quienes le prepara para sus desayunos.  
Tiene una casita  pequeña hecha de materiales precarias como pedazos de maderas y chapas.De esta manera ella ayuda a su pareja con los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos.
En una de sus entrevistas y reuniones semanales, ella nos cuenta que ,”Agradezco a la Fundacion Paraguaya por ayudarme a mi y a mi familia a progresar y  tambien a mi comunidad”termina diciendo.


Nombre y Apellido	Actividad
Rosa Maria B. 	Costurera
Pabla Lucila P. 	Vta de Frutas y verduras
Teodora G.	Venta de Comestible
Dionisia Cano B.  	Vta de ropas usadas
Beatriz Britez C. 	Vta de detergentes y otros

Irma Modesta P..	Venta de Crochet 
 Aquilina F. 	Vta de remedios yuyos
Cinthia S. 	Venta de lenceria
Jorgelina G. 	Venta de comidas
Andrea Lorena B..
	Peluquera
Rosa V.	Vta de scarpin
Elida C.	Vta de comestibles
Mirian M.	Vta de articulos de ferreteria
Guillermina M.   	Vta de manualidades
Georgina F.  	Vta de cosmeticos 
Verena Leticia B.  	Vta de frutas
Silvia Aranda R. 	 Vta de cosmeticos
Silvia Teodora M.  	Vta de articulos de limpieza
texts.en:
This group is made of members from two previous groups no longer active which were headed by Rosa Maria B. and Teodora G.. . The current group is in its eighth loan cycle. We can tell you about Teodora G.: 40 years old with five children who lives with her older sister from which she goes to sell her food in the hot area of Viñas Cue, near her neighbourhood. In the afternoons she sells sweets with her young son Carlos, such as home-made pies made by Teodora. She is a long-suffering woman who has a hard life: at 4:00 A.M. she goes to the wholesale food market to make her purchases with her 12-year-old son and returns home to prepare empanadas [meat patties], tortillas, croquettes for breakfast for some construction workers whom she prepares breakfast for. She has a small little house made of unstable materials such as bits of wood and plywood. In this way she helps her partner with the household expenses and the expenses for her children. In one of her interviews and at weekly meetings she has told us: "I am grateful to Fundacion Paraguaya for their help for myself and my family as well as my community". Name and Activity Rosa Maria B. - dressmaker Pabla Lucila P. - sells fruits and vegetables Teodora G. - sells food Dionisia Cano B. - sells used clothing Beatriz Britez C. - sells cleaning products etc. Irma Modesta P.. - sells crochet Aquilina F. - sells herbal remedies Cinthia S. - sells lingerie Jorgelina G. - sells food Andrea Lorena B.. - hairstylist Rosa V. - sells socks Elida C. - sells foodstuffs Mirian M. - sells hardware Guillermina M. - sells handicrafts Georgina F. - sells cosmetics Verena Leticia B. - sells fruit Silvia Aranda R. - sells cosmetics Silvia Teodora M. - sells cleaning products

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seamstress made-to-measure clothing and sheets to retail. Cleaning products such as detergents, shampoo, cream rinse.

loans.name: Yudy

texts.es: Yudy tiene 22 años de edad, vive hace 3 años con su pareja, y hace tres años migró al pueblo llamado Huasahuasi donde vive en una casa alquilada. Luego que su padre fuera a trabajar de peón a las chacras del pueblo de Huasahuasi (zona denominada “Capital de la papa del Perú”), notó que no habían negocios de comida, como por ejemplo desayunos para los agricultores; entonces de regreso a su hogar comunicó a su familia la idea de ser pioneros en la venta de comida; como jugos de maca, quinua, leche y sándwich diversos, para de ese modo captar ganancias para su economía. Se inició con una carreta pequeña preparando desayunos al paso, logrando una  buena aceptación, debido a ello, su madre migró hacia ese lugar y puso otra carreta, pero esta vez de guisos. Es así que Yudy sigue con el negocio familiar que en todo este tiempo le ha resultado muy rentable, por ello empieza su actividad de dos y media a cinco de la mañana, instalándose en el parque de la zona, donde todos sus clientes la esperan, hasta las diez de la mañana que es cuando termina con la venta. Yudy se siente muy contenta con su negocio, sus metas próximas son de aperturar un nuevo negocio con la venta de bebidas en un local alquilado. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y le han delegado el cargo de vocal, que promete cumplir con mucha responsabilidad, del mismo modo hace el compromiso de pagar todas sus cuotas en las fechas programadas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de harina de maca y de soya para sus mates y jugos, y otra parte la usará para iniciar su negocio de venta de bebidas.
texts.en:
Yudy is 22 years old and has lived with her partner for the past 3 years. She migrated to a town called Huasahuasi 3 years ago, where she lives in a rented house. When her father went to work as a labourer in the farmland of Huasahuasi (a region known as the potato capital of Peru), she noted that there weren't any businesses selling meals, for example breakfast for the farmers. When she returned home she told her family her idea that they could be pioneers in the sale of food, including the juice of maca (a nutritionally rich root vegetable which grows in the high mountains of Peru), quinoa, milk and a variety of sandwiches. In this way they could gain income. She started with a small cart preparing quick breakfasts. Achieving a good response, her mother then migrated to the town to run another cart, but this time selling stews. It is in this way that Yudy continues with the family business that has been very profitable during all of this time. She starts working between 2.30am and 5.00am, locating her cart in the neighbourhood park where all her customers wait for her. She works through until 10.00am, when she finishes her sales for the day. Yudy is very happy with her business. Her goal for the near future is to open a new business selling drinks in a rented shopfront. This is her first loan with MFP, and she has been delegated the role of a member, and is committed to responsibly fulfilling this role. In the same manner she is committed to making all of her repayments on the designated dates. The money she is seeking is to purchase maca flour and soy for her hot drinks and juices, while she will use another part of the money to start her new business selling drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her meals and invest in her new business

loans.name: Verdes

texts.en: D. is 32 years old, single, and has no children. He rents a plot of land to carry out his plant nursery, and he lives at the same site. The business location is in the Criuleni district and now he wants to increase his business. He decided to take out a loan from MicroInvest to increase his working capital to develop and increase his sales in 2009. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase seeds and to pay for the rent. He is sure that he will earn a profit from his sales at the wholesale market.

loans.use: To buy seeds and to pay rent

loans.name: Dennis

texts.es: Dennis se dedica a la agricultura independientemente desde hace 2 años, el principal producto de su cosecha es la papa, la cual vende a los principales mercados tanto para su ciudad como para la ciudad capital. De esta manera percibe las ganancias de 6 meses de trabajo continuo y esforzado, lo bueno es que en todo este tiempo su esfuerzo ha dado buenos frutos por lo que tiene planes de mejorar su producción para los próximos meses. Es la primera vez que Dennos tiene un préstamo con MFP, fue admitido para formar parte de su banco comunal por han notado que es un joven trabajador, responsable y puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que está solicitando es para arrendar un puesto en el mercado de su misma localidad, y  de esta manera tener una plaza disponible para ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Dennis has worked as an independent farmer for the last two years. His principal crop is potatoes which he sells in the main markets of his town as well as in the capital city. In this way he earns money for six months of continuous hard work. The good thing is that his hard work has borne fruit so he has made plans to increase production in the following months. This is the first time that Dennis has asked for a loan from Kiva partner MFP. He was allowed to join the community bank as members noted that he is a hardworking young man and is responsible and punctual in paying back the loan. The money that he is asking for is to lease a stall in the market in his town so he has a regular spot from which to offer his products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a stall in the market

loans.name: Elizabhet

texts.es: Elizabhet tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Tiene una bodega que instaló en su misma casa hace 10 años, empezó este negocio para incrementar sus  ganancias, en un inicio vendía al menudeo por kilos a sus vecinos, pero ahora ya tiene más surtida su tienda donde acuden sus clientes a comprar. Además, también tiene animales que criar, todos los días, muy temprano, recoge el pasto para la alimentación de estos, para luego estar dedicada durante toda la mañana a la atención de su tienda, y por las tardes estar pendiente de sus tierras de cultivo. Ahora Elizabhet está proyectándose para mejorar sus ganancias, por lo que está convencida de seguir esforzándose para el crecimiento de su bodega. Es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, durante un tiempo se retiró de su banco comunal por motivos personales, pero por las buenas referencias que dejó a sus demás compañeros la han vuelto a invitar para formar parte nuevamente de su equipo. Elizabhet está solicitando esta cantidad para invertirla en la compra de mercadería por el valor de 400 soles en 2 sacos de abarrotes, y con 200 soles comprará un cerdo más para criarlo y luego venderlo.
texts.en:
Elizabhet is 37 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. She operates a grocery store that she set up in her home 10 years ago. She began this business to increase their income. In the beginning, retail sales to her neighbors were by the kilo, but now her store has a greater assortment for her customers to buy. She also raises animals, and very early each day she fetches fodder for their diet so that she can then dedicate the morning to her store. In the afternoons she helps tend the fields they cultivate. Elizabhet is projecting increased profits because of her commitment to work hard for the continued growth of her grocery business. This is the third time that she has had a loan with MFP. She previously withdrew from the communal bank for personal reasons, but because of her excellent references, her companions have once again invited her to participate on their team. Elizabhet is requesting these funds to invest in the purchase of merchandise: 400 soles for 2 sacks of groceries and 200 soles to buy a hog she will raise and later sell.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Víctor Manuel Álvarez tiene la edad de 35 años habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla , junto a su esposa e hijos , la esposa de don víctor trabaja como comerciante de ropa para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ya que el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace veinte  años , sus padres le inculcaron como trabajar la tierras , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos los cuales estudian todavía su primaria , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ya que desea brindarle mas comodidad, con esta solicitud del crédito va invertir en comprar fertilizantes y venenos para mejorar el cultivo. Y a si vender a buen precio en el mercado
texts.en:
35-year old Señor Víctor Manuel Álvarez lives with his wife and children in the neighbourhood of Juan Ramón Padilla. His wife sells clothing to help with household expenses, while he has been a farmer for 20 years. His parents taught him how to work the land. Señor Víctor and his wife have two children who are still at primary school. Their plan for the future is to improve the living conditions of the family and make life more comfortable. With the loan, Sr. Víctor will buy fertilizer and pesticide to improve his crops which he will then sell for a good price at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Hansen

texts.es: Hansen tiene 31, vive con su madre y hermanos en L. casa propia D. sus padres. Se dedica a las tareas agrícolas desD. hace 5 años D. manera independiente, ya que desD. niño realizó esta labor apoyando a sus padres. Su trabajo diario consiste en velar por sus tierras D. cultivo para asegurar una buena cosecha libre D. plagas, como lo hizo recientemente aplicando insecticidas (se muestra en L. foto los sacos ya utilizados), él cultiva los principales productos que se dan en su zona y D. variada calidad. Hansen sabe que las ganancias en L. agricultura se dan después D. 6 meses  aproximadamente, por lo que consiguió un trabajo D. medio tiempo que le permite obtener ganancias para optimizar su producción, trabaja en L. municipalidad D. su localidad por las tardes. Ahora tiene proyectos D. seguir emprendiendo su desarrollo, y uno D. ellos es invertir en un nuevo negocio para mejorar L. producción D. sus cosechas, hasta el momento  su forma D. trabajo le ha brindado buenas ganancias, ya que sus cosechas las lleva a vender por grandes cantidades a L. ciudad capital. Es L. tercera vez que Hansen tiene un préstamo con MFP, es uno D. los integrantes más responsables D. su banco comunal, y siempre ha impulsado un trabajo ordenado y honesto a los demás compañeros D. su grupo. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en L. compra D. fertilizantes para sus tierras D. cultivo, y también para el alquiler D. un stand D. ventas en el centro D. Huancayo. Con 1000 soles comprará los fertilizantes, con otros 1000 arrendará el stand y los 1500 será como parte del pago D. una máquina fotocopiadora para empezar a brindar este servicio.
texts.en:
31-year old Hansen lives with his mother and siblings in his parents’ own house. He has been working as an independent farmer for the last five years, the same kind of work he has done since he was a child helping his parents. Every day he checks his fields to make sure his crops are free from pests. Recently he applied insecticiD. (the used bags are shown in the photo). He grows a range of the crops best suited to the area. Hansen knows that profit from agriculture is realised after six months, so he has found a temporary job to earn money during that time. He works in the local municipality office in the afternoons. Currently he has more projects in development, one of which is investing in a new business to improve crop production. He is doing well from this method of working; he now takes his abundant harvests to sell in the capital and earns a good profit from them. This is the third time that Hansen has asked for a loan from Kiva partner MFP. He is one of the most responsible members of the community bank, and he has always worked in a disciplined and honest manner with the other members of the bank. The money that he is asking for will be used to buy fertilizer for his fields, and also to rent a stall in the centre of Huancayo. 1000 soles will be used for fertilizer, 1000 soles to lease a stall, and 1500 soles as part-payment for a photocopying machine to start a new business providing photocopying services.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to lease a market stall

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Alejandro Torres  vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Aida Chuilla y su hijo.
El señor Alejandro es rentista de la administración publica, y su esposa es comerciante en un mercadito de su zona.
El crédito solicitado es para el trazado y traslado de tierra de la parte posterior de su vivienda, nivelado que posibilitara una nueva construcción y la estabilización del suelo.
Esta es la octava vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 1998.
texts.en:
Alejandro Torres has his own house, in the Pasankeri zone on the west side of the city of La Paz, with his wife, Aida Alejandra lives on a pension from the local municipality and his wife is a merchant in a small market in their area. The loan will be used for the leveling and hauling of soil from the back of his house, which will make possible building on it and putting down a floor. This is the eighth loan that they have requested and the socioeconomic analysis performed qualifies them favorably to receive this loan. He has been a client of IMPRO since 1998.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for leveling ground and hauling of soil from rear of house

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La señora Betty Y. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Tacagua, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo y sus dos hijas.
La señora Betty es cocinera, siendo empleada de un snack hasta el año pasado, buscando mejores ingresos,  esta instalando una pensión en su zona, la misma que requiere de arreglos para su funcionamiento.
El crédito es para la refacción de muros y ventilación de la pensión. Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Betty Y. lives in her parent's house with her husband and two daughters, in the Tacagua area, on the west side of the city of La Paza. Betty is a cook, being employed in a small restaurant until last year. Looking for better income, she is setting up her own small restaurant in her area, that requires repairs to be able to use. The loan is for the repair of walls and ventilation in the restaurant. This is the first loan that she has requested and the socioecomonic analysis performed favorably qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of walls and ventilation in order to set up a restaurant

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 39 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la casa de su suegra. El arte del bordado siempre fue lo que le llamaba la atención desde jovencita, tuvo la oportunidad de trabajar bordando hace 4 años desde que conoció a su mejor amiga, quien le enseñó esta labor y la impulsó para trabajar bordando prendas para exportación, pues todos los días tienen grandes cantidades pedidos que realizar. Desde entonces, viene trabajando todos los días dentro de su hogar donde puede sentirse cómoda junto a sus seres queridos. Lo difícil de su trabajo es cumplir con las grandes cantidades de prendas pues es muy cansado mantener su mano trabajando al mismo ritmo continuamente. Gladys espera que en el fututo pueda tener un taller de bordados, donde las máquinas puedan ayudarla a producir mayores cantidades de prendas. Hace 4 años que trabaja con MFP, y está muy contenta de formar tan bonito grupo de trabajo junto a sus amigas. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará para comprar mayor cantidad de materiales; como hilos y telas para sus bordados.
texts.en:
39-year old Gladys lives with her husband and two children in her mother-in-law’s house. The art of embroidery has always attracted her ever since she was a child. She got the opportunity to work in embroidery four years ago when she met her best friend who taught her how to do it. Her friend encouraged her to embroider clothes for export as they always have a large number of orders to complete. Since then, she has been working every day from her home where she feels comfortable close to her beloved family. The difficult part of her work is to complete the large number of clothing orders since it is very tiring for her hand to maintain the constant rhythm. Gladys hopes in the future to have her own embroidery workshop where machines can help her produce a larger quantity of clothing. Four years ago she started working with Kiva partner MFP and is very happy to be part of such a nice group and to be working alongside her friends. The money she is asking for will be used to buy a larger quantity of supplies such as thread and material for her embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy embroidery supplies

loans.name: Aline

texts.es:
La señora Aline A. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Villa Pavón, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Daniel Vásquez y sus dos hijos.
La señora Aline es secretaria en un consultorio medico particular, y su esposo es empleado en una veterinaria de su zona.
Con el crédito anterior construyeron dos habitaciones en obra fina, las que están habitando.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una cocina y el pasillo de ingreso a su vivienda.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Aline A. lives in her parent's house, located in the Villa Pavón area on the west side of La Paz, with her husband Daniel Vásquez and her two children. Aline is a secretary in a private medical office and her husband is an employee in a veterinarian's office. With their previous loan they build the two bedrooms that they are now using. The loan that they are requesting is to be used for building a kitchen and an entrance walkway to their house. This is the second time that they have requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis performed favorably qualifies them to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a kitchen and entrance walkway to their house

loans.name: Karla Vanesa

texts.es: La señora Karla Vannessa González Martines tiene la edad de 29 años habita el barrio las enramadas ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe , ella es madre soltera a su cargo tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian , una de las hijas de doña Karla estudia su secundaria y después de clases le ayuda en el mercado a despachar sus variedades de ropa, zapatos y otros articulo que vende, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar la infraestructura del negocio ya que esto le permite mejores condiciones para sus ventas como para brindar un buen servicios a sus clientes. Con esta solicitud de crédito es para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su vivienda. Gracias a los prestamos que Afodenic ha otorgado ha logrado poder hacer su vivienda en mejores condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Ms.Karla Vannessa González Martines is 29 years old and lives in the neighborhood Las Enramadas located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother who has two children who both study, one of Ms. Karla's daughters studies in secondary school and after classes she helps in the market to sell varieties of clothes, shoes and other items that they sell. Her plans for the future are to improve the business infrastructure to allow for better conditions for her sales so she can provide good services to her clients. This request for credit is to purchase construction materials to make improvements to her home. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic she has been able to make her home better for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 39 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Desde muy joven le agradó realizar diversas actividades comerciales, con cuyas ganancias instaló ahora una congeladora en su casa, donde vende helados y bebidas a las personas que transitan por su localidad. Para Elsa incrementar sus ganancias es reflejo de buena inversión y trata siempre de administrar adecuadamente su negocio, y para ello está trabajando de la misma forma en la distribución de grandes cantidades de bebidas para diversas festividades, pues los pedidos son grandes y le permiten tener grandes ganancias. Su deseo a futuro es convertirse en una distribuidora de reparto al por mayor, sin dejar de lado las metas que tiene de poner una tienda en su casa para vender diversos productos de primera necesidad. Este es su cuarto préstamo, viene trabajando tres años con MFP, institución que le ayudó a mejorar su negocio y a tener amistades en su localidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de bebidas a las empresas distribuidoras para atender sus diversos pedidos.
texts.en:
Elsa is 39 years old. She and her husband live in their own house with their two children. Ever since she was young, she has partaken in various business activities. From those profits, she has been able to set up a refrigerator in her house to sell ice cream and soft drinks to the people who pass through her neighborhood. For Elsa, increasing her profits is a reflection of a good investment, and she always tries to manage her business adequately. For this reason, he has been distributing great amounts of soft drinks for all occasions. Because her orders are big, she is able to earn big profits. Her future plan is to become a wholesale distributor, without setting aside the goal she has of setting up a general store inside her home in which she can sell basic need items. This is her fourth loan with MFP, the institution that helped her improve her business and establish friendships in her neighborhood. With this loan money, she will purchase a greater amount of soft drinks from suppliers so that she can fill her orders.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Bulat

texts.en:
This is Bulat S.. She is 34 years old and her main activity is raising cattle. She learned this skill from her brother who was involved in this business for more than 5 years. He raised cattle and sold them to meat suppliers who paid quite well. S. is married and has two children, a boy who is 13 years old and a girl who is 11 years old. Both are pupils and they dream of becoming doctors in the future. Tto support her children, Serafina decide to borrow from MicroInvest to increase the number of cattle. She presently has 3 cows but she wants to sell them to the meat suppliers. 

S. thanks MicroInvest for the loan, and MicroInvest thanks the Kiva lenders who help our entrepreneurs.

loans.use: increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
El señor Wilson vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Arturo Borda de la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que el realiza es el ensamblaje de computadoras y mantenimiento de computadoras, además de esta actividad Wilson tiene una librería en la zona central.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de papel Bond y así poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ya que su la librería está ubicada justo  frente a la facultad de arquitectura.

Es cliente de Impro desde enero de 2008 y por su actividad puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Wilson lives in his parent's house in Alto Sopocachi in the the city of La Paz. He works assembling and repairing computer; he also has a bookstore downtown. The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of Bond paper to be able to satisfy his clients' demand, since his bookstore is located just across from the university's architecture department. He has been a client of Impro since January 2008 and with his business he is eligible to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Bond paper to sell in his bookstore

loans.name: Chepa

texts.es:
La señora Chepa vive en casa propia en la calle Vincenti de la zona de alto sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene un puesto de venta en el Mercado Bolívar de la zona de Tembladerani, en este lugar ella vende todo tipo de productos como ser arroz, fideo, azúcar, aceite, etc. El crédito que solicita es para comprar más mercadería para su negocio ya que debido a la alza de precios que sufrió nuestro País ella se descapitalizó y ahora necesita ayuda. 

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 1998; sus historial de pagos es muy bueno y  su actividad comercial le permite  acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Chepa has her own house in the Alto Sopocachi neighborhood of La Paz. She has a booth in the Bolívar market in the Tembladerani neighborhood in which she sells all types of products such as rice, noodles, sugar, oil, etc. The loan that she is requesting is to be used to purchase more merchandise for her business, since with in increase in prices that the country has experience she has lost business capital and now needs helps. She has been a client of Impro since 1998. Her repayment history is very good and her business activity qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as rice, noodles, sugar and oil for her small store

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 45 years old, married, and has 5 children. He sells loaves of bread. He has been in this business for a long time. He needs a loan of N150,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. He says "thanks" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase bread

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
La señora Dorotea vive en casa propia con su esposo en la calle Gutiérrez de la zona de alto chijini de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la venta de calzados de cholita en la calle Max Paredes de la zona central , con esta actividad ella mantiene a su familia ya que su esposo  esta mal de la vista y no puede trabajar, tan solo le ayuda a cargar y llevar y traer la mercadería.
El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital para comprar más calzados, ofrecer mayor variedad  y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2000 y por el buen historial que tiene puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Dorotea lives in her own house with her husband in the Alto Chijini neighborhood in the city of La Paz. Her business activity is selling shoes in the traditional "cholita" style on Max Paredes street in the city center. She this activity she is able to support her family; her husband has vision problems and cannot work and can only help her loading and carrying the merchandise. The requested loan will be used to increase her business capital to purchase shoes to offer a wider variety of style and thus increase her income. She has been a client of Impro since 2000 and due to her good repayment history is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes to sell

loans.name: Felix Ruben

texts.es: El señor Félix Rubén M. habita en el Kilómetro 10 ½  Carretera a Masaya junto a su esposa e hijos, la esposa trabaja como conserje en el colegio San Antonio Sur  para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, el Sr. Felix M. desde hace quince años es docente del mismo colegio imparte clases a niños de primaria  por las mañanas y por las tardes es profesor de educación física del mismo. El esta contento ya que tiene cuatro ciclos trabajando con Afodenic y ha logrado darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, poco a poco con el financiamiento ha logrado hacer parte de la vivienda y con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción  para hacer división de cuartos. Y poder tener más privacidad. a futuro espera seguir aumentado su casa.
texts.en:
Mr Felix M. Ruben lives at Kilometer 10 ½ on the highway to Masaya together with his wife and children; his wife works as a janitor at the school San Antonio Sur. To support the household expenses, for the last 15 years Mr. Felix M. has taught at the same school teaching classes to children in primary school in the mornings and in the afternoons he teaches physical education. He is happy because he has had four cycles working with Afodenic and has managed to give a better life to his family, little by little with the financing he has been able to make part of the house and with this credit he will buy building materials to make a room divider and to have more privacy. In the future he expects to further enhance his home.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to make a room divider

loans.name: Alionza

texts.es: Alioza tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en la casa de su madre. Se dedica al bordado, arte que aprendió gracias a unas amigas, con el tiempo consiguió ser más creativa, y ahora esas amigas están muy contentas de haberle apoyado, pues vendía tamales en los mercados y necesitaba una actividad adicional para incrementar sus ingresos económicos y gracias a este arte recibe todos los días una muy buena cantidad de polos para ser bordados, actividad que realiza en su casa. Sin embargo, sigue dedicándose a la venta de tamales, pues recibe pedidos para diversas fiestas, donde elabora grandes cantidades de este platillo para servir a los invitados. La prioridad de Alioza es instalar un taller de bordados, pues es un negocio muy rentable debido a los pedidos de exportación que están aumentando y contar con  maquinaria adecuada la ayudaría mucho. Ella es cliente de MFP desde hace 4 años, este es su quinto préstamo, el cual le ayudó a relacionarse con las personas y conformar un bonito equipo de trabajo responsable. Aloiza invertirá 1200 soles en comprar materiales para incrementar la cantidad de sus bordados, y con ello aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Alionza is 42 years old and lives with her husband and children in her mother's house. She embroiders for a living, an art that she learned thanks to some friends. Over time she has become more creative with her embroidery, and now these friends are very happy to have helped her. She used to sells tamales in the markets, and needed an additional activity to increase her income. Thanks to this art, everyday she receives a good quantity of polo neck sweaters to be embroidered, an activity which she carries out at home. Nevertheless, she continues selling tamales, as she receives orders for different holidays when large quantities of this dish are served to guests. Alionza's priority is to install an embroidery workshop, as it is a very profitable business thanks to increasing export orders, and having adequate machinery would help her greatly. She has been a client of MFP for four years, and this is her fifth loan. MFP has helped her to build relationships with people and form part of good team that works responsibly. Alionza will use the 1,200 soles to buy materials to increase the quantity of her embroidery, and thus increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase embroidery material

loans.name: Ascencio

texts.es:
El señor Ascencio vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle mantilla de la zona de las lomas de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como carpintero en un taller, donde percibe un salario mínimo, los días sábados y domingos trabaja por cuenta propia arreglando puertas ventanas, etc. La esposa trabaja como empleada de limpieza.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar madera y elaborar muebles a pedido para mejorar sus ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2007, su historial de pagos es muy bueno y por la actividad que desarrolla puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Ascencio lives in his own home with his wife and children in Mantilla St, in the neighborhood of Las Lomas in the city of La Paz. He works as a carpenter in a workshop where he earns the minimum wage. On Saturdays and Sundays he works for himself, fixing doors, windows, etc. His wife works for a cleaning business. He is seeking a loan to buy wood to make furniture orders, so he can increase his income. He has been a client of Impro since 2007. His repayment history is very good, and his work activity gives him access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood and other materials to make furniture orders

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 39 years old, married, and has no children. He sells sunglasses. He hopes to expand this business. He needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more sunglasses to sell. He says "thanks" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase sunglasses

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua P. is 47 years old. She is a married woman with five children - two boys and three girls. She says one of her children is employed, another is currently in the university, and the rest are in the senior high and the primary schools. Akosua’s husband is a cocoa/poultry farmer. She lives with the family in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about a 45 minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. 

Akosua trades in fresh yams and crates of eggs to make some income. According to her, she procures the fresh yams and the eggs from Techiman and Kintampo where the price is quite economical. Akosua sells the yams on a table top in front of her house, mostly to retailers. She has been in business for ten years. Akosua wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure yams and eggs in bulk. She hopes to help her husband improve upon their standard of living and give all their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To procure yams and eggs

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is a fashion designer. She also sells sarongs and tailoring materials. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. Doris is 28 years old, married, and has one child. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell. She says "thanks" to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs and tailoring materials

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa A. is 38 years old. She is a married woman with four children - two boys and two girls. She says one of her children has completed senior high school while the rest are in the junior high and the primary schools. Adwoa’s husband is a mason by profession. She lives with the family in her brothers’ house in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about a 45 minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. Adwoa trades in fresh yams and crates of eggs to make some income. According to her, she procures the fresh yams and the eggs from Techiman and Kintampo where the price is quite economical. Adwoa sells her goods at the market square and also to retailers. She has been in business for five years. Adwoa wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure yams and eggs in bulk. She hopes to help her husband improve upon their standard of living and give all their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To procure yams and eggs

loans.name: Boscaneanu

texts.en: Boscaneanu L. was born in 1975 and her main activity is agriculture. She also grows animals. She is helped by her father who is war veteran and a specialist in agriculture. L. needs money to build a greenhouse for fruit and vegetables because she has a lot of clients who would like to buy both fruit and vegetables from her. She requested a loan from MicroInvest to build the greenhouse so she can have a rich harvest in 2009.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en:
Yaw Oti Mensah is a 47-year-old married man with two daughters. Both daughters are in junior high school. Oti’s wife works to help support the family. She is a food vendor. He lives with his wife and children in a brother-in-law’s house in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about a 45 minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. 

Oti trades in maize. He procures bags of maize from nearby villages at affordable prices. He distributes the maize to the retailers in the market square. Oti also sells to food vendors. Oti has been in this business for five years. He wants a loan to increase his working capital so he can procure bags of maize in bulk to be able to supply to more customers. Oti is hopeful that if he works harder, he will be able to put up his own building and to give his children the best education possible.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Zephaniah

texts.en: Zephaniah is 35 years old and single. He sells second-hand clothes. He needs the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. He says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Cristina Vilma

texts.es:
La Sra. Vilma vive en la zona de Pampahasi al Noroeste de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, es una cliente muy responsable y puntual, y conocida por ello en la institución ya que trabaja con nosotros desde hace varios años.
Se dedica a la de venta lubricantes y al inflado de llantas, asimismo su taller es muy conocido por los transportistas que operan en la zona, ya que vive mucho tiempo allí. Tiene dos hijos que están saliendo profesionales gracias al arduo trabajo de su mamá. La Sra. invertirá en la compra de lubricantes para su taller.
texts.en:
Vilma lives in the Pampahasi area, to the northeast of La Paz, Bolivia. She is a very responsible and punctual client -- and is recognized within the organization for being so, as she has worked with us for many years. Vilma sells motor vehicle fluids and provides a tire inflation service. Her auto maintenance shop is well known among the carriers in the area, seeing Vilma has lived there for a long time. Vilma has two children, who are developing professional carerrs thanks to their mother's hard work. Vilma plans to invest in the purchase of fluids and lubricants for her auto maintenance shop.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of motor vehicle fluids

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia T. is forty-two years old. She is married with six children, two daughters and four sons. She says the last born is currently in senior high school while the rest have all completed school and are engaged in commercial activities.

Cecilia’s husband is a cocoa farmer. Cecilia is a petty trader to make some income to help her husband financially. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about forty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Cecilia sells "gari" and dried pepper. "Gari" is a local delicacy produced from cassava dough. It can be eaten raw with sugar and roasted groundnuts or with cooked beans. She procures bags of gari and dried pepper all the way from the borders of Cote D'Ivoire where she claims the cost is more reasonable.

Cecilia treks to other markets to sell her goods, mostly to food vendors. She says retailers also come to buy from her. Cecilia has been in business for seven years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure bags of maize and pepper in bulk.

loans.use: To buy ‘gari’ and dried pepper for re-sale

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: El señor Carlos C., habita en los altos de Masaya, junto a su esposa y hijos, la esposa es comerciante en el mercado de Masaya desde hace cinco años, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace veinte años, la mayor dificultad que ha tenido es la falta de financiamiento, inicio con sus propios esfuerzos a establecer cultivos. Don C. en futuro quiere comprar más terreno para poder tener mejores ingresos y poder darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia. Con esta solicitud va invertir en la compra de fertilizante para mejorar el cultivo y obtener una mejor producción
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos C. lives in the highlands of Masaya together with his wife and children. His wife has been a trader in the market of Masaya for five years. To support her with household expenses, he has dedicated himself to agriculture for twenty years. The biggest difficulty he has had is the lack of financing; he began with his own efforts to grow crops. Mr. C. wants to buy more land in the future in order to have better income and to give a better life to his family. With this loan request he will invest in the purchase of fertilizer to improve the crops and have better yield.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and poisons to improve yield

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married and has one child. He sells women's clothing at the central market. Vladimir has been in this business for 2 years. He inherited the business from his parents, who are still alive but can not be actively involved in business as they used to be.

Even though Vladimir is new to this business, he has already developed a simple discount policy to retain old customers and attract new ones. Vladimir lives with his wife and daughter in a two-room apartment. He is young and is full of energy to develop this business further, for it is the only income in their family. Vladimir would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to increase the assortment. He plans to increase sales during the coming spring season, and he needs to get ready for it.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah K. is forty–one years old. She is married with three children- two boys and a girl. One child is currently in junior high school, the other two are in primary school. Hannah’s husband is a pastor at a church in their community. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural dominated town. It is about forty – five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. 

Hannah trades crates of eggs to make some income to support her husband financially.  She procures eggs from poultry farms in her community. Hannah sells at the local market square and also treks to other markets to do business. Besides the egg business, Hannah also deals in ready-made textiles.  She has been in business for nine years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital to procure more goods. She hopes to help her husband improve upon their standard of living and give all their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To procure more goods

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
