Grace D. is fifty–one years old. She is widowed and has seven children to care for - four sons and three daughters. She says one of her children has completed university, the others are currently in high school and junior high. Grace lives with her children in a house, she toiled to put up with her late husband, in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural dominated town. It is about forty – five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. 

Grace works very hard to provide for the family since she doesn't receive any help. She is a day nursery teacher/farmer. Apart from these busy activities, Grace is engaged in trading activities. She trades charcoal. She procures bags of charcoal from nearby villages and sells them in her community. Grace says she also deals in textile materials.  She has been in business for seven years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more goods. She hopes to improve upon her families standard of living and give all her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of charcoal

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander B. sells various home products at the central market in Melitopol city. He has been in business for 10 years. He enjoys selling small things that help make home chores easier. Alexander is a very happy and enthusiastic person. With his income, he helps his sisters and their parents whom he lives in one big house. He is not married.

Alexander would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase his inventories. He always tries to have a large assortment of small home products to offer something to each client that comes his way.

loans.use: To increase his inventories

loans.name: Lesbia Elisalda

texts.es:
La microempresaria Lesbia Elisalda B. P. ha trabajado en la venta de ropa por muchos años.  Siempre había querido su propio negocio, y hace 5 años logró a establecer una venta de ropa usada en el Barrio Central de la ciudad de Bluefields.  La ropa que ella vende es de los EEUU y la compra de Managua.  Con este negocio bien establecido, Lesbia tiene una buena red de clientes habituales, y ella los avisa cuando tiene una paca nueva.  

Lesbia es casada y tiene 4 hijos.  Su esposo es chaufer de taxi y ayuda en los gastos para la familia.  Lesbia ya ha recibido un préstamo de ADEPHCA y lo usó para aumentar su negocio y no tenía ningún problema con los pagos del préstamo.  Porque tuvo tanto éxito con el primer préstamo, ella está pidiendo más esta vez.  Con este dinero, va a comprar una paca de ropa niño por US$ 200, una paca de ropa adulto por US$ 150, una paca de sábanas por US$ 150, y una paca de toallas por US$ 100.  Ha vendido la mayoría de estas cosas en el pasado, pero va a usar parte de este préstamo para aumentar su negocio para incluir sábanas, que nunca ha vendido y tiene clientes pidiéndolas.  

Lesbia tiene muchos sueños para su familia.  Ahora tiene una casa de madera, y le gustaría hacerla de cemento.  También, tiene hijos que quieren ir a universidades buenas en la ciudad de León, que queda en otra parte de Nicaragua.  Ella dice que esto es costoso y difícil, pero quiere lo mejor para sus hijos y sigue trabajando duro para ellos.
texts.en:
Small-businesswoman Lesbia Elisalda B. has worked in clothing sales for many years. She had always wanted her own business, and 5 years ago she established one selling used clothing in the Barrio Central neighborhood of the city of Bluefields. The clothing she buys is from the United States and she buys it in Managua. With this business being well-established, Lesbia has a good network of habitual customers, and she lets them know when she has a new bundle of clothing. Lesbia is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a taxi driver and helps with the family’s expenses. Lesbia has already received a loan from ADEPHCA and she used it to grow her business and she had no troubles with the payments for the loan. Since she had such success with the first loan, she is requesting another. With this money, she will buy a bale of children’s clothing for US $200.00, a bale of adult clothing for US$150.00, a bale of sheets for US$150.00, and a bale of towels for US$100. She has sold the majority of these things in the past, but she will use a part of this loan to grown her business to include sheets, which she has never sold but which customers are requesting. Lesbia has many dreams for her family. She currently has a wooden house, and she would like to build one of cement. Also, she has children who want to go to good universities in the city of León, which is located in a different area Nicaragua. She says it is difficult and expensive, but she wants the best for her children and so she keeps working hard for them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one bundle each of children's clothing, adult clothing, sheets, and towels.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence S. is thirty-one years old. She is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. She says that the boy is currently in the basic school and the girl has not started school yet. Her husband is a mason. 

Florence trades to earn some income to support her husband financially. She lives with the family in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agriculturally dominated town. It is about forty-five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. 

Florence sells onions, dried pepper and other vegetables. She buys the onions and the dried pepper from a central business town called Kumasi in the Ashanti Region. She treks to other markets and sells her goods mostly to food vendors. She says that retailers buy from her, too. Florence has been in business for six years. 

She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can buy bags of onions and pepper in bulk.

loans.use: To buy onions and vegetables

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James K. is 23 years old. He is single, very hardworking, and dedicated to his work. James has been a carpenter for the past three years. Carpentry has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his upkeep. He owns a carpentry shop where he manufactures all kinds of things pertaining to furniture, such as a group of chairs, a wardrobe and a bed. 

He says that he doesn't have enough money to finance most of the orders from his customers. He says that this slows down his work because hehas to wait for funds from his customers before he begins the work, which often causes delays. 

He is requesting a loan to buy working tools and furnishing materials like polish, glue, sand paper, and wooden boards to improve on his efficiency. He believes this will improve his income and ensure good living. It has been his dream to be one of the best carpenters in the community where he lives. And he also has the zeal to support the youth in his neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy carpentry tools and and materials

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose T. is 48 years old. She is a married woman with three children. Two have completed the junior high school and the last born is in primary school. She lives with her family at Wasa Simpa in the western region of Ghana. 

For the past three years, Rose has been baking bread and supplying it to the villages around. She also sells some to individuals. Demand for the bread has increased as a result of constant supply and just-in-time delivery. Her customers book their order in advance and it is ready before they come. She says that the price of commodities is rising, which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market and the daily demand for bread is high. She says she bakes almost 700 loaves of bread in a day. 

Rose needs a loan to buy more flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood to restock her inventory. Rose belongs to a village bank called ‘St Martin’s’. She also hope to receive GH¢700 to improve her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy baking materials

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is twenty-eight years. She is single and lives at Wasa Simpa in the western region of Ghana. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood and also sells cosmetics. Florence is a very skillful and talented hair dresser. Through the innovative touches she adds to her customer’s hair, she has attracted lots of clients who come to have their hair done. Florence has been in this business for the past five years and has significant experience in customer care.

She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service. Therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, and activators to serve her customers. Florence belongs to a village bank called ‘St Martin’s’. She also hope to receive GH¢800 to improve her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, and activators.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
A. Gloria is a 42-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of two children who are currently in school. Through hard work, A. support for her children's education. She is a food vendor who sells kenkey (corn dumpling) in her neighborhood for the past eight years now. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains that cooked and eaten with hot pepper, gravy stew, or other types of soup and fried fish or meat. She has many customers, because many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. She has added the sale of soft drinks and grocery products to her product line. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, like maize, meat, fish, rice, vegetables and firewood. As a part of her business expansion, A. has added cooked rice and stew to her product line. She said most of her customers requested rice, so she saw it as an opportunity. 

She hopes to raise more income to support her children so they can enter university. A. belongs to a village bank called ‘Joy’. She also hope to receive GH¢700 to improve her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Maritza Bernarda

texts.es: Maritza Bernarda S. Chavarría tiene 45 años, su estado civil es soltera. Y tiene 3 hijos. Todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Maritza es la venta de comida. Hace mas de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y dio comienzo a esta actividad en su casa de habitación, y con la ayuda de los préstamos logro ampliar su negocio. Los propósitos para su  negocio es innovar con nuevas comidas y que sus clientes disfruten su comida. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que sin el dinero no puede lograr sus objetivos además tiene que realizar las compras de carnes, verduras y granos básicos. Doña Maritza desea poseer un restaurante para ofrecer su deliciosa comida. La cantidad  solicitada es de C$ 3.500 córdobas a un plazo de 6 meses.
texts.en:
Maritza Bernarda S. Chavarría is a 45-year-old single mother of three children. All of her children attend school. Maritza's area of work is food sales. She has been selling food for more than 15 years. She began selling food out of her home and, with help in the form of loans, managed to expand her business. Maritza is proposing to introduce new dishes to her menu, to ensure her clients enjoy their meals. The loan will be used for working capital, which is needed for her to achieve her goals: she needs a loan to purchase meats, vegetables and basic grains. Maritza wants to own a restaurant where she can serve her delicious foods. She is requesting 3,500 córdobas [approximately US$ 175], which she will pay back in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 12 dish drainers, 12 chairs with armrests, 1 box of plastic dishware, and 1 set of aluminum cooking pots

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Married with two children who are currently in school, Doris T. is 26 years old. She sells food, such as eggs, maize and maize flour in the local market of Wasa Simpa in the western region of Ghana where she lives. She boils the eggs and sells them by the road side in the lorry station with pepper. She uses maize flour to prepare banku (corn paste) and kenkey (corn dumplings).

She started selling  several years ago and she has lots of selling experience to win customers. Doris is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her kids with quality education for their future careers. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more maize to prepare maize flour and eggs to serve her customers. Doris belongs to a village bank called ‘Joy’. She hope to receive GH¢600 to improve business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more maize, eggs and cassava flour

loans.name: Maria Licet

texts.es: María Licet C. tiene 43 años, su estado civil es soltera, tiene 2 hijos. La actividad económica a la que Doña María se dedica es la venta de ropa y costura. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Su propósito para su negocio es invertir en más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes la mejor calidad en ropa. El préstamo lo solicita para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar la compra de productos como tela, hilo, tijeras y otros productos para la elaboración de sus prendas de vestir. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 5.500 a un plazo de 8 meses.
texts.en:
María Licet C. is a 43-year-old single mother of two children. Her area of work is clothing sales and dressmaking, which she has done for more than three years. María's plans for her business include investing in more products, to offer her clients higher quality clothing. She is requesting a loan for working capital, which she needs to purchase goods such as fabric, thread and other materials used to make clothing. She is requesting 5,500 córdobas [approximately US$ 275], which she will pay back in eight months.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la Sra.Ester Caballero que es grupo San Blas , quien le comento acerca de la Fundacion y del programa a la Sra Liz Elvira R. Noguera. 
Podemos hablar de la Sra. Del Rocio Antonia Ovelar, tiene 28años, con 3 hijos, ella vive en una casa precaria hecho de tabla y techo de chapas, tambien vive con ella su madre, la Sra. Del Rocio se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras por el Asentamientos y por los barrios .Ella hace su compra del mercado de Abasto se va a las 4:00 de madrugada se y regresa a su casa para las 6:00 de la mañana y realiza su recorrida con su hijo mayor, mientras los otros se queda al cuidado de la abuela.
La Sra.Del Rocio dice que hay poner empeño y coraje para sobresalir adelante, y con esta ayuda que le da la Fundacion espera ella va salir adelante con sus hijos. 

Nº	Nombre y Apellido	Actividad

2	Nicolasa B.. 	Vta de tappers

	Vta de Ropa.

texts.en:
The San Blas Group was formed thanks to Mrs. Ester Caballero, who told Mrs. Liz Elvira R. Noguera about the Foundation and the program. We can talk about Mrs. Antonia Ovelar Del Rocio. She is 28 years old, has 3 children, and lives in a poorly constructed house made of boards with a sheet metal roof. Her mother, Mrs. Del Rocio, also lives with her. She works selling fruit and vegetables in the settlements and neighborhoods. She buys her merchandise from the basic provisions market at 4:00 am and returns home at 6:00 am to complete her sales circuit with her oldest son while the other children stay under their grandma's care. Mrs. Del Rocio says that she has to put forth a lot of determination and courage to get ahead, and with the help that the Foundation gives her she hopes to get ahead with her children. Number Name and Last Name Activity 1 Aidalina C. M. Fruit and vegetable sales 2 Nicolasa B. Plastic storage sales 3 Lorenza M. de C. Food sales 4 Emelinda Orue G. Grocery 5 Lilian Maria A. Dressmaker 17 Alicia B. de G. Sales of Avon products

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery sales of: noodles, rice, flour, oil, powdered soap, salt; Sales of herbal remedies: mint, perdudilla, horsetail, anise, tarope,santa lucia, burrito, malva, salvia, etc.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
La Señor Victor Raúl B. de 38 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Remanso de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa, posee un automovil Chevet modelo del añoi 1981 que utiliza para la compra de mercaderías para surtir su Despensa.- 
Esta casado hace 10 años con la señora María Cristina Vera de B. su cónyuge quien también se dedica a la misma actividad y le ayuda para la economía familiar, tienen 2 hijos una niña de 8 años y un nene 7 meses. La hija concurre a una escuela pública en el tercer grado.
El negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio sito en las calles Buenos Aires Nº 138 c/ Paso Medin y Av. Von Poleski del Barrio Remanso de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa camino a San Antonio., es casi la única Despensa en los alrrededores, además recientemente tienen nuevos vecinos de un asentamiento nuevo que son todos clientes suyos. 
El Sr. Victor B., retira el préstamo para la compra de varios mercaderías como Embutidos como panchos, chorizos, Fiambre, Carnes vacunos de diferentes cortes, (carnaza de 1a, de 2a, ) pollo(alita de pollo, puchero de pollo), Suavizante para ropa, Jabón de tocador, jabón en polvo, Pañal Desechable, Yogurth, Leche, Leche en Sachet, Yerba, Azúcar, Chocolate, Jugo Ades, Gaseosas, Cervezas, Vino, verduras varias como: tomates, locotes, cebollas, papas, lechuga, y frutas: Banana, naranjas, melones, piñas, ciruelas,etc.
El Sr. Victor se levanta a las 4:00 de la mañana y se dirije con su automovil al Mercado Central de Abastos de donde se provee de sus mercaderías, llega alli aproximadamente a las 05:00 Hs A.M. A fin de comprar todo lo que necesita para su negocio. 
Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente el negocio, en lo que se refiere a la venta de Bebidas como Cervezas y Gaseosas.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor Raúl B., a 38-year-old man who lives in the Remanso neighborhood of the city of Villa Elisa, has his own 1981 Chevet, which he uses to purchase goods to stock his general store.

He has been married for 10 years with Ms. María Cristina Vera de B., who helps out with the family business in order to cover the family expenses. They have 2 children—an 8-year-old daughter and a 7-month-old son. Their daughter currently attends the third grade at the local public school.

The business is located inside their own home on Buenos Aires Street in Villa Elisa. Theirs is almost the only general store in the area. Furthermore, they recently got new neighbors, who are now their customers, from a newly constructed housing development nearby.

Mr. Victor B. is seeking this loan in order to purchase provisions, such as sausages (i.e. hot dogs and chorizo—seasoned pork sausage), cold cuts, different cuts of beef, chicken, fabric softener, bars of soap, detergent, disposable diapers, yogurt, milk, milk in a bag, herbs, sugar, chocolate, juice, soft drinks, beer, wine, vegetables (tomatoes, bell peppers, onions, potatoes, lettuce), fruit (bananas, oranges, melons, pineapples, plums), etc.

Victor gets up a 4am, gets in his car, and drives down to the Central Wholesale Market, where he obtains his products. He arrives at approximately 5am so that he can get everything he needs for his business.

One of his aspirations is to expand his business soon so that he can sell more beverages, such as beer and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase provisions for his business

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes B. tiene 40 años, su estado civil es casada. Tiene 2 hijos. Y todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica de María es la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y dio inicio por el deseo de ayudar con los gastos de su casa ya que poseía empleo y necesitaba ingresos para su familia. Los propósitos que Doña María tiene para su negocio son de establecerse en un lugar mejor para sus clientes. El préstamo es solicitado para la compra de más productos nuevos y de mejor calidad. Sus deseos son de mantener su negocio ya que por medio de su negocio ha logrado obtener lo necesario. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 10.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
María Mercedes B. is 40 years old and married, with two children. Both of her children attend school. María sells clothing for women and men, which she has done for seven years. She began selling clothes because she wanted to help out with household expenses and already had a job, but needed additional income for her family. María's plans for her business include moving to a location which is more convenient for her clients. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of additional new and higher-quality products. She would like to keep her business going, seeing it is the means by which she has managed to take care of her needs. The loan amount requested is 10,000 córdobas [about US $500], which María will pay back in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa Z. D. tiene 43 años, esta acompañada. Tiene 6 hijos. Y Todos sus hijos trabajan. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería en la que vende los productos de pan, golosinas, refrescos y gaseosa. Hace más de siete años que se dedica a este oficio. Los propósitos para su negocio incrementar su pulpería y solo podrá realizarlo con la ayuda de los financiamientos. El financiamiento será utilizado para la compra de más productos que son necesarios para el uso diario. Los sueños para su negocio son de poseer otra pulpería y obtener otra fuente de ingresos para su familia. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 12.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa Z. D. is 43 years old, has six children and lives with her partner. All of her children work. Candida has a local convenience shop where she sells bread, sweets and soft drinks. She has been doing this for seven years. Candida's plans for her business are to grow her shop and she can do this only with financial support. This loan will be used for the purchase of additional products necessary for daily use. Candida's dreams for her business are to own a second shop and have another source of income for her family. The amount requested is 12,000 córdobas [about US $600], which will be paid back in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Chaipe surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación. Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser : Venta de Ropas, Venta de mercaderías comestibles, venta de Bijoutery, despensa, venta , venta de frutas y verduras, venta de manteles, venta de plásticos, venta de cosméticos y otros . El monto que recibe cada señora varía de 300.000 a 2.000.000, todas las señoras destinan el crédito para las actividades que ya estan realizando actualmente.

texts.en:
This group from the neighbourhood of Barrio Chaipe was created because one of its members found out about the Foundation. All the women are active in productive businesses such as: clothing sales, food sales, jewelry sales, grocery store, general sales, fruits and vegetable sales, tablecloth sales, plastics sales, cosmetics and others. Each woman will receive between 300,000 to 2,000,00; all the women will use their loan for their current business. 1. Hermelinda Gómez- Grocery store 2. María Estela M.- Jewelry sales 3. Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing; foodstuffs such as flour, oil, noodles, herbs, cigarettes, drinks, meats; jewelry; fruits and vegetables; cosmetics; and items to stock a grocery store.

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es: La solicitante es la Sra Mirta agüero la misma es casada tiene 3 hijos todos trabajan y ayuda a la unidad familiar. La misma es microempresaria se dedica al servicio de Bar hospedaje denominado San Luis en la Ciudad De Yatytay km 16 cuenta con 20 años antigüedad en rubro. Esta solicitando de nuestra asistencia destino de la operación compra de mercaderias, harina aceite carne , y articulos de limpieza la de 3MM a 12 meses.
texts.en:
The applicant is Mrs. Mirta Agüero who is married and has 3 children, all of whom work and help the family unit. She is a micro-entrepreneur who works in service at the Bar-Lodge called San Luis in the city of Yatytay kilometer 16 and has 20 years in this area. She is asking for our support for the purchase of merchandise, flour, oil, meat and cleaning products with 3 million Guarani over 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, beer, flour, meat etc.

loans.name: Joaquin Alberto

texts.es: Joaquín Alberto M. López tiene 46 años, esta casado. Y tiene 3 hijos. Todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica de Don Joaquín es joyero. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Don Joaquín tiene el propósito de ampliar su negocio ya que este es muy pequeño y se encuentra en su casa de habitación. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita la materia prima para la elaboración de las joyas. Su sueño es de poseer otro negocio y que sus hijos lo administren. la cantidad solicitada es de C$ 7.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Joaquín Alberto M. López is 46 years old and married with three children. All of his children attend school. For more than 20 years Joaquín has been a jeweler. His plans for his business include expanding it, seeing the business is very small and is run out of his home. The loan requested will be used for working capital, which Joaquín needs to purchase materials for making jewelry. Joaquín dreams of owning a second business and hopes his children one day will manage it. He is requesting 7,000 córdobas [about US $350], which he will pay back in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 55  años de edad, vive  en pareja con Nemesio Torres de 57 años de edad, viven en  casa propia, tienen  dos hijos, todos mayores de edad y profesionales, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres.
Lucila se dedica a la venta de maderas para la construcción de viviendas, se dedica al ramo hace más de 15 años.

Realiza las ventas en su local propio que funciona en la ciudad de Paraguari. Su esposo le ayuda en el negocio y a la par se dedica a la música debido a que canta en un grupo de mariachis de la ciudad.
Gracias al esfuerzo y empeño puesto por ambos, hoy día ya cuentan con varios vehículos de su propiedad, así como casas y terrenos. También el negocio va creciendo día a día.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de madera y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes
texts.en:
Lucila is 55 years old and lives together with Nemesio Torres who is 57 years old. They live in their own home and have two children, both of whom are adults and professionals thanks to their parents’ effort. Lucila works selling wood for home construction and she has worked in this field for more than 15 years. She carries out sales in her own locale which operates in the city of Paraguari. Her husband helps her in the business and also works in music as he sings in a group of mariachis in the city. Thanks to the effort and hard work of both, today they have various vehicles as their property as well as houses and land. The business also grows day by day. She needs a loan to purchase the wood in order to satisfy the demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés tiene 33  años de edad, vive  en pareja con Gladys Aguero de 32 años de edad, viven en  casa propia, tienen un hijo de 3 años .
Moisés empezó desde muy joven a trabajar con su padre como vendedor,  luego adquirió una pequeña camioneta y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia hace más de cinco años.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de mercaderías de todo tipo, las cuales distribuye en un camión de su propiedad por las compañías de la ciudad de Paraguari.
Gracias a su esfuerzo ya cuenta con buena clientela bien formada y además le da trabajo a dos primos suyos, quienes cobran de acuerdo a las ventas realizadas.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de harina, arroz, azúcar, bebidas, etc.
texts.en:
Moisés is 33 years of age and lives with his partner Gladys Aguero who is 32 years old. They live in their own home and have a son who is 3 years old. From a young age Moisés started to work with his father as a salesman. He then acquired a small truck and began to work independently more than five years ago. He currently works selling all kinds of merchandise, which he distributes in his truck to companies of the city of Paraguari. Thanks to his effort he already has a well developed clientele and in addition employs two of his cousins, who earn according to their sales. He needs a loan to buy flour, rice, sugar, drinks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, rice, sugar, drinks etc. to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Rehana Kosar M. Javed Group

texts.en:
Rehana Kosar baji is a 25-year-old married woman and has been a citizen Borewala, Pakistan for the past 6 years. Her husband, M.J., is a delivery man. He uses his donkey cart to transport items from one place to another. 

Rehana baji has two daughters. Neither are school-aged. Her husband’s earning is insufficient, which forced her to do some work. She prepares embroidered dresses and takes care of her daughters as well. She charges $3 per embroidered dress. She is applying for a loan for her husband because his cart has become rough and it doesn’t allow him to load anything. 

She is the leader of a group of women in her locality. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Kishwar baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her parlor. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle, like a tuk-tuk). Sawran baji wants a loan to by a donkey cart for loading. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: 'Baji,' which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Naziran M. Habib Group

texts.en:
Naziran baji is a 55-year-old married woman who has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 35 years. Her husband, M. H., works in a factory. Naziran baji is the mother of three sons. Her eldest son has a dairy business. The next son sells jackets. Her younger son works in a clinic. 

Naziran baji belongs to a family of farmers. For this reason, she helps her son by getting milk from the buffalo in her old age. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her milk-selling business.

She is a the leader of a group of women in her locality. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Naseem Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Hafizan baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Razia Begum baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her milk-selling business

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La sra. Maria incio el negocio, porque es una persona mayor de edad y por esta razon le fue muy dificil encontrara trabajo, ya que no pueden contratarla en una empresa facilmente, auqnue ella un se siente fuerte para trabajar, su edad era un impedimento,  ante tal situacion ella opto por abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes,  junto a su esposo y así seguir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida, poco a poco ha logrado hacer mas clientes gracias a que brinadn un buen servicio. 

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3500 que pagara en 8 catorcenas para comprar mercancia y surtir bien su negocio para tener mas variedad de productos y así tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
Maria started her own business because she is a senior citizen and it was very difficult for her to find a job. She could not be contracted by a company easily, and although she feels strong enough to work her age was an impediment. Facing this situation, she opted to open a small grocery store together with her husband, and in this way move forward and improve their quality of life. Little by little she has attracted more customers by offering good service. She is seeking a loan of $3,500 pesos which she will repay in 8 fortnightly installments. She will use the loan to purchase merchandise and restock her business so that the variety of products will attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima M. Hanif Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima baji is a 58-year-old married woman who has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 35 years. Her husband, M. H., has run a tea stall in the community for the past 3 years. Fatima baji is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her son drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Her daughter is 12 years old and reads in 8th standard. 

Fatima baji is a seamstress. She sews clothes to share the financial burden of her husband. She successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her son. 

She is a the leader of a group of women in her locality. Mukhtaran baji wants a loan to buy an animal to sell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy a lath machine. Another woman, also named Mukhtaran baji, wants a loan to buy leather to sell. 

 This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: 'Baji,' which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Fozia Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Fozia baji, the wife of N. A. and lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 22 years. Fozia baji quit school after completing her 8th standard because she paid more attention to household chores than studies. Her husband runs a shop where he sells embroidery material (beads, laces and colored thread). He has a very good variety that attracts a large number of customers. 

Fozia baji successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more embroidered material to sell. 

She is a the leader of a group of women in her locality. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy fruit for her fruit business. Tahira bano wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for her motorbike rental business. Rashidan baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy embroidered material to sell

loans.name: Ameena M. Saleem Group

texts.en:
Ameena baji is a 40-year-old married woman and a citizen of a Borewala, Pakistan for the past 26 years. Her husband's name is M. S., and he has a business selling seasonal vegetables. He has been selling vegetables for the past 10 years. Ameena baji is the mother of two sons. Her sons are getting an education from a school that is located near their house. Ameena baji is a midwife. She learned this art from her mother. Ameena baji is applying for a loan to buy medicine for her work. 

She is the group leader of more women in this area. Sugran baji would like a loan to buy clothes for her clothing sales business. Abida baji would like a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. RaZ. baji would like a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. NaZ. baji would like a loan to buy perfumes for her perfume shop. Gulzaran baji would like a loan to buy spare parts for motorbikes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one anothers' loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Najma Munir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Najma baji is a 44-year-old married woman. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 44 years. Her husband's name is M. A.. He is a driver by profession and drives a 32-seat local bus. Najma baji is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. All of her children are getting an education. Najma baji pays their school fees from her business sewing clothes. She sews clothes by taking orders from her relatives and from her neighbors. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s vehicle so that he is able to continue his work. 

She is the group leader of more women in her area. Naseem akhtar baji would like a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Shaheen baji would like a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Sakina baji would like a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Muafia baji would like a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair the 32-seat bus

loans.name: Imtiaz M. Aslam Group

texts.en:
Imtiaz baji is a 48-year-old married woman and a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 25 years. Her husband's name is M. A., and he has a business selling animals for meat. He buys animals from animal markets and sells them to the butcher shops to earn a profit. Imtiaz baji is the mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. All of her children are getting an education from a school located near her house. Imtiaz baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy animals (goats and sheep) for her husband’s animal selling business. 

She is the group leader of more women in her area. Iqbal begum baji would like a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Salma baji would like a loan to buy leather to sell. Khatoon baji would like a loan to buy fruits and vegetables for resale. Shamim akhtar baji would like a loan to buy spare parts for motorbikes to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals for resale

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: la Sra. Rosa Elena F. se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 20 años, ella se levanta muy temprano para moler el maiz y luego para la produccion  de tortillas, ella vende su producto en su casa todo el dia, compra cada 8 dias lo necesario para la produccion de la semana, ella viaja al mercado de la ciudad donde compra todos los materiales necesarios para la elaboracion de las tortillas.  Tiene 3 hijas las que le ayudan en su pequeño negocio, ella es viuda su esposo murio hace 10 años, por lo que le ha tocado salir adelante sola con sus 3 hijas, todo esto gracias a su negocio. ella esta muy agradecida por haber encontrado un lugar en el cual le otorguen un credito para poder salir adelante con su negocio y con su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Elena F. has worked selling tortillas for more than 20 years. She gets up very early to grind the corn to then produce the tortillas. She sells her product in her house all day long. Each week she buys what is necessary for the week’s production. She travels to the city market where she buys all of the materials neccesary for making the tortillas. She has three daughters who help her in her small business. She is a widow as her husband died 10 years ago, which is why she has had get ahead alone with her 3 daughters, all of this thanks to her business. She is very thankful for having found a place in which they will grant her a loan to be able to advance with her business and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, lime, firewood and water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shahnaz Sabir Masih Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji is a 30-year-old married woman and a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 12 years. Her husband's name is S. M., and he is a mason by profession. Shahnaz baji is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. None of her children go to school. Shahnaz baji wants to send her children to school but due to her few financial resources she cannot do this. Her husband’s income is very low, so she shares the financial burden by knitting clothes. She successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan for her husband, because her husband wants to start a business selling animals. 

She is the group leader of more women in her area. Sajida parveen baji would like a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Jamila baji would like a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Gulnaz akhtar baji would like a loan to buy animals for her business selling animals. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) to sell

loans.name: Nargis Munawar Masih Group

texts.en:
Nargis baji is a 35-year-old married woman and a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Nargis baji is the mother of five children: four daughters and one son. All of her children are getting an education from a school located near her house. Nargis baji is married to a man whose name is M. M. and he is a mason by profession. Nargis baji is a very supportive lady. She shares the financial burden with her husband by sewing clothes. She charges $2 per dress. She invests her income in a committee because her husband wants to start a milk selling business. She is applying for a loan of PKR 56000 to add to the committee pool to buy a buffalo. 

She is a group leader of more women in her area. Razia begum baji would like a loan to buy wood for her wood selling business. Hanifan baji would like a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Khalida baji would like a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Kosar baji would like a loan to buy iron to make iron rods to sell. Ameeran baji would like a loan to buy goats to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for selling milk

loans.name: Las Legendarias De Chanquil Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Legendarias D. Chanquil, pertenece al Proyecto Wari I, las socias son D. L. comunidad D. Chanquil, distrito D. Morochucos, Provincia D. Cangallo, departamento D. Ayacucho, L. comunidad esta ubicada a 3500 m.s.n.m. tiene una población aproximada D. 250 habitantes, las principales actividades D. L. comunidad son L. crianza D. animales como vacuno, L. agricultura D. papa y cereales.
Las socias realizan diferentes actividades como es el caso D. Julia que es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, Julia tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa y también compra y venD. cereales, Julia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar, los sueños D. Julia son tener una tienda mayorista y que sus hijos salgan adelante.
Mientras que Fortunata es casada, tiene 8 hijos, Fortunata se dedica a L. crianza D. ganado vacuno, produce quesos que venD. en las ferias y también en casa a donD. acuden sus clientes, Fortunata necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. moldes para quesos y un estante para acomodar los quesos, los sueños D. Fortunata son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.
texts.en:
The community bank Las Legendarias D. Chanquil belongs to Project Wari I, the members are from the community of Chanquil, district of Morochucos, Cangallo province, Ayacucho department. The community is located at 3500 meters above sea level and has an estimated population of 250 inhabitants, the main activities of the community are raising animals like cattle, growing potatoes and cereals. The members engage in various activities, as is the case with Julia, who lives with her partner and has 2 children, Julia has a grocery store in her house and also buys and sells grain. Julia needs a loan of 600 soles which will be invested to buy buying rice, sugar. Julia's dreams are to have a wholesale store and that her children succeed. Meanwhile Fortunata is married and has 8 children. Fortunata is dedicated to raising cattle, producing cheeses sold in the markets and also at home where her customers go. Fortunata needs a loan of 300 soles, money will be invested in the purchase of molds for cheese and a shelf to accommodate the cheese. Fortunata's dreams are to proviD. a good education for her children in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase molds for cheese, rice, sugar, grains, animals

loans.name: Naseem Fatima Maqbool Ahmad Ayazi Group

texts.en:
Naseem Fatima baji is a 55-year-old married woman and a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 26 years. She is married to a man whose name is M. A. A., and he is a property dealer. Naseem baji is the mother of four children: one son and three daughters. Her son runs a barber shop. Her daughters are getting an education from a local school which is located near her house. Naseem baji is an older lady so she mostly spends her time on household work. She successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy materials (mirror, chairs, and razors and creams) for her son’s barber shop. 

She is the group leader of more women in her area. Khursheed akhtar baji would like a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sajida baji would like a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. Naziran baji would like a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for a barber shop

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Buena Vista esta integrado por tres miembros, todos vecinos de esta cominidad, ellos se conocen muy bien. las actividades que realizan ellos son las siguientes:
La Sra. Vicenta I. tiene 60 años de edad y tiene a su cargo 3 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela de la comunidad, ella sostiene a su familia y su hogar de la venta de leche que realiza desde hace varios años, 3 para ser exactos.
El Sr. R. tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos y se dedica a la venta de leña, la cual realiza desde hace 8 años, el vive con sus padres, es muy trabajador y les ayuda con los gastos.
EL joven Carlos N. es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres, a los cuales les apoya economicamente con su negocio de venta de agua y leña, esta actividad tiene 13 años de hacerla y le va muy bien, el es muy humilde y quiere ampliar su negocio con el prestamos que esta solicitando.
texts.en:
The Buena Vista group is made up of three members, all of them neighbors in this community and they know each other very well. The activities that they carry out are the following: Mrs. Vicenta I. is 60 years old and is responsible for three children who study in the school in the community. She supports her family and her home through the sale of milk, which she has done for various years, 3 to be exact. Mr. R. is 25 years old, is single, does not have any children and works selling firewood, which he has done for the past 8 years. He lives with his parents, is very hard working and he helps them with their expenses. . The young man Carlos N. is single, has no children and lives with his parents, who he supports economically with his business selling water and firewood. He has done this activity for 13 years and it is going well for him. He is very humble and wants to expand his business with the loan that he is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of milk, firewood and water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar M. Akram Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar is a 31-year-old married woman and a citizen of a Borewala, Pakistan for the past 16 years. Naseem baji is an uneducated lady because she belonged to a poor family and her parents couldn’t bear her educational expenses. Naseem baji is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are getting an education because Naseem baji wants to give her children all the things that she didn’t get. Her wish gives her strength to move ahead and work for it. She has a buffalo and she gets milk from it and than goes to the milk shops to sell the milk. She earns the required income and can easily pay the school fees for her children. Naseem baji is the wife of M. A., who runs a grocery shop in the community. People used to come to him to buy groceries. She successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop. 

She is the group leader of more women in her area. Razia baji would like a loan to buy paint for her paint shop. Ameena baji would like a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Zahida baji would like a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. Tasleem akhtar baji would like a loan to pay off the remaining installments for her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Hermanas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Hermanas” está conformado por las hermanas: Virginia G. y Rosalía G., ambas viven en la zona Noroeste de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia con sus respectivas familias. La Sra. Virginia tiene hijos en edad escolar a quienes cuida dedicadamente y vive junto a su esposos quien le tambien trabaja y entre ambos mantienen a su joven familia. Ambas hermanas se dedican a tejido y bordado de chompas, chalinas, y otras prendas de alpaca, trabajo por el cual son muy reconocidas ya que trabajan bastante tiempo en este rubro. Invertirán el crédito en la compra de materia prima. El fino producto que realizan es vendido principalmente a turistas quienes más aprecian su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group “Sisters” includes the sisters Virginia G. and Rosalía G.. Both live in the northwest area of the city of La Paz, Bolivia with their respective families. Mrs. Virginia has school-age children, who she cares for devotedly, and lives with her husband, who also works. Between the two of them, they care for their young family. Both sisters weave and embroider sweaters, scarves, and other alpaca garments. They are well-known because of their work in this field. They will invest the loan by buying raw materials. They sell their final products mostly to tourists who appreciate their work most.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Santos Gregoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Santos C. vive en la aldea de San Jeronimo, ella es muy humilde y comenzo con su negocio hace 28 años ya que ella tuvo que sacrificarse para salir adelante y asi poder darle a sus hijos estudio, alimentacion y hogar. en total ella tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales 3 son profesionales y le ayudan economicamente, otros 3 estudian en el colegio y los otros 2 se desplazan a distintas aldeas y caserios para vender sus rosquillas (este es su negocio pricipal) ella tambien tiene una pequeña pulperia en la cual vende cosas basicas para los vecinos de la comunidad.
para fabricar las rosquillas ella compra maiz, cuajada, mantequilla, leña.
su esposo le ayuda ya que el se dedica a la agricultura y a la cria de ganado, ellos dos son muy unidos y juntos desean salir adelante para que sus dias sean mejores.
ella con este prestamo quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y tambien mejorar su negocio, asi podra apoyar mas a sus hijos que estudian.
su mayor sueño es que todos sus hijos fueran profesionales para poder desarrollarse en la vida, tambien su otro sueño es que su negocio sea de los mas grandes en la zona para poder tener muchos clientes y muchas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos C. lives in the village of San Jeronimo. She is humble and started her business 48 years ago because she had to make sacrifices to go forward so that she could provide an education, food, and a home for her children. She has 8 children, of whom 3 are professionals and help her financially. Three of her children are in secondary school, and the other 2 moved to other villages and hamlets to sell their ring-shaped pastries, which is their main business. She also has a small store where she sells basic goods for her neighbors in the community. To produce the pastries, she buys corn, curd, butter, and firewood. Her husband helps her by working in agriculture and raises livestock. The two of them are very close, and together, they want to go forward so that their days will be better. With this loan, she wants to improve her quality of life and also to improve her business. In this way, she will be able to support her school-age children. Her biggest dream is that her children will become professionals so that they can improve their lives. Her other dream is for her business to be one of the biggest in the area so that she can have many clients and a lot of earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make ring-shaped pastris and to buy drinks, churros, cookies, candies, lollipops, lard, batteries, toilet paper, and ham.

loans.name: Ghazala M. Arsh Group

texts.en:
Ghazala baji is a 31-year-old married woman and a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 31 years. She is married to a man named M. Arshad and he is a bus driver. Ghazala baji works in a decorative embroidery business. She prepares embroidered clothes with new designs. Ghazala baji has a very artistic mind. She always gives her dresses a new look which attracts a good number of customers. She is applying for a loan to buy an embroidery machine which will help her make new embroidered dresses. 

She is the group leader of more women in her area. Nadeeman baji would like a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business. Niamatay baji would like a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Ameena baji would like a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. Jamila baji would like a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cristo Rey esta integrado por tres personas, todos ellos son vecinos y se conocen desde muy atras y se dedica a actividades diferentes.
La Sra. Gloria es la lider del grupo y tiene 68 años de edad, vive sola y tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos vive en la casa con su madre, el otro vive en Costa Rica, y cuando el puede le envia dinero para que pueda salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos desde hace 10 años.
La Sra. L. vive con sus dos hijos, ellos no estan estudiando en este momento le estan ayudando a su madre con su negocio que es venta de chicharras, ella tiene 55 años de edad, ella se quiere dedicar a la costura y venta de ropa para eso necesita el prestamo, su meta es poder darles estudios a sus dos hijos para que sean profesionales algun dia.
El Sr. Oscar tiene 29 años de edad vive con su madre y tiene dos hijos, la mama les ayuda economicamente. el se dedica  a la venta de lacteos y compra pescado en San Lorenzo para venderlo en diferentes comunidades. el necesita el prestamo  para comprar mas pescado ya que en estos dias la gente come mucho pescado por la epoca de semana santa, de las ganancias quiere comprar unas dos vacas para poder sacarles leche y asi producir lacteos.
texts.en:
The group “Cristo Rey” is made up of three people. All of them are neighbors and have known each other for a very long time. They pursue different activities. Mrs. Gloria is the leader of the group and is 68 years old. She lives by herself and has two children. One of them lives in the house with her mother, and the other lives in Costa Rica. When he can, he sends money so that they can go forward. She has sold cosmetics for 10 years. Mrs. L. lives with her two children. They are not in school at this time; they are helping their mother with her business, in which she sells cicadas. She is 55 years old. She wants to pursue sewing and selling clothes, for which she needs this loan. Her goal is to be able to provide her children with an education so that they can become professionals someday. Mr. Oscar is 29 years old. He lives with her mother and has two children. His mother helps them financially. He sells dairy products and buys fish in San Lorenzo to sell in different communities. He needs this loan to buy more fish since these days people eat a lot of fish for the holy week. From the earnings, he wants to buy two cows so that he can produce milk and, then, produce dairy products.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, dairy products, fish, and fabric and thread for sewing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Daniel Pascual

texts.es:
El Sr. Daniel M., se encuentra en su primera secuencia de créditos, es un cliente recomendado por la Sra. Remedios M. quien es cliente antigua y muy responsable en Emprender.
Daniel trabaja como transportista desde sus 18 años a la fecha tiene 26 años, vive con su mamá, una Sra. de edad, muy sociable, además de sus hermanas y sobrinos, con quienes comparte las horas de descanso y a veces el almuerzo, son una familia muy unida.
El joven adquirió su movilidad con un crédito de otra Institución bancaria y está pagando esa deuda a largo plazo, puntualmente. Dicha movilidad se encuentra trabajando en la Empresa Eurosur como Radio taxi.
Por el buen historial que a la fecha presenta, se aprobó el crédito que solicitó con la garantía personal de su hermana.
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel M., who is in his first sequence of loans, is a client recommended by Mrs. Remedios M., who is an old, very responsible client of Emprender. Daniel has worked as a transportation carrier for 18 years and is 26 years old. He lives with his elderly, friendly mother. They, along with his sisters and nieces and nephews, with whom he spends his leisure time and sometimes lunchtime, are a close-knit family. The youth acquired his vehicle with a loan from another banking institution, and he is paying this debt punctually in long installments. This vehicle is operating in Empresa Eurosur as a Radio taxi. For the good record that he has to date, he was approved for this loan, which he requested with the guarantee of his sister.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To change the shock absorbers in his vehicle

loans.name: Sharifan Ishaq Masih Group
loans.use: To buy animals for selling.

loans.name: Betsaida Rosaly

texts.es: la Sra. C. tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos ellos estudian en la escuela comunal. la Sra. C. tiene de estar en este negocio desde hace 12 años y ha podido obtener una muy buena clientela, debido a su forma de trabajo en el ambito social ella es catalogada como una persona responsable y con buenos principios culturales. uno de sus mayores sueños es que sus hijos sean profesionales graduados de la universidad y con esto todo su esfuerzo de toda su vida seria un trofeo para ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. is 29 years old, is married, and has 4 children, all of whom attend a community school. Mrs. C. has been in this business for 12 years and has been able to acquire a good clientele, because she works in a friendly setting. She is characterized as a responsible person with good cultural principles. One of her biggest dreams is for her children to become professional graduates of the university. With all of her effort during her life, this would be like trophy for her.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Naziran Bashir Ahmad Group
loans.use: To repair auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicles).

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
La Sra. Yanes tiene 57 años de edad, es soltera, tuvo siete hijos los cuales ya se casaron, actualmente tiene 3 nietos y ella los tiene a su cuidado ya que unos de sus hijos se fueron a USA a trabajar y le envian dinero para manterlos.
la Sra. Yanes tiene 17 años de vender abarroterias en la ciudad de Nacaome, en todos estos años ha logrado obtener bastante clientela.
con mucho esfuerzo ella le dio estudio a todos sus hijos y tuvo que trabajar desde joven para poderles dar lo necesario en alimentacion, salud y estudios, en dicha comunidad la conocen como una persona muy luchadora y honrada.
su mayor sueño es vivir una vida en paz y armonia ya que ella tiene mucha pasion por las personas que buscan a Dios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yanes is 57 years old, is single, and has seven children, who are already married. At present, she has 3 children, and she takes care of them because some of her children have gone to the USA to work. They send money to take of them. Mrs. Yanes has sold groceries in the city of Nacaome for 17 years. In all of these years, she has succeeded in acquiring a large clientele. With a lot of effort, she provided for an education for all of her children. She had to work since she was young so that she could provide them with the necessary food, health, and education. In her community, she is known as a hard-working and honest person. Her biggest dream is to live her life in peace and harmony since she has a lot of passion for people who are looking for God.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, corn, salsa, soups, spices, vinegar, juices, drinks, soap, paper, gelatin, churros, cookies, candies, bleach, etc

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Naseem Jahangir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is a 29-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Borewala, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is J. A. and he is a wood seller by profession. He has been selling wood for the past 8 years. Her husband chose this business because there’s no gas in the area. Naseem baji is applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her husband’s wood-selling business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy mason's tools. Haleema begum baji and Sajida baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mussarat baji wants a loan to buy a motorbike to rent out.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood to sell

loans.name: Juana Berta

texts.es:
la Sra. M. tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y tuvo 3 hijos de los cuales 1 de ellos se encuentra en USA y a veces le ayuda enviandole dinero para el sosten del hogar, una hija se encuentra estudiando su cuarto año en la Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Honduras ubicada en Tegucigalpa y la otra se estudia en el cologio y en sus ratos libres acompaña a su madre a vender productos en el mercado.
la Sra. M. Propuso como meta tener su propio negocio desde hace varios años ya que anteriormente trabajaba vendiendo ropa de otras personas era empleada de una tienda de ropa y graicas a Dios ha logrado poner su propio negocio.
su mayor sueño es que sus hijos se graduen de la universidad para que se puedan defender solos en esta vida, tambien ella quiere que su negocio sea bien grande para tener mayores ganancias y asi tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Ms. M. is 48 years old. She is single and has 3 kids. Of the three, one lives in the USA and helps her sometimes by sending her money so that she can support herself and her children at home. One daughter is studying in her fourth year at The National Autonomous University of Honduras, located in Tegucigalpa, and the other child studies at a private school and in her free time she accompanies her mother to sell products in the market. Ms. M. made it a goal to start her own business and after many years of working for someone else selling clothes in a store, thank God, she has been able to start her own business. Her biggest dream is for her kids to graduate from the university and to be able to be on their own and successful. She also dreams of her business growing, so that she can increase her income and have a better life. (Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, sandals, shirts, blouses, underwear, bras, skirts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lazaró René

texts.es: Lázaro René C. R. reside junto a esposa y sus pequeños hijos en San martín. El tiene su propio negocio el cuál consiste en la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en los diferentes mercados y plazas de San Martín, a pesar que su mayor ganancia la obtiene de esta manera, también sabe vender por pedidos previamente realizados. Es por ello que el deseo de Lázaro René, es de obtener un préstamo a través del cuál pueda ser capaz de comprar más telas de diferentes colores de manera que tenga la capacidad de aumentar sus ventas y poder brindarles un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Lázaro René C. R. lives together with his wife and young children in San Martín. He has his own business selling clothing on a roaming basis in the different markets and plazas of San Martín. Although this is his main source of income, he also makes sales based on previous orders. It is for this reason that Lázaro René wishes to obtain a loan to purchase more fabric in different colors, and thus have the capacity to increase his sales and offer his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fabric to increase the production of his business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco González se dedica a la venta de partes de carros usados, y su esposa la señora Rebeca Serrato a la venta de ropa usada estos son los ingresos de su familia. Ellos viven actualmente en una casa prestada pero ya les están pidiendo que desocupen la vivienda. Y a su casa le esta haciendo falta la losa pero no cuentan con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora, es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para poder terminar la construcción y así poder abitar a su propia casa. 
La persona que sale en la foto es su esposa la señora Rebeca Serrato, ya que el solicitante el señor Francisco González no se encontraba porque él es la única persona que atiende el negocio, y el de su esposa es más accesible en los horarios de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco González sells used car parts. His wife, Mrs. Rebeca Serrato, sells used clothing. These two jobs provide the family’s income. Today they live in a borrowed home and they have been asked to move out. Their home is missing the slab foundation but they don’t have the money to make this improvement, so they are seeking a loan to be able to finish the construction and be able to live in their own home. The person in the photo is Mrs. Rebeca Serrato, as Mr. Francisco González was not home because he is the only person who works in his business, while his wife’s business is more accessible during business hours.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Concrete slab

loans.name: Santos Eusebia

texts.es: La Joven Santos G. se dedica al comercio ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio denominado Variedades Chevita, tiene mas de 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio y durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien ya que ella vende ropa de muy buena calidad a un precio justo para todos sus clientes, ella es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres a los que apoya con algunos gastos en el hogar, uno de sus sueños es tener una gran tienda en la que pueda emplear personas y de esta forma tratar de contribuir a crear fuentes de empleo, hay que buscar nuevas opciones para salir adelante dice ella, ella es una mujer con espiritu de superacion, ella tiene 36 años, en estos momentos desea subir un peldaño en la escalera de sus sueños.
texts.en:
The young Santos G. makes a living as a merchant and she depends on a store that she owns called "Variedades Chevita". She has been dedicating herself to this business for the past 6 years and during all this time it has been going well since she has been selling clothes that are in good condition and at prices that satisfy her customers. She is single and has no children and she lives with her parents who help her with some of the costs of living. One of her dreams is to own a big store were she could employ people and contribute to helping people work so they could make a better life for themselves. She is a woman with spirit that helps her to overcome all obstacles and to better herself. She is 36 years old. At this time Santos wants to take one more step up the ladder to her dreams. (Translated by Alexis of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms to sell, including shoes, undergarments, shirts, skirts, pants, bloomers, socks and knee-highs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es: la Joven Xiomara C. cuenta con una pequeña tienda de venta denominada VARIEDADES IVETH, tiene mas de 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y segun ella comenta le ha ido muy bien aunque en algunas veces ha tenido ciertas limitantes por falta de capital de trabajo, ya que a veces ella no puede invertir y tener un negocio en el que pueda tener mas productos y mayor variedad y asi poder vender un poco mas, ella necesita el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio, ella vive con sus padres a los cuales les ayuda monetariamente para salir adelante con su hogar.
texts.en:
Miss Xiomara C. has a small shop called VARIEDADES IVETH, which has been in business for 3 years. She states that her business has been prosperous. However, at times, she has experienced certain limitations due to a lack of business capital when she cannot invest in her business and offer a variety of products. She needs this loan in order to re-stock her business more inventory. She lives with her parents, whom she helps financially so that the entire household can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lotion, facial cream, shampoo, hair gel, poweder, medicine and nail polish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jesús Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Roberto D. es padre de familia tiene dos hijas a las que quiere y desea darles lo mejor. 
Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorros a podido construirles un cuarto, pero le esta haciendo falta el techo y el quiere mejor ponerlo de concreto ya que es mas duradero y seguro para ellas. Pero no a podido terminar la mejora y por eso nos está solicitando un préstamo para terminarles la recamara a sus niñas y así tengan su propio espacio en la casa. Planea pagar esté crédito con los ingreso de su trabajo como jefe de mantenimiento técnico en una fabrica. Cuando visitamos el domicilio de Don Jesús Roberto el no se encontraba estaba en su trabajo solo estaba su esposa la señora San Juana Sánchez que nos atendió y aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
Jesús Roberto D. has two daughters who he loves and wants to give the best to. With much effort and his savings he has been able to construct a room for them. It still needs a roof and to be reinforced with concrete, which is more durable and safe. But he has not been able to finish the construction and that is why he is requesting a loan to complete his daughters' bedroom, providing them with their own space in the house. He plans to repay this loan with his earnings as chief maintenance technician at a factory. When we visited the house Jesús Roberto was at work so only his wife, San Juana Sánchez, appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paving house with flagstones

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: la Sra. Maria G. cuenta con un comedor que se conoce con el nombre de COMEDOR EMMANUEL tiene mas de 30 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien ya que con este negocio logro que sus hijos estudiaran y tambien logro remodelar su casa de habitacion, en esta comunidad ella fue la primera que puso un negocio de este tipo y eso le ayudo a obtner su casa y muchas cosas mas, tiene una hija que le ayuda a elaborar la comida que vende y una de las metas de ella es poder poner un hospedaje para que los clientes que comen en su negocio si quieren dormir alli lo puedan hacer. la mayoria de la gente que viaja come en su comedor y a veces ellos tienen que regresarse hasta el Paraiso para poder conseguir un lugar en donde descanzar. esto queda a 17 kilometros de su local.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria G. has a restaurant called Emmanuel Restaurant. She has been in this business for more than 30 years and during all this time it has gone very well, with this business she was able to provide her children an education and also remodel her home. She was the first to open a business of this type in her community and this helped her obtain her home and many other things. She has a daughter who helps her make the food that she sells and one of her goals is to be able to provide lodging so that if the customers that come to her business want to sleep they can do so there. The majority of the people that travel eat in her restaurant and at time they have to return to Paraiso in order to find a place to rest, and that is 17 kilometers from her locale.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, butter, beans, chicken, cheese, spaghetti

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua la señora Ana O. se dedica a su actividad de venta de alimentos y productos de especies como salsas, mostazas, entre otros ofertados en su propio establecimiento el cual ha logrado mejorar a raíz del tiempo.

Diariamente desde tempranas horas, la señora O. se prepara para abrir su local donde es visitada por varios clientes que compran los alimentos y las especies. El crédito que hoy en día solicita es para la compra de materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y de igual manera para la compra de las especies para continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In Managua, capital of Nicaragua, Señora Ana O. sells foods and condiments such as salsas, mustards, and others. These are sold from her own establishment where she has completed improvements on schedule. Every day, beginning early in the morning, Señora O. gets ready to open her shop, where various clients come to buy foods and condiments. The loan she is requesting today is to purchase raw materials to prepare the foods, as well as to buy the condiments to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Julia Marina

texts.es:
La señora Julia S. es originaria de la ciudad de Managua donde posee su establecimiento de venta de frutas, verduras, refrescos de frutas y vinagres atendidos en su local que a pesar que no está en las condiciones necesarias se ha esforzado para salir adelante en el negocio.

Actualmente ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel ya que requiere de la compra de las frutas y verduras lo mas antes posible y por esto espera muy confiadamente creyendo que su crédito será otorgado sin problemas alguno.
texts.en:
Señora Julia S. is a native of the city of Managua, where she has her business selling fruits, vegetables, fruit beverages, and vinegars from her shop. In spite of the fact that conditions are not the best, she has worked hard to get ahead in her business.
