Currently she is seeking the help of Ceprodel so she can buy fruits and vegetables as early as possible. For this reason she is waiting expectantly for her loan to be approved without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Marcelina De Los Santos

texts.es:
La señora Marcelina de los Santos Q. se dedica en la ciudad de Managua a su actividad de venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 15 años habiéndolos comercializado con mucho esfuerzo ya que es una madre con cuatro hijos que debe mantener y proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.

Es importante destacar que actualmente la señora Marcelina ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de las frutas y verduras y con este crédito se beneficiará tanto ella como su negocio y su amada familia.
texts.en:
Señora Marcelina de los Santos Q. has sold fruits and vegetables in the city of Managua for 15 years. She has been selling energetically because she is the mother of 4 children whom she must support and provide the best conditions for their development. It is important to emphasize that Señora Marcelina has requested this loan from Ceprodel to buy fruits and vegetables, and that this loan will benefit her as much as her business and her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nelly Del Socorro Mercado

texts.es:
Nelly M. es una dama muy trabajadora cuya labor es la venta de colchones desde hace 5 años siendo este un negocio que le ha ayudado a desarrollarse y proporcionar mejores condiciones a su familia.

A sus 50 años de edad, como toda mujer nicaragüense ella se caracteriza por ser una excelente trabajadora con el propósito de llevar el bienestar a su casa de habitación. Ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de colchones ya que requiere adquirirlos para así seguir en su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
Nelly M. is a hard-working woman whose business is selling mattresses. She has been in this business for 5 years, which has helped her to improve herself and provide the best conditions for her family. At 50, like all Nicaraguan women, she describes herself as an excellent worker with the goal of increasing the well-being of her home. She has come to Ceprodel for a loan to purchase mattresses, since she must acquire them in order to continue her economic development.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mattresses

loans.name: Lidia Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Lidia C. se dedica a su actividad de venta de frutas y verduras en la ciudad de Managua teniendo su propio establecimiento el cual a diario busca la manera de como suplirlo de estos productos.

Actualmente ella se destaca por ser una excelente comerciante y es por esta razón que quiere superar en el negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada por un crédito para así comprar los productos y continuar en su actividad.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia C. sells fruits and vegetables in the city of Managua. She has her own establishment that she strives daily to provide with this produce. Currently she stands out as an excellent businesswoman because she wants to excel in her business. She has come to Ceprodel for a loan to buy produce so she can continue in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: María de la Concepción M. tiene 43 años, su estado civil es casada, tiene 3 hijos. Todos sus hijos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña María es una pulpería. Hace más de 10 años que Doña María se dedica a su negocio. Y dio inicio con muy poco capital, y es por medio de los financiamientos que ha podido mejorar su negocio. Los propósitos de Doña María son de mantener su negocio activo ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, pollo, carne, queso y gaseosa y así no perdería su clientela.  Doña María sueña en convertir su pequeño negocio en una distribuidora que ofrezca lo necesario. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 13.000 córdobas a un plazo de 18 meses.
texts.en:
Maria de la Concepcion M. is 43-years old and married with 3-children. All her children are working. La actividad economica de Dona Maria is a store. Maria has dedicated herself to the business for more than 10 years now. It started with very little capital and it’s through funding that she’s been able to improve her business.

The requirements for Maria are to maintain her business actively as it is a unique form of income. The funding is for working capital to buy basic grains, chicken, meat, cheese and beverages so as to not lose clientele. Maria’s dream is to convert her little business into a distributor that offers all the necessities. The loan is for C$13.000 cordobas which will be repaid in 18 months.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for store needs.

loans.name: Marlene  Lecahdo

texts.es: Marlene Lechado A. tiene 47 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Marlene tiene 2 hijos. Todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Marlene es la venta de productos varios como veta de queso, gaseosa, golosinas y otros. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio y se da por la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingresos. Sus propósitos son de mejorar la calidad del queso para que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para comprar golosinas y  gaseosas. Los deseos de Doña Marlene son de poseer una casa propia ya que actualmente donde reside es en la vivienda de sus suegros. La cantidad que necesita es de C$ 19.000 córdobas a un plazo de 14 meses.
texts.en:
Marlene Lechado A. is 47-years old and is married with two children. Both her children are currently studying. Marlene’s trade of choice is to sell various products such as: veta cheese, beverages, candy and other things.

She has dedicated more than 5-years to this business and is in need to obtain more income. Marlene wishes to improve on the quality of her cheese to ensure that her customers are satisfied. Funding is for working capital to purchase candy and beverages. Marlene’s desires are to own her own home where she can live with her in-laws. She requests a loan of C$19.000 cordobas which will be repaid in 14-months.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for supplies and food refinement.

loans.name: Alina Isabel

texts.es: Alina desde muy joven se ha incorporado a las actividades organizativas y productivas a traves de sus padres, en la actualidad es socia de la cooperativa COPACSELES mediante la cual pretende incorporarse a la sociedad para la construccion de un trillo arrocero de propiedad colectiva, donde se procesara la industrializacion del cultivo de arroz y dentro de sus sueños esta pertenecer a esta sociedad y accesar a los servicios, ya que junto a sus padres son pequeños productores de arroz y necesitan trillar su produccion a menor costo, por lo que solicita este financiamiento.
texts.en:
From a very early age Alina has been involved in production and organizational activities through her parents. She is currently a member of the COPASELES cooperative, where she intends to become involved in the group building a collectively-owned rice threshing machine which can be used to industrialize the cultivation of rice.

One of her dreams is to belong to this group and have access to its services as her parents are small rice farmers and need to thresh their produce at a lower cost. This is the reason she is requesting this loan.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contibution towards the construction of a rice threshing machine

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Don Juan Jose es un pequeño comerciante de productos perecederos de forma ambulante, diariamente muy temprano sale de su casa a realizar la venta de verduras frescas a los diferentes barrios de Juigalpa, su esposa Rosa Betancour tambien vende refrescos ambulante para ayudar a su marido en el sostenimiento del hogar, son padres de un hijo de 14 años que estudia secundaria, con esfuerzo ha logrado mantener su negocio y solicita financiamiento para fortalcer su inventario y brindarle mayor oferta a sus clientes, su seño es algun dia contar con un vehiculo que facilite su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Jose is a small business man who works by traveling and selling perishable products. He leaves his house very early each day to begin selling fresh vegetables to the different neighborhoods of Juigalpa. His wife, Rosa Betancour, also travels selling soft drinks to help her husband sustain the home. They are the parents of a 14 year old son who studies in the secondary school. With a lot of effort he has succeeded in maintaining his business and he asks for financing to fortify his inventory and provide his customers with lower prices. His dream is to someday have a vehicle to help his business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perishable product sales (vegetables, soft drinks, others)

loans.name: Alfredo Alonso

texts.es: Alfredo Alonso Jiménez tiene 52 años, su estado civil es soltera, tiene 6 hijos. Todos sus hijos estudian.  La actividad económica de Don Alfredo es el destace de cerdo, Don Alfredo inicio este negocio hace más de 12 años. Y nos dice que desde que era niño ayudaba a su abuelo y fue así como decidió mantener este negocio. El propósito fundamental para su negocio es que le proporcione los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las deudas contraídas con la Fundación León 2000. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo es para la compra del cerdo ya que tiene que visitar muchas comarcas. Los sueños de Don Alfredo son de establecer un lugar para su negocio. la cantidad para el préstamo es de C$ 16.500 a un plazo de 18 meses.
texts.en:
Alfredo Alonso J. is 52-years old and is single. He has six children and all of them are studying. Mr. J.’s trade of choice is to butcher and prepare pork. He started this business more than 12-years ago and said that when he was younger he used to help his grandfather with the business and afterwards decided to take up the business himself.

The primary purpose for the business is to generate revenue to cure the debt owed to Fundacion Leon 2000. The reason for the funds are for working capital to purchase pigs and to visit many regions. Alfred’s dream is to establish a place for his own business. The loan request is for C$16.500 to be repaid in 18-months.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase pigs and for travel needs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Vicenta del Socorro P. B. tiene 37 años, tiene dos hijos. Sus dos hijos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Vicenta es la venta de mercadería en general como ropa, calzado, perfumes, cremas y bolsos. El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 10 años. Doña Vicenta inicio este negocio por que tenía que ayudar a su familia y fue por medio de una amiga que le enseño y fue con pocos productos como ropa y cosméticos. Los propósitos de Doña Vicenta son de obtener ingresos con su negocio ya que este es el único medio de supervivencia. El financiamiento será utilizado para capital de trabajo de su negocio ya si podrá compra productos como ropa, cosméticos y calzado. Sus deseos son de establecer una tienda para que sus clientes observen la ropa. La cantidad que solicita es de C$22.000 córdobas a un plazo de 14 meses.
texts.en:
Vicenta del Socorro P. B. is 37 years old and she has two children, who are currently students. Vicenta sells general merchandise such as clothes, shoes, perfume, lotions, and purses. She has had this business for the past 10 years. Vincenta started with this business in order to support her family It was through a friend that she learned of this trade and she started off with few products such as clothes and cosmetics. Vicenta's goal is to earn enough income from her business because it is her only means of survival. This loan will be used to purchase more products for resell including clothes, cosmetics, and shoes. Her wish is to establish a local shop for her customers to see her clothes. The loan will be for C$22.000 cordobas to be paid off in 14 months.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Del Alba Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Mujeres del alba” pertenece a la familia de  Pro-Mujer hace más de dos  años. La mencionada asociación  pertenece al centro focal Villa Adela, ubicada  en la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con dieciséis miembros.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación, por ejemplo algunos se dedican a la carpintería, otras  se dedican a la venta de artículos en cerámica, también venden abarrotes. La asociación Mujeres del alba  precisa  créditos para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, para poder ampliar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres del Alba” Association has been with the Pro-Mujer family for more than two years. This association is in the center of the Villa Adela neighborhood, located in the city of El Alto. Currently they have 16 members. There are various businesses in the association: some engage in woodwork, others in selling ceramic articles, yet others sell groceries. This association needs loans to purchase larger quantities of product, in order to increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of larger quantities of products

loans.name: Angela Del Rosario

texts.es: Ángela del Rosario Pérez Castellón tiene 60 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Ángela tiene dos hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Ángela es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años Doña Ángela anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa usada y con 3 créditos otorgados por Fundación para el manejo de capital de trabajo compraba los productos, pero con el paso del tiempo este negocio no fue favorable por lo que decide establecer una pulpería en su vivienda. Y ahora los propósitos de Doña Ángela son de fortalecer su negocio y así salir adelante. El financiamiento es para  capital de trabajo ya que con este dinero podrá comprar productos como golosinas, productos medicinales, lácteos, carnes y frutas. Doña Ángela desea es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. La cantidad es de C$ 5.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Ángela del Rosario Pérez Castellón is 60 years old, single, and has two children. She makes a living by having her own shop. More than three years ago, she used to have a used clothing shop. After being granted three loans through Fundacion, she gained enough capital to buy more products. However, as time passed, this business was not preferable and Angela started a shop in her home. Now her goal is to strengthen her business and make progress. This loan will be used to purchase products such as snacks, medicines, dairy, meats, and fruits. Angela would like to improve her family's living conditions. This loan is for C$5.000 cordobas to be paid off in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martha Petrona

texts.es: Martha Petrona G. Carbajal tiene 58 años, su estado civil es soltera. Tiene 4 hijos. Todos sus hijos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña Martha es un bar y comedor. Hace más de 32 años que se dedica a este negocio y da inicio al negocio con capital propio y cuando empezó este le generaba ingresos fue por esto que decidió mantener este negocio. Doña Martha tiene los propósitos de son de obtener los ingresos necesarios de su inversión por lo que la situación en la que nos encontramos es muy difícil y el único medio de ayuda  que presentamos actualmente en el país son las micro financieras y las organizaciones en el exterior que nos ayudan. Sus deseos son de seguir trabajando y prosperar con su negocio. la cantidad que necesita es de C$ 19.000 córdobas a un plazo de 18 meses.
texts.en:
Martha Petrona G. Carbajal is 58 years old, single, and has 4 children, all of whom work. Martha earns income from her bar and cafe. She has had this trade for more than 32 years that she started with her own capital. She has earned income from this business since she started it. Martha's goal is to earn enough income to support herself. The situation is very difficult in her country; microfinance and outside organizations are the only methods of help currently offered to them. Her wish is to continue working and for her business to prosper. The loan quantity is C$19.000 cordobas to be paid off in 18 months.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela de 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su pequeña hija. La casa donde viven es propia. Ella se dedica a vender repuestos de celulares, como también vende recargas virtuales y físicas para estos teléfonos, esta actividad la viene haciendo desde hace un año. Ella trabaja junto con su esposo quien es el encargado de reparar algunos equipos celulares malogrados (técnico de teléfonos). Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer muchas personas, además le es rentable porque trabaja junto con su esposo y ambos ven que sus ingresos son buenos. Posteriormente quiere alquilar un local para instalara unas cabinas telefónicas. Este es su 4to su crédito con MFP, y con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar más repuestos para celulares para lo cual gastará toda la cantidad requerida.
texts.en:
Graciela is 24 years old and lives with her husband and small daughter. The house she lives in is her own. She sells cell phone covers, chargers, and other phone accessories. She has been doing this trade for a year. She works with her husband who is the manager of repairing broken cell phones. She likes her job because she meets a lot of people and it is profitable because she works with her husband, both of whom earn good income. In the future, she wants to rent a shop to display the phones. This loan with be her fourth with MFP and she will spend the entirety of the loan on more cell phone covers.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cell phone covers for resale

loans.name: Semilla Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Semilla” pertenece al centro focal Los Andes, ubicado en la zona  de Villa Tunara de la ciudad de El Alto,  trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace ocho años, aproximadamente.
Casadas en su mayoría tienen un promedio de cinco hijos cada una, en algunos casos sus parejas las abandonaron teniendo que hacerse cargo ellas solas de sus familias, es por ello que tuvieron la  necesidad de buscar actividades propias que les permita generar recursos para el bien de sus familias.
La asociación “Semilla” tiene diversas actividades, venden; ropa, queso, verduras, fruta, zapatos, otras venden chompas y mantillas tejidas a mano. Todas las socias  quieren mejorar sus negocios, para esto solicitan mayor capital para comprar mercadería y materia prima, dependiendo el caso. Están seguras que sus ventas aumentaran y podrán obtener ingresos suficientes para solventar  sus familias.
texts.en:
The Semilla Association belongs to the main center of Los Andes, located in the Villa Tunara zone of the city of El Alto. They have worked alongside Pro-Mujer for the past eight years, approximately. The majority of these women are married and they have an average of five children apiece. In some cases their partners abandoned them and they have had to work alone to care for their families. For this reason they needed to look for their own activities that would allow them to generate resources for the good of their families. The Semilla Association has diverse activities. They sell clothing, cheese, vegetables, fruit, and shoes. Others sell sweaters and hand-woven mantillas (veils). All the members want to improve their businesses so they are asking for a loan to buy merchandise and raw materials, depending on their business. They are sure their sales will increase and they will earn enough to solve their families' problems.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos quienes le ayudan mucho. Ella es una experta en el arte de las manualidades, ya que hace tejidos para carteras, collares, aretes, brazaletes, entre otras variedades. Estos artículos hechos con sus expertas manos los lleva a vender por los diferentes lugares de su zona. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchas personas con quienes se socializa y le es muy rentable porque sus productos se venden muy bien, y a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son mujeres les encantan. Ella posteriormente quiere poner un taller de bijouteria y tejidos. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales de piedras finas para hacer sus trabajos de manualidades, telas e hilos para bordados, gastará 500 soles, con lo restante comprará un motocarro de segundo uso para que su esposo trabaje en transporte de pasajeros.
texts.en:
Kelly is 26 years old. She lives with her husband and her three children who help her a lot. She is an expert in handicrafts, and already has weaved wallets, necklaces, earrings, bracelets, amongst many others. These articles, made by her expert hands, are sold in different places in her area. What she likes about her job is that she meets a lot of people with whom she socializes, and it’s very profitable because her products sell well and her clients, of which the majority are women, love her work. She now wants to start a workshop for jewelry and weavings. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and with the money that she requests she will buy materials and fine stones to do her handicrafts, fabrics and threads for embroidery. This will cost 500 soles, and she will buy a second-hand motorcar with the rest so her husband can work as a passenger transportation service.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her handicrafts

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: La señora Monica de 48 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con su único hijo de 17 años, quien le ayuda mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, pero a su vez trabaja como secretaria en la municipalidad del distrito donde vive. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años atrás. Y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es vender sus productos adecuadamente, además le es muy rentable porque sus principales consumidores son sus compañeros de trabajo y le genera ingresos buenos. Posteriormente quiere tener una tienda de ropa y zapatos. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de prendas para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Monica is a single mother, 48 years old, and lives with her only son, aged 17, who helps her a lot. She sells clothing and shoes, at the same time she works as a secretary in the municipality of her district. She has been in her current sales activity for the past two years. What she enjoys most in her work is selling her products which is very profitable because most of her customers are her co-workers and she makes a good income. Later, she would like to have a store to sell her clothing and shoes. This is her second loan with MFP; she will use the loan to buy a large quantity of clothing to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Cenit

texts.es: La señora Cenit de 47 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus 2 hijos que la apoyan mucho, sobre todo en su negocio. Se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, golosinas entre otras variedades), ella es una comerciante viajante, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 5 años atrás, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar lo mejor de ella a sus clientes para que los mismos se sientan satisfechos, además de conocer nuevos lugares, ya que sus productos los lleva a vender a unos caseríos a 18 horas de viaje río  arriba. Este negocio le es rentable porque sus productos los vende de inmediato “a ojo cerrado”, razón por la cual le va muy bien. En el futuro quiere tener una bodega en su casa para estar cerca de sus hijos. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de primera necesidad para llevarlos a vender y utilizará todo lo adquirido.
texts.en:
Cenit is a 47-year-old single mother living with her two children who help her greatly, especially in her business. She sells basic foodstuffs (milk, rice, candies and so on). She has been a traveling saleswoman for the past five years and what she enjoys most about her work is giving her all to her customers so that they can feel satisfied as well as going to new places, since she transports her products to villages 18 hours upriver. This business is profitable because she sells her goods immediately, sight unseen, which is why business is very good. In the future she wants to have a store in her home so that she can be near her children. This is her second loan with MFP; she will use the entire loan amount she is asking for to buy more staple goods to resell.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Jellype

texts.en:
Jellype B. is a rice grower. Her harvest helps her raise her family. The income she gets from her farm helps her pay tuition and book fees for her children. She is 49 years old and has 6 children. Her husband, Rufo B., is the manager on the farm. Together, they are doing their best to increase the harvest for their family.

She is asking a loan of Php 11,000 to CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. She believes the loan will help in increasing her yield. In this way, she will have more support to give to her children. 

CEVI provides their clients credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage.  CEVI believes their work is important to help alleviate people from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa, de profesión profesora de inicial, tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. La casa donde viven es propia. Ella es una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación, se dedica desde hace 7 años a la venta de productos de belleza como: perfumes, joyas, talcos, lápices labiales, cremas y otras variedades. Además labora como profesora en una institución educativa desde hace 12 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a muchas personas y le es rentable porque sus clientes son sus compañeras de trabajo y gracias a su carisma y jovialidad al vender sus productos se ganó una gran gama de clientes. Estos productos los lleva a vender por muchos lugares, los deja al crédito o al contado. Trabaja por horas, y se siente bien con su trabajo ya que conoce mucha gente. Más adelante desea tener una tienda de ropa y perfumes. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, con el dinero que solicita comprará una vitrina y también se implementará con más productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Rosa, a teacher by trade, is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two children. The house where she lives is her own. Rosa is a very active woman and with much desire to overcome hardship. For the past seven years, she has sold beauty products such as: perfumes, jewelry, powder, lip liners, lotions, and more. Also, she has worked as a teacher in an educational institution for the past 12 years. She likes her job because she is able to meet a lot of people and it is profitable because her customers are her friends. Due to her charisma and friendliness, she has been able to gain a large customer base. She sells her products in many places and allows her customers to pay by credit or cash installments. She works many hours, but feels good about her job because she knows a lot of people. In the future, she would like to have her own shop of clothing and perfumes. This loan is her second with MFP and she will use the loan to purchase beauty products and a glass case to display her products.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise and a glass case to display products

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es: Cinthya tiene 20 años, vive junto a su pareja, no tienen hijos, la casa donde viven es de su madre. Se dedica a vender ropa para niños y adultos de todas las marcas y modelos, así como también lo complementa ofreciendo zapatos y otras variedades de accesorios del vestir, productos que deja a sus clientes al crédito o al contado. Este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace un año atrás y lo que le gusta es estar en contacto directo con las personas, además que le es rentable porque lleva a vender de casa en casa, y le va muy bien. Posteriormente quiere construir un pequeño local en las afueras de su casa para poner su tienda de ropa, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona, debido a al transito de gran cantidad de personas. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero solicitado comprará ropa y zapatos para colegiales, ya que estamos en la temporada escolar.
texts.en:
Cinthya is 20 years old and lives with her husband. They do not have children yet and they live in her mother's house. She sells clothing of all brands for adults and children. She also sells shoes and other accesories, products that are sold to her customers either by credit or cash installments. She started this job a year ago and she likes being in direct contact with people. Also, it has been profitable because she sells the clothing by going door to door. In the future, she would like to build her own shop outside of her home to display her products. She would like it to be in a good location so that a large quantity of people would go past it. This loan is her first with MFP and she will use the money to purchase children's clothing and shoes because they are in the school season.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita tiene 25 años, vive con su pareja en su casa, aún no tienen hijos. Se dedica esforzadamente a la venta de zapatos solo para damas, estos calzados los lleva a vender por las distintas zonas de su localidad, y los deja al crédito o al contado. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años atrás y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es tratar bien a sus clientes y sobre todo conocer varios lugares. Anita cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien la ayuda a vender y esto le genera muchos más ingresos. En el futuro quiere poner una zapatería solo para damas. Es la primera vez recibe un crédito de MFP, le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal porque le brindó la oportunidad que otros no le dieron. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un local donde podrá exhibir y guardar sus zapatos adecuadamente, y sobre todo dará una mejor acogida sus clientes.
texts.en:
Anita is 25 years old and lives with her boyfriend in their house: they don't have any children yet. She devotes her time to selling women's shoes, which she takes to sell in different areas in her region, making sales on credit or in cash. She started this business three years ago and it is going very well. What she likes about this work is providing good service to her customers and above all getting to know different places. Anita depends on the support of her partner who helps her with sales and this helps generate much more income. In the future she wants to set-up a ladies' shoe-shop . This is the first time she has received a credit from MFP, and she likes working with the community bank because they have provided her with opportunity that others haven't. With the money she's asked for she will be commission the construction of a site where she can show and store her shoes adequately, and above all give a better welcome to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a site for her business

loans.name: Cristal De Amistad Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Cristal de amistad “ pertenece al centro focal Senkata  ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto, hace seis años que trabajan junto a la familia de Pro – Mujer.
La mayoría casadas y con familias numerosas, necesitan recursos económicos, para cubrir  necesidades básicas  de sus hijos, que aumentan día tras día. Por este motivo  necesitan de mayores créditos para ampliar sus ventas con la seguridad de obtener mayores ingresos.
La asociación Cristal de amistad  se dedica al comercio en general, 
Jacinta por ejemplo se dedica a la venta de chuño, papa y tunta; María vende frutas de la temporada, Gabriel es chofer de transporte público. Otras de ellas venderán artículos para las fiestas de carnaval.
texts.en:
The association 'Cristal de amistad' ('Crystal Friendship') belongs to the focal center Senkata, located in the city of El Alto and for 6 years it has been working together with the Pro-Mujer (Pro-Woman) family.

The majority are married women and have large families; they need economic resources to cover their kids' basic needs which grow each and every day. It is for this reason that they need bigger credits; to increase their sales with the assurance of obtaining higher earnings.

The 'Cristal de amistad' association dedicates itself to business in general, for example Jacinta sells potato flour, and different types of potato; Maria sells seasonal fruit; Gabriel is a driver of public transport. Others among them will sell articles for the carnival parties.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The need to buy larger amounts of products/Necesitan comprar mayor cantidad de productos

loans.name: Glendy

texts.es: La señora Glendy de 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos quienes la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches en las afueras de su casa, así como también vende bebidas gaseosas durante todo el día y quien el ayuda en su negocio es su esposo. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y que estos se sientan satisfechos y gustosos de su buena sazón. Más adelante quiere poder implementar un restaurante de recreo donde solo atenderá los fines de semana con la venta de parrilladas y otros platos especiales. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita implementará un espacio más adecuado afuera de su casa, con un techo a base de ramas para estar más protegida tanto ella, como sus implementos y comida.
texts.en:
Glendy is 32 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children who support her a lot. She sells food in the evenings outside her home, and she sells soda pop during the day and it is her husband who helps her with the business. She has had this business for 8 years. What she likes about her work is providing good customer service so that her customers feel satisfied and pleased with the good service. In the future she hopes to be able to open a casual restaurant that will she will operate on the weekends selling grilled meals and other special dishes. This is her first loan with MFP and with the money she seeks she will implement a more adequate space outside her house, with a roof made of branches so her customers will be protected, as well as her, her utensils and food.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Create an adequate spaces outside her home for her business

loans.name: Sotera

texts.en:
Sotera P. is engaged in rice farming. She is 44 years old. Her husband, Rufo P., is also a farmer. Every day, they check their farm, under the heat of the sun, to ensure a quality harvest. They even grow other crops to better support their needs.

Sotera started her business when she got married. She uses 2 hectares of land, which she inherited from her parents. Now she still has her farm, abundant in harvest, which helps her pay the school and book fees of her 3 children. She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 from Kiva's partner, CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for growing rice. She is also willing to venture to some other line of business. The loan will truly help Sotera to increase her yield and get started in her new business. CEVI provides credit assistance, training and insurance-coverage services to Sotera. CEVI helps more people start their own businesses and make them grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es: Carmela tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su conviviente y su hija quien es madre soltera, ellos viven en su casa propia. La señora Carmela es una mujer multifacética laboralmente porque se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, bebidas heladas, condimentos al por menor y a la confección de prendas de vestir, actividades que realiza desde hace 6 años atrás, pero ella no trabaja sola ya que en su negocio la ayudan su pareja y su hija, quienes son los encargados de ir a dejar los productos que ella vende a los clientes que lo solicitan en un mercado cerca de su casa. Lo que le gusta a Carmela de la diversidad de trabajos que posee es que la hacen sentir muy útil, además que lo considera muy rentable ya que tiene ingresos a diario. Ella tiene planes de seguir trabajando y posteriormente quiere poner un minimarket donde pueda ofrecer gran cantidad de productos y así satisfacer todas las necesidades de su clientela. Ella ha tenido 6 préstamos en MFP y ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos, además le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal, ya que ha hecho muy buenas amigas ahí. Carmela  quiere comprar abarrotes en lo cual gastara 500 soles, además de telas para la confección de ropas lo que costará otros 500 soles  y lo que sobre lo invertirá para el arreglo de su casa.
texts.en:
Carmela is 45 years old, lives with her partner and her daughter who is a single mother; they live together in their own home. Carmela is a multifaceted worker because she sells groceries, cold beverages, condiments at retail and makes items of clothing, which she has been doing for 6 years. But she doesn’t work alone in her business, her partner and daughter are in charge of delivering the products that she sells to her customers in a market near their home. What Carmela likes is the diversity of the jobs that she has because they make her feel useful, in addition profitable as she has daily income. She has plans to continue working and then wants to open a minimarket where she can offer a great variety of products and in this way satisfy all her customer’s needs. She has had 6 loans with MFP and has been very punctual with her payments; in addition she likes to work with the communal bank and has made very good friends there. Carmela wants to buy groceries which will cost 500 soles, in addition to fabric to make clothing that will cost another 500 soles and the remaining she will invest in repairing her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Glenis

texts.es: Glenis de 26 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su conviviente, ella es madre de 3 hijos los cuales vienen estudiando. La señora Glenis es propietaria de 2 mototaxis, los cuales manejan ella y su conviviente, quienes se dedican al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 2 años atrás para cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar. Lo que a ella le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y sobre todo se relaciona con varias personas, haciendo muchas amistades, quienes recomiendan el servicio de Glenis, ella considera muy rentable su labor ya que sus dos herramientas de trabajo le generan muy buenos ingresos económicos,  los cuales administra ella, haciéndolo de la mejor forma para que alcance a cubrir los gastos diarios y del mes. Ella quiere mas adelante comprar otro mototaxi y empelar a una persona que lo necesite y así generar un puesto de trabajo. Glenis ya tiene 7 préstamos en MFP y es muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que  le gusta trabajar con sus amigas de su banco comunal. Con el dinero del préstamo mandará a reparar sus herramientas de trabajo, comprando repuestos y motores generando un gasto de 1800 soles, el dinero restante lo ahorrará para comprar un mototaxi de segundo uso.
texts.en:
Glenis is 26 years old, lives in her own house with her boyfriend, and is the mother of three children in school. Glenis is the owner of two motorcycle taxis, which she and her boyfriend drive. They have been working in transportation for two years to cover their household expenses. What she likes best about her job is getting to know many places--and most of all, meeting new people and making friends who recommend her services. She considers this work very profitable as her two vehicles generate a very good income, which she administers, so it's the best way to cover her daily and monthly costs. In the future, she wants to buy another motorcycle taxi and employ another person, thus generating a new job. Glenis has had seven loans through MFP. She is very punctual in her repayments, and enjoys working with her friends at the communal bank. With this loan, she will repair her two motorcycles, buying spare parts and engines at a cost of 1800 soles. She will save the remaining money to purchase another motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle repairs

loans.name: Union Progreso Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Senkata, a éste pertenece la asociación “Unión Progreso” .Un grupo muy simpático y particular ya que además de trabajar  de manera muy responsable, llegaron a formar una muy linda amistad entre ellas. Varias son las actividades del grupo, por ejemplo se dedican a la venta de pan, venta de chamarras, venta de ropa, otros miembros de la asociación son artesanos en tejidos.
La asociación Unión y progreso  necesita comprar  productos y/o materia prima para ampliar sus ventas, así sus ingresos mejorarían para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
The focal center Senkata can be found located in the city of El Alto, and the association 'Union y Progreso' ('Union and Progress') belongs to it. It is a very nice group, in particular because it works in a very responsible manner and because the members have formed good friendships amongst themselves. The group carries out various activities, for example selling bread, selling jackets, selling clothes and other members of the association are craftswomen who weave.

The association 'Union y Progreso' needs to buy products and/or basic materials to increase their sales so that their earnings will increase for the good of their families.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The need to buy products and/or basic materials/Necesita comprar  productos y/o materia prima

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita M. grows rice for a living. She is 38 years old and has 2 loving children. She and her husband rent a 1-hectare plot of land, which they use to plant rice to support the family. She dreams of having her own land someday to better support their needs. Aside from rice, they also grow vegetables in their backyard. Teresita waters the vegetables  every day and uses her harvest to pay tuition and book fees for her children.

She is requesting a  loan of PHP 9,000 from Kiva's partner, CEVI, to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She is also interested in looking for other possible income areas to help her family more. The loan will truly help Teresita increase her yield and start a new business.

CEVI provides not just credit assistance. They also give training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Loisith

texts.es: Loisith de 23 años de edad, es casada, vive con sus hijos y su esposo, en su propia casa. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en todas sus variedades y frutas regionales en un puesto que puso afuera de su vivienda, ella de dedica a esta actividad desde hace 2 años atrás, ya que vió que la venta de estos productos es muy rentable ya que las personas lo requieren para alimentarse, es así que su esposo la ayuda de vez en cuando ya que el es un trabajador dependiente. Lo que le gusta a Loisith de su trabajo es que puede relacionarse con varias personas y brindarles un trato amable lo cual piensa es lo  principal si quiere que se conviertan en sus fieles clientes, dándole su táctica muy buenos resultados ya que su negocio le es muy rentable, gracias a la cantidad de clientes que tiene, esto le ayuda a sostener sus gastos familiares, ella quiere seguir poniendole empeño a su trabajo paea posteriormente crecer y tener su propia tienda de abarrotes. Loisith tiene 4 préstamos en MFP y le gusta trabajar con su grupo, ya que son muy unidas y se colabroan entre sí. Con el dinero del préstamo ella quiere mandar a construir un kiosco en lo cual gastará un aproximado de 1000 soles, además quiere comprar mayor cantidad de verduras y frutas en lo cual invertirá el resto el dinero.
texts.en:
Loisith is 23 years old, married and lives with her children and her husband in their own house. She sells all varieties of vegetables and regional fruits from a stall that she set-up outside her house. She has been doing this for the past two years, and she has already seen that the sale of these products is very profitable as people need to buy them in order to feed themselves. As a result, her husband sometimes helps her, as he is also a shop assistant. What Loisith likes about her work is that she is able to mix with all sorts of people and offer them a friendly service, which she thinks is the most important principle if you want to convert them into loyal customers. This tactic has given her very good results so the business is very profitable, thanks to the number of customers she has. This has helped her to meet the family's expenses. She wants to continue working hard so that in the future she can establish her own grocery store. Loisith has had 4 loans from MFP and likes working with her group as they are very united and collaborate between themselves. With the money of the loan she wants to commission the construction of a kiosk, which will cost her around 1000 soles, and she also wants to buy a larger quantity of vegetables and fruits, and she'll invest the rest of the money on this.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha K. is a villager in Damnak Roveang Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Seak Sok, is a motorbike taxi driver who faces a small problem because his motorbike is too old and he usually spends much money on petroleum to support his bike. Thus, Mrs. Sokha K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for her husband's business. She is 46 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband's motorbike taxi business.

loans.name: Chek

texts.en: Mr. Chek K. was born in 1961 and he now lives in Kraing Raong Village in Takeo Province. He is a recycling collector who buys wastes such as empty bottles, cans, plastics and so on to re-sell to a recycling factory. Aside from this business, he is an ice cream seller. Since these businesses are going well, he wants to expand them, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more recycling waste to re-sell and he plans to use the rest of the loan to buy ice cream ingredients to make ice cream to sell. His wife, Mrs. Kheom Chan, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Mr. Chek K. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy more recycling wastes to re-sell and to buy ingredients to make ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida C. owns a rice field. She is 37 years old and has 2 children. She dreamed of having a carabao (water buffalo) someday to plow her field. Now, she is renting a tractor to really loosen the soil before planting rice. Her husband is the one who manages their farm. Their harvest is what they use to raise their family and provide for their daily needs. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 from Kiva's partner, CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and to rent a tractor. The loan will truly help Zenaida grow her harvest. She also is willing to venture to another line of business. In this way, she could be able to contribute more to the family income. 

CEVI provides Zenaida credit assistance. Aside from that, CEVI gives all their clients training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rent a tractor

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Mrs. Sarom K. is a villager in Kraing Raong Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who cultivates vegetables to earn a living. In this farming, she faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy vegetable seeds, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy those seeds to grow on the plantation field. Aside from this farming, she will use the rest of the loan to hire laborers to work on the field. Mrs. Sarom K. is a 47-year-old widow with four children, three of whom are employed in different positions while the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds to plant in her field.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Mrs. Leonora C., 42 years old, married, lives at Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has 2 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Because she is skilled at making toys, she ventured into this business together with running a sari-sari (convenience) store. During her free time, she makes toys out of cloth, together with her husband. Fortunately, her first customer who happened to be her neighbor and saw her work bought it.

Now there are customers who buy her toys from Tangub, Molave, Kapatagan and Dipolog areas. Due to inadequate working capital, she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in July 2008. She was not wrong when she chose Paglaum because of its add-on benefits given to members. She has received loans up to 3 times already. Today, she is appliying for PHP 14,900 to buy meters of cloth for making toys and additional merchandise for her sari-sari store. She wants to expand and have a market in toy crafting in different areas.

loans.use: to buy meters of cloth for toy crafting and additional merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en:
Ms. Nelie D. P., 34 years old, single, presently resides at Talic, Oroquieta City. As a young woman, she already knew how to earn money for her needs and for her family as well. Based on a recipe inherited from her family, she continues “Suman” making (a traditional Filipino snack delicacy made of rice and coconut milk) as her economic activity to generate income. Her customers are her neighbors, friends, and relatives.

When she was already accepting orders from other people, aside from her usual customers, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for additional working capital. She was recognized as a member in February 2004. In fact, this is already her 5th loan. Now she is applying for PHP 14,950 to buy ingredients for “Suman” making.

By having this loan she can address the orders of her customers. The greater the capital she invests in the business, the higher the income. She really hopes that someday her “Suman” will be globally in demand because of its unique taste.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for "Suman" making

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Mrs. Lydia A., 50 years of age and a widow, is a resident of Tipan, Oroquieta City. She was blessed with 2 healthy children. At first she experienced hardship in raising her children because of her status, being a single mother, the only one working to sustain their daily needs.

Lydia thought of a livelihood project that could sustain their financial needs, that is why she came to think of a business in “Pig Selling”. In order for her to have enough capital to buy pigs, she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative on August 19, 2008, to be exact. She already received loans last year. And now, she is applying for PHP 10,000 to buy pigs.

Eventually, all her pigs are sold for occasional reasons. She wishes to have a lot of capital to have her own piggery. For this, she knows, would bring a good way of living for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy 5 pigs

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Mrs. B., has been a PMPC member for more than three years. She started her business (Sari-Sari--convenience--Store) out of her own pocket as her initial capital. She displayed her items for sale right inside her house. When she became a Paglaum member, she infused additional capital, taken from her loan through the cooperative. Now she’s on her 7th loan cycle and is asking to be granted a loan amounting to P 10,000.

She is planning that the store will have its own building so it will be separate from her home. She hopes that their financial status will grow, thru the help of the business.

Above all, she is so thankful for the trust Paglaum gave her, that she’s able to avail herself of the credit services of PMPC. And because of that, she tries her very best to cope with her responsibilities as a Paglaum member, being religious in paying amortizations on time, as well as the weekly savings and share capital and attending meetings regularly.

loans.use: for purchase of additional materials such corn, rice and other food products

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Simple yet hard-working describes Mrs. Carolyn V., 41 years old, married and living at Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She was blessed with 3 children. Her husband is a fisherman. With the increasing prices on basic commodities, Carolyn thought of helping her husband by selling fish in the market. Some of these fish were caught by her husband and some were bought from other fisherman. Her customers are her neighbors, friends and the people of Aloran.

In order to have additional working capital, she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to request a loan in July 2008. She has received loans two times already. Now, she is applying for PHP 10,000 to buy kilos/"cavans" (a Filipino measuring unit similar to bushel) of fish and also fishing net. She really wants to see her business succeed by having a stall in the market and an additional pump boat for fishing.

loans.use: to buy kilos of fish and fishing net

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Mrs. Guillerma M., 46 years of age, married with 5 children of whom 3 are studying, presently resides at Hill View, Minaog Dipolog City. Her husband has no regular work. To enable them to generate income, both manage to raise pigs. They decided to become members of Paglaum MPC because they want to save a part of their meager income. Aside from this, they also have insurance and other benefits that the Cooperative offers.

Guillerma has received several loans and paid them already. Recently, she is applying for a loan amounting to 12,000 PHP in order for them to buy pigs and add to their capital. Luckily, they have buyers and are looking forward to seeing the success of their business. Guillerma aspires to have a decent living in the future.

loans.use: buy additional pigs

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
A mother and father to her 4 children, that is Mrs. Anselma A., 52 years of age, a widow, residing at Sta. Filomena, Dipolog City. She needs to make an income to support the needs of her children and to have them survive. Actually, she started making an income by selling 2 trays of eggs. By the time her 2 children were in high school, she decided to look for work that really makes more income and for this, she needs additional capital. Fortunately, she attended a seminar at Paglaum MPC and liked the insurances and savings benefits. She acquired membership on January 27, 2009.

Then she requested a loan of 5,000 Php for the purpose of selling “balut” (fertilized and slightly developed egg embryos). Since this business is much known and most people like to eat these eggs, she has vendors that are helping her in selling her products.

Today, she is praying for the success of her business and that from time to time, she will always have customers to buy her “balut” so that she can send all her children to college.

loans.use: purchase of fresh eggs for "balut" business

loans.name: Salma Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Salma baji is a 51-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Borewala, Pakistan for the past 30 years. Salma baji is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t bear her education expenses. She is married to a man whose name is N. A. and he is a painter. He performs his duties when people make a call to him to paint their houses. Salma baji is the mother of two sons. Her elder son is also a painter and her younger son works in Saudi Arabia.

Salma baji is an older lady so she keeps herself busy with household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more paint to expand their painting business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Khalida Parveen baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy paint for their painting business

loans.name: Zulma Xiomara

texts.es: Zulma Xiomara C. S., reside en Armenia departamento de Sonsonate, junto a su esposo, Gerson Chávez de 34 años de edad, trabajan en conjunto para poder brindarle un mejore estilo de vida a su pequeña hija  Koni C. de 6 años de edad. Zulma trabaja a diario para poder brindarle todo lo necesario a su hijita como lo es educación alimento y vestuario. Es por eso que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cuál pueda aumentar los productos de su negocio, el cuál consiste en una tienda de productos perecederos, cabe mencionar que esta tienda la tiene desde hace cuatro años. Zulma desea aumentar los productos de la tienda de manera que sus ingresos familiares sean mayores a los actuales.
texts.en:
Zulma Xiomara C. S. resides in Armenia in the department of Sonsonate with her husband Gerson Chávez who is 34 years old. Zulma and Gerson work together to be able to offer a better lifestyle to their young daughter Koni C. who is 6 years old. Zulma works daily to be able to give everything necessary, in the way of education, food, and clothing, to her young daughter. For this reason she is requesting a loan through which she may be able to increase the number of products in her business which consists of a store of where she sells perishable goods. She mentions that she has had this store for the past 4 years. Zulma wishes to increase her store inventory so that her family income will be greater than what it currently is.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new products for her business.

loans.name: Krishna Devi

texts.en:
Krishna Devi M. is a resident of Thecho. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in her region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. Krishna Devi M. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Thecho. She opened her grocery store a year ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells different grocery items in her shop. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 8 and her daughter is in grade 3. Her son helps his mother in her grocery store.

Now Mrs. Krishna Devi M. is requesting Rs 10000 as a loan to buy various grocery items such as rice, maize, and snacks for her shop to expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Khalida Parveen M. Munir Group

texts.en:
Khalida parveen baji is a 35 year old married lady and a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 30 years. Khalida baji married a man whose name is M. M. and he is a driver by profession, something he has done for the past 10 years. Khalida baji is the mother of six children: one son and five daughters. Her son runs a workshop where he repairs different kinds of vehicles, e.g. motorbikes, rickshaws. All of her daughters are getting an education from a local school near their house. Khalida baji performs her duties as a wife, a mother and a seamstress also. She sews clothes to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy repair tools for her son. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Rakhshanda yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones to sell. Parveen baji and Jamila khatoon baji each want a loan to buy fruit for their fruit selling businesses. Shakeela naz baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy repair tools for motor workshop

loans.name: Thuli Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuli Maiya L. lives in Khokhana-Dobato, Lalitpur. She has four members including herself in her family. 
She is a farmer in Khokhana-Dobato, and she grows different types of vegetables. Due to the lack of technology, most of the farmers in this area depend on seasonal farming. 

Mrs. L. sells her vegetables in the local vegetable market in the mornings and evenings. Now she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her work. She has two sons and a daughter. All of her children are now studying. A few years ago her husband died and now she has sole responsibility for her 3 children.

loans.use: To buys fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Naziran M.asghar Group

texts.en:
Naziran baji is a 57 year old married lady and a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 30 years. Her husband's name is M. Asghar, who has been a vegetable seller for the past 4 years. Naziran baji is the mother of one son, named Abbas ali, and he is a driver by profession. He drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Naziran baji is an old lady so she spends most of her time doing household work. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her son. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy bicycles to sell. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy blankets to sell. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana Luisa G. D. V., resiD. en El Junquillo departamento D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y pequeños hijos. A sus 50 años D. edad, Margarita trabaja haciendo comida típica la cual la venD. al contado. Así también posee una pequeña tienda en la cual venD. algunas golosinas. Junto a su esposo trabajan arduamente para lograr cubrir todos los gastos del hogar, afortunadamente ambos son conocidos como personas muy honradas y trabajadoras, así también poseen muy buenas ventas. Es por ello que el anhelo D. Margarita es poder aumentar los productos D. su tienda, así también desea contar con el dinero para poder comprar más materia prima para realizar los platillos típicos. Es por eso que Margarita solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda invertir y ver las ganancias necesarias para gozar D. una vida mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Luisa G. D. Velásquez resides in El Junquillo in the department of Ahuachapán with her husband and small children. In her 50 years of age, Margarita works preparing traditional food which she sells for cash. She also owns a small store in which she sells certain sweets. Luisa and her husband work arduously to be able to cover all the costs of their home; fortunately, both are well known as honest and hardworking people, and for that reason they have very good sales. Due to this Margarita yearns to be able to increase the products in her store, and also wishes to count on the money to be able to purchase more basic materials to make her traditional dishes. It is because of this that Margarita is requesting a loan through which she may be able to invest and attain the necessary profits to be able to enjoy a better life accompanied by her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for food preparation.

loans.name: Latifan Abdul Sattar Group

texts.en:
Latifan baji is a 47 year old married lady and a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Latifan baji married a man whose name is A. S., and he is a cobbler by profession. Latifan baji is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Both of her sons work in a bakery as salesmen on monthly wages. Her daughters are getting an education from a local school which located near their house. Latifan baji is applying for a loan for her elder son because he wants to become an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver and for this he requires an auto-rickshaw. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Hassan baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy bakery items (bread and butter) to sell. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Razia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Erick

texts.es: Erick A. L. reside en el municipio de San Luis Talpa en el departamento de la Paz, tiene 59 años de edad, pero esto no es obstáculo para que cada día salga a las calles, barrios y colonias a vender emparedados y fresco, así también posee una pequeña tienda en su hogar. Gracias a su pequeño negocio Erick logra pagarse lo más básico en la vida, como lo es la alimentación, ropa y una pequeña casa. Debido a que lo que obtiene de sus ventas es la única ganancia que obtiene, solicita un préstamo, de manera que con esto logre comprar más productos para su tienda y así mejorar sus ventas, lo cual contribuirá a que Erick tengo un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Erick A. L. resides in the municipality of San Luis Talpa in the department of La Paz. He is 59 years old but this is not an obstacle to his every day outings to the streets, neighborhoods, and residential developments, where he sells sandwiches and refreshments. Erick also owns a small store in his home. Thanks to his small business Erick is able to afford the most basic things in life, such as food, clothing, and a small house. Given that what he obtains from his sales is the only earnings that he obtains, he is requesting a loan so that with this he is able to purchase more products for his store and in that way improve his sales, which will contribute to Erick being able to have a better lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for his store.

location.town: San Luis Talpa,  departamento de La Paz.

loans.name: Sây

texts.en:
V. is 57 years old and the father of four children. They all still live in the family home; two of them are employed; they live together in a medium-size wooden house in Battambang Province, Cambodia. V. currently cultivates rice and also raises oxen in a stall for their offspring. His wife's name is Savat, 49, and she is an employee of an electric company.

V.'s business raising oxen is running smoothly and has provided them income through selling the offspring. In order to make his business more successful and to earn more income, V. has requested a loan to buy more oxen to raise. (V.'s wife is pictured.)

loans.use: To buy more oxen

loans.name: Edith Nanfuka Group

texts.en:
Edith is 45 years of age, single, with six children aged between 13 and 23. She rents a one room house where she stays with her children. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense per month is paying tuition fees for her children.

She sells charcoal to earn a living for herself and her family, and she does her business from the market six days a week. She receives about twenty customers a day. Edith has done this kind of business for six years now and so far, she has no challenges. She has been a member of MCDT for four years now and she has so far received eight loans. She has worked with her group for four years and she will use this loan to increase her stock. She also looks forward to expanding her business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible

loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Parveen Kosar M. Yaseen Group

texts.en:
Parveen kosar baji is a 36 year old married lady, and a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 14 years. Parveen baji married a man whose name is M. Y. and he runs a sweetmeat shop. Basically, he is a professional sweetmeat maker and Parveen baji helps him in making the sweetmeat. She is applying for a loan to buy material (sugar, cooking oil and essences and dried fruit) for her husband’s sweetmeat selling business. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Khalida parveen baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell. Ramzan baji wants a loan to buy bakery items (bread and butter) to sell. Naziran begum baji wants a loan to buy an embroidery machine for preparing embroidered dresses. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for sweetmeat business.

loans.name: Amina Namubiru Group

texts.en:
Amina is twenty years of age, married, and has one child who is two years old. She rents a one room house where she lives with her husband and child. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense every month is food, since she has to buy everything they eat at home.

She has a retail shop as her business, which she rents. She works seven days a week, and receives about 20 customers a day. She has done this kind of business for over six years now and her main challenge is transportation since she buys the bananas from the village. She has to transport them to town where she sells them.

She has worked with MCDT for two years now and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because she wanted some capital to put in her business. She has worked with her group for two years and her goal right now is to have a successful business and be able to sustain her family needs.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible

loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Plaxeda Nakitto Group

texts.en:
Plaxeda is 37 years of age, and is married with four children between the age of 14 and 20. All of the children are at school. Plaxeda stays in a six room house with electricity but no piped water. She fetches her water from the well.
She has two meals a day and her greatest expense every month is food, school fees, and transportation to her workplace.

She sells matooke (bananas) in the market where she rents a room to store her bananas. She works four days a week and she receives about 50 customers a day. She sells both retail and wholesale. She has done this business for fifteen years now and the challenge she finds in her business is that at times she gets into accidents on the way from collecting her bananas from the village.

She has worked with MCDT for four years now and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because she wanted some capital to put in her business. She plans to construct a rental house to improve her income.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Maritha

texts.en: Mrs. Maritha B. is 35 years of age, and lives in Punta, Dipolog City. She raised her four children alone, and this serves as her inspiration to earn a living. She had a carinderia (restaurant) business before, but changed to a sari-sari (grocery) store because she can gain more income. She also engages in the electronic-loading business and “video cinco” in order to sustain their daily needs. She’s been a good member for a year in the Cooperative and has already availed herself of several loans. Now, she is requesting a loan because she wants to add to her stock of groceries, and to her electronic-loading business. She dreams of sending her children to school despite of being a single Mom.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items and additional capital for the electronic loading business.

location.town: Punta, Dipolog City Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Mrs. J. is a PMPC member under the PDP-LP program, is 47 years old, married, and has 3 daughters (1 in school). She has a good credit record with PMPC. She has a grocery store as her existing business, which gives their family a good profit aside from their coconut income. At this time she would like a loan for her business, and this will be her 7th cycle. Furthermore, she wants to engage in wholesale and retail trade in the future.

She wants to increase her income so she can support her daughter's college studies in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock such as canned goods, noodles, rice etc.

loans.name: Charbel

texts.en: Charbel is a 29-year-old married man with one young child, living in Zouk Mosbeh in Mount Lebanon. Since he was 16, he has worked as a car electrician in a car repair shop, and in 2002 he opened his shop. Today, Charbel wants to borrow US$ 1,000 in order to buy electrical spare parts to increase his inventory.

loans.use: Buy electrical spare parts

loans.name: Đặng Thị Hiếu Group

texts.vi:
Cô H., 52 tuổi, hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ đang đi học. Cô cùng chồng rất chăm chỉ làm ăn. Gia đình cô vừa làm ruộng, làm bánh tẻ bán, bán hàng tạp hoá và cho thuê cửa hàng. Vì vậy thu nhập gia đình cô khá thường xuyên và ổn định khoảng 120000-150000 vnđ / ngày .Chu kì trước cô đã vay và hoàn trả rất tốt. Nay cô tiếp tục vay 4704000 vnđ/50 tuần để bổ sung vốn buôn bán và mua nguyên liệu làm bánh. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm của cô: 
+ Cô Nguyễn Thị B. vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn bán hàng ăn, chăn nuôi và sản xuất nhựa.
+ Cô Nguyễn Thị Thuý vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn bán hàng ăn, chăn nuôi.
+ Cô Lê Thị D. vay 4256000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn bán hoa quả.
+ Cô Nguyễn Thị Thuý vay 4256000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn phát triển nghề xây dựng.
+ Cô Tô Thị T. vay 3360000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn bán hàng tạp hoá.
texts.en:
Mrs H., 52 years old, lives with her husband and their 2 young children. She and her husband are hard workers. They work in their rice field, sell rice cake, grocery and rent space part of their store. This is why their family income is good and stable at 120000-150000 VND a day. She has already paid back her previous loan. Now she is requesting 4.704.000 VND (50 weeks) to invest in her businesses, buy ingredients to make the rice cakes. Other members in her group are: * Nguyễn Thị B., requesting 4704000 VND to buy products for her food stand, raising livestock and produce plastic.
* Nguyễn Thị Thuý, requesting 4704000 VND to invest in her food stand, raising livestock.
* Lê Thị D., requesting 4256000 VND. She sells grocery.
* Nguyễn Thị Thuý, requesting 4256000 VND to invest in her construction business.
* Tô Thị T., requesting 3360000 VND. She sells grocery.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy ingredients to make rice cakes

loans.name: Avelita

texts.en:
Avelita B. is one of the Members in Good Standing of Paglaum under the Paglaum Development Program for the Landless People. She became an official member on 16 December 2007. She currently lives in Guinabut, Sapang Dalaga, in the Philippines. She has two grown children, and another one who is still in school.

Like any other business owner, Mrs. B. dreams of expanding her existing businesses, and she hopes this will help all of her children to finish a college education. Mrs. B. is applying for a loan of PHP 9,000 ($200) to expand her "lechon" (roasted pig) business. Lechon is one of the favorite dishes of the Filipinos. This loan will also support her current businesses of ready-to-wear clothing sales and snack vending. Mrs. B. is so thankful for Paglaum's credit services.

loans.use: For purchase of livestock for lechon making and selling, which is part of her snack and ready-to-wear business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica O. is 26 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN ($350) to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sunday Davidson

texts.en: Sunday Davidson O. is 38 years old and single. He lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria, and he has one child. Sunday is a printer. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN ($700) to purchase more printing materials for his printing business. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase printing materials for his business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. B. was recognized as a Paglaum member on 29 May 2007 and is a resident of Barangay Guinabut.
