She is married and has six children, three of whom are studying and working while living with relatives. Her husband is sickly because he has asthma, so she raises her children through her own efforts.

Mrs. B. considers herself fortunate to be part of Paglaum's membership, because she has already enjoyed its programs and services. She says that without the help of Paglaum's credit services, she would not have been able to open her business selling whole coconuts and coco shells. Her family has slowly overcome their previous difficulties, because now they have their own means of earning a living.

She is now requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP ($200) to buy more whole coconuts and coco shells for her business. She aspires to someday expand her business more and help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase whole coconuts and coco shells for her business

loans.name: Obiaderi

texts.en: Obiaderi sells beef. She is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N50, 000 to purchase more beef to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Hoa Group

texts.vi:
Chị H., 40 tuổi, hiện đang sống cùng cH. và 3 con (2con đi học và 1 con ở nhà buôn bán cùng chị). CH. chị làm nghề xây dựng nên suốt ngày theo công trình không thể giúp chị bán hàng. Chị rất tháo vát nên 2 mẹ con chị đã mở cửa hàng H. quả rất có lộc. Thu nhập hàng ngày của gia đình chị khoảng 150000-170000 vnđ/ ngày. Lần này chị vay 4704000 vnđ/chu kì 2/ 50 tuần để bổ sung vốn buôn bán H. quả. Các thành viên còn lại trong nhóm của chị:
 Chị Chu Thị B. vay 4256000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để mua nguyên liệu tráng bánh đa nem.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị H. vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn buôn bán H. quả.
 Chị Dương Thị H. vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn bán quần áo.
 Chị Đặng Thị Hường vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn bán quần áo.
texts.en:
Mrs. H., 40 years old, is living with her husband and three children (two of them go to school, and one stays at home helping her). Her husband is a worker at construction sites and cannot help her to trade. She is very active, and her fruit shop has good business. The daily income of her family is about VND150,000-170,000. In this second loan cycle, she borrows VND4,704,000 for 50 weeks to invest more in buying and reselling fruits. Other members in her group include: + Ms. Chu Thi B. borrows VND4,256,000 in 50 weeks to buy supplies for dried rice pancake. + Mrs . Nguyen Thi Hoi borrows VND4,704,000 in 50 weeks to invest in fruit trading + Mrs. Duong Thi Hong borrows VND4,704,000 in 50 weeks to invest more in clothes trading + Mrs Dang Thi Huong borrows VND4,704,000 in 50 weeks to invesst more in clothes trading.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vay vốn buôn bán

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 33 years old and married with a child. He has a medicine store, where he sells medicine both wholesale and retail to his customers. He needs a loan in the amount of N50, 000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Agée de 49 ans, Madame Aminata Kassongué vit avec ses 8 enfants et son mari  dans le quartier Kouloukoro  de la ville  de koutiala(troisième région du Mali)
N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire de brillante étude , Aminata s’est très vite interessée aux activités génératrices de revenu. Après s’être essayé à plusieurs activités  elle finit par opter pour  le commerce de condiments alimentaires depuis maintenant  10 ans. 
Afin de remedier aux  ruptures de stock elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso   il ya 5 ans.  Après  8 prêts solidaires  ( prêt du groupe ) tous correctement  remboursés,   elle est à son 1 er  prêt individuel. 
 Elle compte acheter différentes sortes de condiments avec ce prêt, telque les poivres, sels de cuisine, soumbala et autres. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossites et effectue sa vente  au marché Kouloukoro de koutiala  à une clientèle  essentiellement feminine au comptant ou à crédit.  
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA  par mois  qu’elle envisage  utiliser  pour rembourser les  intérêts du prêt  et participer aux dépenses familiales.
Elle ambitionne devenir une grossiste de condiments au grand marché de Koutiala.
texts.en:
At 49 years of age, Mrs. Aminata Kassongué lives with her 8 children and her husband in the Kouloukoro area of the city of Koutiala (in the third administrative region of Mali). Not having had the chance to pursue a stellar education, Aminata very quickly became interested in revenue-generating business activities. After trying out several businesses, she ended up settling on the condiment business, which she has been engaged in for 10 years. In order to solve the problem of stock shortages, she decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After 8 solidarity (group) loans, all repaid properly, she is seeking her first individual loan. She intends to buy different types of condiments with this loan, such as peppers, edible salts, soumbala, and so on. She obtains her supply from wholesalers and makes her sales at the Kouloukoro market in Koutiala to a primarily female clientele in cash or in credit. She intends to earn an average profit of 45,000 FCFA per month, which she foresees using to repay the loan and take part in meeting her family's expenses. Her ambition is to become a wholesaler of condiments at the grand market in Koutiala.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is a widow. She sells children's clothing at Melitopol central market. Her income is 2,500 UAH per month.

Galina has been in this business for 12 years. She likes selling children's clothing because she just loves children. Besides that she puts good prices on her goods and treats her clients well. Galina lives by herself in a small apartment. Galina’s business is the only source of income.

Galina would like to borrow a loan to increase inventory. Galina uses her income to help her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Kassipin

texts.fr:
Madame Kassipin Traoré est âgée de  47 ans et vit  dans une famille polygame  dans l’un des quartiers de la ville de koutiala, Hamdallaye (troisième région du Mali)
Pour des raisons sociales elle n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école.Très tôt elle s’interessa aux activités génératrices de revenu notamment la fabrication  de savons. Elle a eu les premières notions auprès de sa mère et les perfectionna  ensuite dans une association feminine de koutiala. Depuis maintenant 15 ans elle  exerce cette activité, vu sa réputation, elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes  à travers des vendeuses détaillantes de savons de la ville de koutiala.   
Pour la satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’augmentation de son fonds de commerce, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 2 ans.  Après  4 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire ) tous  remboursés correctement, elle est à son premier prêt  individuel.
Elle compte acheter, 3 barils d’huile à l’usine ( FAMAB ) de koutiala. Elle effectue sa vente à koutiala ville.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement du prêt et contribuer aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs.Kassipin Traoré is 47 years old and lives in polygamous family in one of the neighborhoods of the city of Koutiala, Hamdallaye (third district of Mali). For social reasons she was not able to attend school. At a very young age she became interested in business activities to generate income, notably the manufacture of soaps. She first learned the business from her mother, then mastered it through her associations with other women in Koutiala. She has operated this business for 15 years and due to her reputation she receives many orders from retailers who sell soap in the city of Koutiala. To satisfy her customers needs and to increase her operating capital she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance company two years ago. After 4 group loans (guaranteed group loans), all of which were duly repaid, she would like to make an individual loan. She plans to buy 3 barrels manufacturing oil (Famab) from Koutiala. She will resell this in Koutiala and expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 Francs CFA which she will use to meet her loan payments and contribute to the family expenses.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy barrels of oil to use in manufacturing soap

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en:
One of the active members under the Individual Membership of Paglaum is Mr. Felimon B.. He lives in Mapang Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. He has four children. One of his children is still studying.

His project is called peddling. He sells his commodities to neighboring barrios, especially on scheduled barangay “tabo” or market day of each barangay or town. He also transports other peddlers commodities for display at their target sites.

Their business is now slowly growing and they are so thankful for Paglaum’s credit services where his last loan amounting to PHP 5,000 was granted as additional capital for the purchase of additional goods for his peddling business.

Felimon hopes that one day, their business would grow big and that they will be able to help all their children finish college.

The couple said, it is because of Paglaum's teachings that they have learned to value the importance of savings and insurance, too.

loans.use: additional capital for grocery store and peddling activity

loans.name: Franca

texts.en: Franca is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells planks to builders. She needs the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods to the people in her community. She has been in this business a long time. Hope is 35 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Agbor, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of  N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Djiguiya est composé d’une veuve et de 4 femmes mariées dont deux polygames. Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou. (4ème région administrative du Mali) où elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et dans le marché de Ségou Coura à partir de leurs activités Commerciales.
Elles font le commerce d’articles divers tels les condiments, les céréales et autres.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle il décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son 8ème prêt de groupe. Tous les sept précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter,  4 bassines de tomates fraîches dont une partie serait transformée en concentrée de tomate, 50kg de laye, 40 boites de tomate concentrée, 50kg d’oignon frais dont une partie serait torréfiée, 25kg de soumbala (condiment préparé à base de noix de néré et de la soja), 4 sacs de sel iodé, 4 cartons de cubes maggi ,4 sacs d’attiéké et 7 sacs de riz. Elles se ravitaillent en ces denrées alimentaires au grand marché de Ségou et lors des foires hebdomadaires. La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché de Ségou Coura à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel moyen de 35 835FCA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt et la prise en charges des dépenses des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Djiguiya is composed of a widow and four married women, including two who are polygamous. They live in the Bagadadji district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), where they know one another through marital and community ties and through their businesses at the Ségou Coura marketplace. They do commerce in various goods, such as condiments and grain.

To satisfy the needs of their customers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which they are on their eighth group loan. All the preceding loans have been repaid without difficulty.

This loan will be used to buy: 4 tubs of fresh tomatoes, part of which would be processed into tomato paste; 50 kg of garlic; 40 cans of tomato paste; 50 kg of fresh onions, part of which would be roasted; 25 kg of soumbala (a condiment made from néré seeds and soybeans); 4 sacks of iodized salt; 4 boxes of Maggi cubes; 4 sacks of attiéké (dried fermented cassava), and 7 sacks of rice. The group members resupply themselves with these food items at the grand marketplace of Ségou and during the weekly fair. Sales are made at home and at the Ségou Coura marketplace to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

The group members hope to realize an average monthly profit of 35,835 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover the children’s expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments and grain

loans.name: Kubra Ghulam Jailani Group

texts.en:
Kubra baji is a 37-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Borewala, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is G. J. and he is a cobbler. Kubra baji is the mother of four kids: three sons and one daughter. Her first two sons are involved in a carpet-weaving business. The others are getting education from a school located near their house.

Kubra baji is a very supportive lady. She helps her husband in making shoes. She is applying for a loan to buy leather to make more shoes and earn a profit.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Nasreen Kosar baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread and sketches) for her carpet-weaving business. Salma baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Razia baji wants a loan to buy warm clothes to sell. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy leather to make shoes

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is divorced and has one teenage daughter. She owns a small retail business and sells women's shoes at the market. Elena started this business 6 years ago. Her friends suggested Elena to try selling this particular item. She tried and it was successful. Elena offers affordable prices and good customer service. This helps her to have repeat customers. Elena would like to develop her business even more.

Elena would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to purchase spring inventory. She would spend the income to improve living conditions in the apartment where she and her daughter live.

loans.use: to purchase spring inventories

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe  Sabougnouman (une veuve et 3 femmes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 4 enfants, vivent  dans des familles monogamiques dans le quartier Ségou Coura de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et dans  une association traditionnelle. 
Elles font essentiellement le commerce de condiments alimentaires et ont connu Soro Yiriwaso à travers l’assemblée générale tenue dans le vestibule du chef de quartier de Ségou Coura. Elles sont à leur 9ème prêt solidaire,  après avoir bien remboursé les huit prêts précédents. 
Ce prêt sera utilité pour acheter , 200kg de beurre de karité, 6 bassines de piment, 3 sacs d’aubergine, 200kg d’oignon frais dont une partie serait torréfiée et 2sacs  de graines d’arachide qui seront transformées en pâte. Elles se ravitaillent en condiments au grand marché de Ségou à la foire hebdomadaire. La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile, au marché de Ségou Coura et à l’extérieur du Mali (Sénégal, Burkina Faso et France pour le beurre de karité) à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel moyen de 49 160FCA qui sera  utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt et  l’achat du trousseau de mariage pour leurs filles. Leur objectif est d’avoir une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The women of the group Sabougnouman are composed of one widow and three married women who average 38 years of age and 4 children. They live in monogamous families in the Ségou Coura district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through marital and community ties and through a traditional association. Essentially they do commerce in condiments and found out about Soro Yiriwaso through the general assembly held in the reception area of the chief of the Ségou Coura district.

The group members are on their ninth solidarity loan, after having repaid the preceding eight loans. This loan will be used to buy: 200 kg of fresh onions, part of which would be roasted; and 2 sacks of peanuts, which will be made into peanut butter. They resupply themselves with these condiments at the grand marketplace of Ségou during the weekly fair. Sales are made at home, at the Ségou Coura marketplace, and outside of Mali (Sénégal, Burkina Faso, and France for the shea nut butter) to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

The group members intend to realize an average monthly profit of 49,160 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to buy wedding items for their daughters. Their goal is to have a house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
One of the members of Paglaum under its Microfinance Program is named Fe G.. She is happily married to a fisherman and they were blessed with four children.

Fe is currently requesting a loan amounting to PHP 11,000 for the purchase of additional fishing net and other fishing materials for their fishing venture.

As a member she is always on time on her payments, giving weekly savings and attending meetings regularly. She is hoping that this loan would help augment their income as the main source for their living.

She dreams that someday she could enhance her fishing venture, acquire big fishing boats and other related fishing materials. She is also hoping that she could send all her children to college courses someday.

The family is so grateful for the support and concern of Paglaum for them as a family.

loans.use: purchase of fishing nets, etc.

loans.name: Vũ Văn Kỷ Group

texts.vi:
Chú Kỷ, 49 tuổi hiện đang sống cùng vợ và 2 con nhỏ đang đi học. Gia đình chú có rất nhiều hoạt động: vừa buôn bán các laọi thức ăn chăn nuôi, cung cấp rất nhiều mặt hàng cho các cửa hàng trong và ngoài tỉnh. Thu nhập gia đình chú rất ổn định trung bình khoảng 180000-200000 vnđ/ ngày. Lần này chú vay chu kỳ 2 với mức vốn 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để bổ sung vốn buôn bán. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm của chú ;
+ Chi Phan Thị Lý vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn buôn bán hoa quả.  
+ Chi Dương Thị T. vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn  bán hàng tạp hoá. 
+ Chi Dương Thị Q. vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn đi chợ. 
+ Chi Nguyễn Thị Cừ vay 4256000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn mua nguyên liệu sản xuất giấy. 
+ Chi Tô Thị L.  vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn buôn bán bánh kẹo.
texts.en:
Mr Ky, 49 years old, currently lives with his wife and two young children who are still going to school. He is selling a variety of cattle food to stores inside and outside his province. His family income is very stable, approximately 180,000 to 200,000 VND per day (11 to 12 USD per day). This is his second loan cycle, and he hopes to borrow 4,704,000 VND (271 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to have more fund investing in his business. Other members in Mr. Ky's group are: + Mrs. Phan Thi Ly wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (271 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to sell fruit. + Mrs. Duong Thi Tam wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (271 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to invest in her sundry goods store. + Mrs. Duong Thi Q. wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (271 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to sell goods at the market. + Mrs. Nguyen Thi Cu wants to borrow 4,256,000 VND (245 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to buy more materials to produce paper. + Mrs. To Thi L. wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (271 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to invest in her candy store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in small businesses

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Бохтурова Тахмина проживает в городе Вахдат. Возрвчт 24 года , замужем и имеет двоих детей. Для того, чтобы обеспечивать свою семью она работает частной портнихой. Шьет базарные сумки для продажи. Продает на центральном рынке. Бизнес приносит доход ,но условия в которых она работает не очень ее устраивают. Поэтому она решила получить кредит для того, чтобы купить более современную швейную машинку. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tahmina B. lives in Vakhdat. She is 24 years old and is married with two children. In order to provide for her family, Tahmina works as a private tailor. She makes shopping bags which she sells at the central market. The business is profitable but the working conditions are not so good. Therefore Tahmina is applying for a loan. She would like to use it for a new sewing machine. Tahmina plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a universal sewing machine

loans.name: Shahnaz Akhtar Mazhar Hussain Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz Akhtar baji is a 36-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 26 years. Her husband's name is M. H. and he has a thread-selling business. Shahnaz baji is the mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. All of her kids are getting an education from a school located near their home.

Shahnaz baji is a very hard-working lady. She sews clothes for the sake of sharing the financial burden of her husband because his income is very small. From the amount she makes, she pays the school fees of her children and relieves her husband of these expenses. Shahnaz baji successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute oin Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy thread for her husband’s thread-selling business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Kishwar Sultana baji and Kosar Parveen baji each want a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Parveen Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread and sketches) for her carpet-weaving business. Lal baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy thread to sell

loans.name: Arafsho

texts.ru: Исоева Арафшо проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 42 года, замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Образование среднее. Занимается пошивом больших базарных сумок и мешков. Занимается этим уже шесть лет. Кредит планирует получить и использовать его для покупки швейной машинки. Это ускорит  ее работу и она сможет в два раза больше производить свою продукцию. Погашать кредит буде в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Arafsho I. lives in Vakhdat. She is 42 years old and is married with six children. She has a high school diploma and makes a living by making large shopping bags. She's been in this business for six years. Arafsho plans to use the loan for the purchase of a new sewing machine. A new sewing machine would speed up her work and she would be twice as productive as she is now. Arafsho would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: a sewing machine

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is married and has one daughter, Victoria, who is 9 years old. She sells women's shoes at the market. Elena has been in this business for 6 years. She was able to develop her business due to her husband's support. Having repeat customers makes this business a steady source of income.

Recently Natalia started up a second business location with a different type of goods - small hope products. She wants to try it out to see if this business direction is profitable enough.

Natalia would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase the inventory. She would spend the additional income to remodel their house.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Allah Rakhi Niaz Ali Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi baji is 56 years old and a married lady, a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 35 years. Her husband's name is N. A. and he works as a watchman in a local school. Allah Rakhi baji is the mother of six children: five sons and one daughter. Her eldest son runs a tea stall in the community. The next on is involved in a carpet-weaving business. The third is involved in a dairy business. He gets milk from the buffalo which he has in his house and sells it to the milk shops. The other kids are getting an education from a school located near their house.

Allah Rakhi baji is a very simple lady. She spends most of her time doing household work. She successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her son’s milk-selling business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Anwar baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Meena baji wants a loan to buy jewelry to sell. Farnaz baji wants a loan to buy cardboard to sell. Shahida Parveen baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk-selling business

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
Leizel is a member of Paglaum under the microfinance program. She has two children, and both of them are still in elementary school. Leizel and her husband are engaged in fishing. They have a "bunsod", a kind of fish cage, where all of the fish might be trapped, once they are inside the "bunsod".

A bunsod is one of the best fishing strategies especially if the season is good and many fish arise. They acquired a bunsod from her parents-in-law with whom they are living, as they don't yet have their own home for the family. That's why they are requesting a PHP 5,000 loan for said project.

Leizel has high hopes of adding a number of fish cages so they can increase their family income. She strives also so she can send her two kids to school and have them finish their chosen courses in the future.

loans.use: For purchase of shells and other aquamarine products

loans.name: Masooma Taj Din Group

texts.en:
Masooma baji is 35 years old, a married lady and a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 3 years. Masooma baji married a man whose name is T. D.; he is retired and now he runs an electrical shop where he sells electrical supplies (wires and switchboards). Masooma baji is the mother of three kids: one son and two daughters. All of her kids are getting an education.

Masooma baji is involved in a sewing business. She does this work to pay the school fees for her kids and to help her husband with his financial burden. She successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute for Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more electrical supplies for her husband’s electrical shop.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Munazza baji and Khalida baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Azra Parveen baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies to sell

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi is 43 years old and married with 3 children. He sells drinks like palm wine. He also sells pepper soup. He has been in this business for a long time. Ngozi hopes for the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more drinks (palm wine) to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks (palm wine) to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 35 years old and married with no children. He lives in Agbor, Delta State, Nigeria. David is a LAPO client. He needs the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. He says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and to sell

loans.name: Haleema Maqbool Ali Group

texts.en:
Haleema baji is 37 years old and a married lady, a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 18 years. Her husband's name is M. A. and he is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver. He drives a rented rickshaw and earns money. Haleema baji is the mother of five kids: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is a daily wage laborer. The others are getting an education from a local school.

Haleema baji wants to give her children a good education and for this purpose she chose the decorative embroiderery profession. She collects orders from her relatives and neighbors and charges them US$ 3 per dress. She uses the income to pay the school fees for her kids. Her family is very happy with her. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband so that he will be able to earn the whole amount of his daily struggle.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Rehana Kosar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop. Hamidan baji and Kaniz baji each want a loan to buy wheat to sell. Gulnaz baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread and sketches) for her carpet-weaving business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru: Мирзоев  Муким житель Вахдата. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Имеет высшее образование , по профессии юрист. Но нигде не работает, кроме того , что занимается животноводством. Как и многие жители сельской местности он покупает и продает как крупно рогатый скот , так и мелко-рогатый скот. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить овец и коз . Таким образом он сможет увеличить поголовье скота , что принесет дополнительные доходы. Погасить кредит сможет в  течеине 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mukim M. lives in Vakhdat and is married with five children. He has a university degree in Law but he works in animal husbandry. Like many rural residents, Mukim buys and sells livestock. He would like to receive a loan for the purchase of sheep and goats and therewith increase the number of livestock and make more money. He would be able to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Loan Group

texts.vi:
Chị Loan, 29 tuổi hiện đang sống cùng 1 con T. nhỏ đang đi học. Chị là người phụ nữ trẻ nhanh nhẹn, đảm đang nhưng kém may mắn trong chuyện hôn nhân. Chị đã kết hôn nhưng do không hợp nhau nên vợ chồng chị đã ly hôn. Chị nhận trách nhiệm nuôi con. Vì vậy cuộc sống hiện tại của chị khá là vất vả, chị không chỉ một mình lo lắng về mặt kinh tế mà còn có trách nhiệm lớn lao vưà là mẹ vừa là cha của con mình. H. ngày ngoài làm ruộng, nuôi lợn chị còn nhận đồ mộc về nhà làm thuê để có thêm thu nhập. Thu nhập trung bình của chị khoảng 80000-100000 vnđ/ ngày. Tuy khó khăn nhưng chị rất uy tín, chu kỳ trước nhóm chị đã vay và hoàn trả rất tốt. Nay chị tiếp tục vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần/ chu kỳ 2 để bổ sung vốn chăn nuôi lợn. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm của chị :
+ Chị Nguyễn Thị H. vay 2016000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để bổ sung vốn mua cám lợn.
+ Chị Nguyễn Thị H. vay 3808000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để mua lợn giống và cám nuôi lợn.
+ chị Ngô Thị P. vay 2016000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn mua cám lợn.
+ Chị Nguyễn Thị Q. vay 1120000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để mua cám lợn.
+ Chị Nguyễn Thị Mỵ vay 1120000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn chăn nuôi lợn.
+ Chị Nguyễn Thị T. vay 4256000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để phát triển nghề xây dựng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Loan, 29 years old, currently lives with her young son who is still going to school. She is an active and responsible woman, but unlucky in marriage. She got married once but was divorced because she and her husband did not get along well. She single-handedly raises up her son. Thus, she faces many difficulties, as she does not only have to worry about finances but also shoulders the responsibility of being both a mother and a father for her son. Everyday, besides working on the farm and rearing pigs, she also does carpenter works at home to increase income. Her average daily income is about 80,000 to 100,000VND. Though facing hardship, she was still able to repay well her previous loan. This time, she would like to borrow 4,704,000VND over the course of 50 weeks to rear pigs. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hang, borrows 2,016,000VND to purchase bran for pigs.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hat, borrows 3,808,000VND to purchase pigs and bran for pigs.
  • Mrs. Ngo Thi P., borrows 2,016,000VND to purchase bran for pigs.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Q., borrows 1,120,000VND to purchase bran for pigs.
  • Mrs. N. Thi My, borrows 1,120,000VND to rear pigs.
  • Mrs. N. Thi T., borrows 4,256,000VND for building projects.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
One of the members of Bamboo Center, under the Paglaum Development Program for Landless People, a microfinance program of Paglaum MPC, is Mrs. Teresita P..  She's been in Paglaum for four years and has enjoyed 6 loan cycles already. Currently, her loan will be used to purchase additional "banyeras" of fish.  Banyera is a kind of basin that is estimated to be 3 times larger than a regular basin, that is made of thick tin.  She sells her fish in the market, and some are taken to other places.  She has many customers already in town and even other places.

She is confident that her fish selling business will grow and develop to enable her to uplift their way of life. She said that hard work and thriftiness are a few of the keys to be successful. 

Teresita and her husband can't wait to see their children finish their studies and establish their chosen careers.

loans.use: To purchase additional bulk of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian U. is 29 years old and married with one child. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. She has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods. She is a LAPO client. Lilian hopes for a loan to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla O. is 31 years old and is married with 4 children. She sells sarongs and clothes. She is requesting a loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs and clothes to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs and clothes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth H. is 54 years old and is currently residing at Polo, Dapitan City. Her husband is a government employee and they have one child. She noticed that food vending is in demand in their town, so she began to engage in this business and started selling 3 kinds of food. Later on, she wanted to expand but her capital was not great enough to open up an eatery. Hearing good things about Paglaum MPC, she automatically registered for membership on December 26, 2007. She diligently paid back her first loan, and now because she would like to expand her eatery business, she is requesting 50,000 Php. The loan will be helpful to her in buying additional spices and food for the business. She is very excited at the outcome of her business.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina E. is 44 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and food. She loves this business. Valentina hopes for a loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more food and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and food

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en: Katherine A. is 49 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells her clothes by carrying the clothes from one street to another within her community. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes

loans.name: Tavarali

texts.ru: ирзоев Таварали житель города Вахдат. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Возраст 52 года. Имеет высшее образование. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того для того, чтобы увеличить доход , занимается животноводством. Имеет большое хозяйство и несколько голов бычков. В данный момент возникла проблема с комбикормами и поэтому планирует получить кредит для того закупить комбикорма. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tavarali M. lives in Vakhdat. He is 52 years old and is married with five children. Tavarali has a university degree and works as a school teacher. In addition to teaching, in order to increase his earnings Tavarali is involved in livestock breeding. He has a large farm and several bull calves. At the moment he is having problems with fodder and is applying for a loan that would allow him to purchase fodder. He plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fodder

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine A. is 50 years old and is a mother with three children. Two children are currently in school, while the youngest has passed away. She lives at Tarkwa in the western region of Ghana with her family. She has traded in second-hand clothes for the past two years. Selling of used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand-new clothes, shoes, and materials are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, selling of used clothing and shoes has created a market for many women like Augustine. She sells in almost all of the surrounding markets during their various market days. With the loan, she wants to buy more bales of used clothing and shoes to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children's future and also to rent a store to trade in. Augustine belongs to a village bank called ‘Joy’. She hopes to receive 600 GHS to make progress in her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy used clothing and shoes

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Амонов Бахром живет в городе Вахдат. Работает учителем в средней школе. Возраст 34 года , женат и имеет четверых детей. Заработная плата , получаемая им в средней школе не дает возможности иметь хорошие условия для жизни. Поэтому он занимается сельским хозяйством. Пришел сезон посева картофеля. Поэтому он решил получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить качественные семена картофеля и удобрений. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bahrom A. is a school teacher in Vakhdat. He is 34 years old and is married with four children. Bahrom's salary is not sufficient to provide good living conditions for his family, and he has to work in agriculture. Now that the season of planting potatoes is coming, Bahrom is applying for a loan for the purchase of potato seeds and fertilizer. He would be able to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Hermocilla

texts.en:
Hermocilla lives in Minlasag, Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte. She became a member of Paglaum on September 25, 2007. Hermocilla has been engaged in hog raising, the reason why she requested the PHP 12,000 loan amount.

Now she is inspired and excited for the coming delivery of her hog. There are already target buyers for the upcoming piglets.She’s praying and hoping that the hog is in good condition always so that her project will be successful.

The couple also is industrious. They also have a farm for their own consumption and the rest of the products are sold, too. Most of their farm produce is "kamoteng Kahoy" (Cassava) and other root crops.

Hermocilla hopes that in the future she can build a big pigpen for her hogs and piglets, so that her business grows in number and in size. That can provide them a decent family life.

She is thankful for Paglaum’s programs and services and its continued support, too.

loans.use: to expand her hog-raising business

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen S. is a resident of Betibut, Sapang Dalaga, Mis. Occ. She is 37 years old and has only one child.

Allen's business is named S.'s Sari-Sari (convenience) Store. Her store is easily accessible to her customers because it is along the highway. She is currently requesting a 5,000 loan amount for additional capital for her grocery store. She needs to buy additional food, toiletries, and household items, too. Way back when Allen started her Sari-Sari store, she only infused a small capital into her business. She can't imagine how it expanded and grew. But she realizes that it is because of the training and support of our staff who never cease to explain the right way of managing a small capital and the concept of saving. She also learns the value of insurance and investment.

Allen and her husband are planning to extend their store so they can display more items which are in demand by their customers. Her husband is a very hard-working person too, like Allen. He tills a small farm for the family's consumption and if there is an excess of their produce he sells it in a market or to interested buyers who directly make it to their farm.

Allen is hoping too that she can send her child to a decent school and have a decent home also in the future. "Thank you so much, Paglaum," Allen states, as she considers it a great opportunity for her and her family to become part of the Paglaum Family.

loans.use: Purchase of additional grocery items such as food and household items

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora M., 60, is a widow who lives in Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Phillipines. She has 7 children, one of whom is still going to school. Some are married and some have already finished school and are now working and earning a living on their own.
 
Flora operates a sari-sari store (variety store) business. When she started her business, she got her capital from her coconut income. Her neighbors were her prime customers. For almost three years now, she has been a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and she testifies to the worth of its programs and services. She is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000.00. This is her seventh loan, and she will use it to purchase additional grocery items, such as canned goods and noodles for her sari-sari store.

Flora’s future plans are to have a separate building for her business (which is presently in her house) and to save more for her daughter’s education.

loans.use: Purchase grocery items, such as canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a resident of Sapang Dalaga, Mis. Occ.  She is 44 years old and single, but she has a child.

Being a single mom, she tries her best to have enough income for them to survive.  Nida is a very hardworking woman. She rises early in the morning just to prepare her display for the day.  

She is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional grocery items like canned goods, toiletries, and many others items for her sari-sari store (variety store).  

She is working hard so that her business can grow and develop, and she also hopes that someday she can acquire more productive lands, like cocoland so she can have an additional income when she grows old and retires in the future. She’s praying too that her child will soon be successful and be able to make a living on her own.

loans.use: To buy household and food products for her store

loans.name: Faizigul

texts.ru: Розикова Файзигуль проживает в городе Вахдат . Возраст 40 лет. Женат и имеет пятерых  детей.Занитмается шитьем базарных сумок. Кредит планирует использовать для того, чтобы закупить материал. Погасить кердит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Faizigul R. lives in Vakhdat. She is 40 years old and is married with five children. She makes a living by making shopping bags. She would like to receive a loan in order to purchase the necessary materials. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Appolonia

texts.en: Appolonia is 47 years old and married with 2 children. She sells foodstuffs and soup ingredients to the people in her community. She hopes for the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and soup ingredients to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and soup ingredients to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 36 years old, married, and has 4 children. She sells foodstuffs. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says "thanks" to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Mussarat Riasat Ali Group

texts.en:
Mussarat baji, 28, is married and has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 5 years. Mussarat baji is the wife of R. A. who is a carpenter and makes wooden furniture to order. Mussarat baji is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children attend the local school. Mussarat baji is a very hardworking lady. She prepares embroidered dresses and charges $3 per dress. She uses her income to pay her children's school fees. She is applying for a loan to buy material (wood and furniture polish) so her husband can complete the orders of his customers. 

She is the group leader of the following women:
Mukhtaran baji, who wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. 
Zahida parveen and Suraiya baji, who each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. 
Sakina baji, who wants a loan to buy wood to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for making furniture

loans.name: Beknazar

texts.ru: Бедимогов Бекназар проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми.Возраст 46 лет, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Работает бухгалтером и кроме того занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин продуктов питания. Занимается бизнесом уже 10 лет. Сейчас планирует увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Beknazar B. lives in Jalollidini Rumi. He is 46 years old and is married with five children. He works as an accountant and has a groceries store. He has been in this business for the ten years. He is applying for a loan that would allow him to increase cash flow. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Shazia Kosar M. Jamil Group

texts.en:
Shazia kosar baji, 33, is married and has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Shazia baji is married to M. J. who is a painter by profession. He performs his duties only when people call him to paint their houses. Shazia baji is the mother of five children: four daughters and one son. All of her children attend the school that is located near their house. Shazia baji helps her husband by sewing clothes for neighbors and relatives. She uses her income to pay her children's school fees. She is applying for a loan to buy paint so her husband can fulfill the orders of his customers to paint their houses. 

Shazia baji is the group leader for the following women of her locality: 
Ashraf mai baji who wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 
Sugran baji who wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).
Suraiya baji who wants a loan to buy vehicles spare parts to sell. 
Ghulam Fatima baji who wants a loan to pay off the remaining installments of her auto-rickshaw. 
Parveen baji who wants a loan to buy supplies (chairs, creams, and razors) for her salon. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy paint

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells drinks wholesale and retail to her customers. She lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Adiara

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle   Adiara    Samaké   est âgé de 19 ans, célibataire et mère d’un enfant, elle  vit chez son oncle maternelle au quartier Bougoufié de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant vite abandonné l’école pour faire le commerce auprès d’une de ses tantes qui faisait le commerce entre la république du Togo et la république du Mali, Adiara après des années d’apprentissage fut imprégnée des tenants et aboutissants des activités commerciales. Forte de cette expérience empirique elle évolue seule avec pour créneau la lingerie sous toutes ses formes,  depuis 5 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et d’une grande réputation dans la capitale du Balanzan Ségou.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, elle décida de travailler avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son 1er prêt individuel et compte l’utiliser pour acheter 30 pièces de pagnes brodés en république du Togo.
Mademoiselle   Adiara    Samaké vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 150 000 FCFA qui servira à renforcer son fonds de commerce et  faire face à ses propres besoins. 
Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. Adiara Samaké, age 19, is unmarried and a mother with a child. She lives at her maternal uncle’s place in the Bougoufié district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having abandoned school early on, so as to do commerce with one of her aunts, who used to do commerce between the Republic of Togo and the Republic of Mali, Adiara immersed herself in every aspect of business for a few years as an apprentice. Solid in this empirical experience, she herself developed her business five years ago in the niche domain of lingerie of all types. And she enjoys a large customer base and a great reputation in the capital Balanzan Ségou.

With plans to increase her working capital in order to cope with customer demand, she decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her first individual loan and plans to use it to buy 30 lengths of embroidered pagnes in the Republic of Togo. She sells to customers composed of women and men, cash or credit accepted.

With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA for bolstering her capital and for addressing her own needs. Her ambition is to build a house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Zahran Umar Din Group

texts.en:
Zahran baji is a 49-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Borewala, Pakistan for the past 30 years. Her husband's name is U. D. and he is a carpenter and makes wooden furniture. He has been doing this work for the past 17 years. He learnt this art from his father.

Zahran baji is the mother of one son who has a motorbike spare parts sales business. Zahran baji successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan).Now she is applying again for a loan to buy spare parts for her son’s business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Kaniz Fatima baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. Ramzana baji and another Ramzana baji and Ahmadan baji each want a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Ниезова Гулчехра проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми. Возраст 38 лет , замужем и имеет четверых детей.Имеет небольшую точку , где продает пирожки и кофе. Эта точка находится на рынке. Кроме этого она уже 10 лет занимается животноводством. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Gulchehra N. lives in Jalollidini Rumi. She is 38 years old and is married with four children. She has a food stand at the market where she sells pies and coffee. In addition, Gulchehra is involved in livestock breeding. She plans to get a loan for the purchase of livestock. She would be able to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 31-year-old married man with one young child, living in Ain Al Helweh in southern Lebanon. He started his telephone and mobile shop back in 2006. Today, Mohammad wants to renew his shop's decoration; therefore he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200.

loans.use: Renew the shop's decoration

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 48-year-old married man with two children, living in Ain Al Helwi in southern Lebanon. He has owned a grocery store since 1999, where he sells all kinds of goods in addition to vegetables and fruit. Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 in order to buy a new cheese refrigerator.

loans.use: Buy a new cheese refrigerator

loans.name: Maqbool M. Aslam Group

texts.en:
Maqbool baji is a 46-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Borewala, Pakistan for the past 30 years. Maqbool baji is married to a man whose name is M. A. and he is a driver, driving a local 32-seat bus. Maqbool baji is the mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. Her elder son drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The younger is a bus conductor. Her daughters are getting an education from a local school. Maqbool baji is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her elder son.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Sajida baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rukhsana Kosar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport. Ghafooran baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Emeka

texts.en: Emeka is 32 years old and married with a child. He has a motorcycle that he uses to convey passengers from one location of his community to another. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase one motorcycle to enable him to meet the demands of his customers. He lives in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase one motorcycle.

loans.name: Jura

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Джура проживает  вгороде Яван. Живет очень далеко от центра. Семья большая . Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Кроме того, он живет с родителями и братом. Для того, чтобы обеспеспечить свою семью, работает в сфере животноводства. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jura A. lives in Yavan. He lives very far from the city center. Jura has a large family. He is married with two children and also lives with his parents and brother. In order to provide for his large family, Jura works in livestock breeding. He is applying for a loan in order to purchase more livestock. He would be able to pay off the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar Qurban Ali Group

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar baji is a 29-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Borewala, Pakistan for the past 6 years. Parveen baji married a man whose name is Q. A. and he has been running an electrical supplies shop in the community for the past 3 years. Parveen baji is the mother of two sons. Both of them are in kindergarten. Parveen baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy electrical supplies (wires and switchboards) for her husband’s electrical supplies shop.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Razia baji and Jamila baji and Mussarat baji each want a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Abdulahad

texts.ru: Курбонов Абдулахад житель города Яван. Возраст 26 лет, но уже женат и имеет троих детей. Уже шесть лет обеспечивает семью , тем , что занимается купле-продажей крупно рогатого скота. Хочет получить кредит и увеличить поголовье скота. Это даст возможность увеличить прибыль. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdulahad K. lives in Yavan. He is 26 years old but is already married with three children. For the past six years he has been making a living by working in animal sales. He would like to obtain a loan in order to purchase more livestock. This would allow him to increase profit. He would be able to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is divorced with two children. She sells sweets and candies at the local market. Her pricing policy and large assortment attracts many clients to her “sweet kiosk”.

Galina lives with her younger son, Mychailo. He has had a lung disease from his birth. Since her husband left the family, Galina has spent a lot of money to improve Mychailo's health, taking him to medical and retreat centers. Galina’s desire is to help her son to get well and healthy.

Galina would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase the assortment of sweets. She says that the loans help her to develop the business and give her an advantage over the competitors.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of sweets.

loans.name: Mahmadvafo

texts.ru: Мирхомуродов Махмадвафо житель города Ява. Работает механиком. Ремонтирует легковые автомобили. Женат и имеет троих детей. Вместе с тем, что он ремонтирует автомашины  за определенную плату , он реализует запчасти , привозимые им из города Душанбе. Таким образом он делает двойной бизнес . И торгует и производит услуги. Поэтому для того, чтобы купить запчасти он решил получить кредит  сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahmadvafo M. lives in Yavan with his wife and three children. He works as a mechanic. In addition to repairing cars, he sells spare parts that he brings from Dushanbe. Therefore he has a double business - he is involved both in sales and in services. In order to purchase more spare parts, Mahmadvafo decided to apply for a loan that he would repay within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Mahmadovud

texts.ru: Розиков Махмадовуд житель города Яван. Возраст 38 лет , не женат . Работает в столовой , которую арендует. Столовая находится на центральном рынке. Спрос на его продукцию неплохой. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит и закупить продукты долгого хранения. Это поможет ему снизить цены на предлагаемую продукцию и обеспечить население качественной и свежей пищей. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahmadovud R. is a 38-years-old bachelor who lives in Yavan. He works in a cafeteria that he rents at the central market. There is demand for the food he makes and he is applying for a loan that would allow him to stock groceries. He would like to reduce food prices and provide local residents with fresh food of high quality. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima I. is 46 years old. She is married with three children. Rahima is a market vendor, who sells dishes and plates of the oriental style in the central local market. Rahima has been in this business for 8 years already, and her business is successful enough to allow Rahima to support her family and her husband’s parents. Considering that the husband of Rahima is currently unemployed, her business generates the main income. Now Rahima is planning to increase stock by purchasing dishes and plates wholesale. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting $800 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. Rahima thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dishes and plates wholesale in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Ihomiddin

texts.ru: Таваров Илхомиддин житель города Нурек. Женат имеет одного ребенка. Возраст 28 лет. Занимается торговлей уже 10 лет. Имеет свой собственный магазин , где торгует запчастями  и электроприборами. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита. Это даст возможность увеличить ассортимент  и таким образом привлечь новых клиентов. Это даст прибыль. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ihomiddin T. lives in Nurek. He is 28 years old and is married with one child. He has been working in sales for ten years. He has a store where he sells spare parts and electroc appliances. Ihomiddin would like to apply for a loan that would allow him to increase the assortment of goods he sells and attract new customers. This would increase cash flow and profit. Ihomiddin would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en:
Umedjon is married with two children. He is a market vendor from Dushanbe where he sells teenagers' clothing. Umedjon is very enterprising, has vast experience working as a vendor, and is full of creative ideas. A reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service have always been priorities in his work and have helped to ensure the success of his business. Umedjon has been running his business for many years. In general he has about 6 years of experience selling clothing. Currently, he is requesting a loan of $900 USD to increase his inventory. He promises to repay the loan within 12 months. He believes that having this additional turnover capital will help him minimize his sales risk and provide stable financial support for his family. Moreover, it will help him get closer to his ultimate goal of purchasing a big store of his own.

In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new goods for resale

loans.name: Gulsarakhon

texts.en:
M. Gulsarakhon is 49 years old. She is marred with two children. Gulsarakhon has been running her own small business for 20 years. She rents a store in the local market for selling candies and different kinds of sweets. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. Gulsarakhon is very friendly and polite which brings her clientele. Now she requests $1000 USD. She is planning to spend the loan to purchase more goods for selling, thus increasing the variety of the goods and to be able to provide for her children's needs and their school fees. Gulsarakhon promises to repay her loan within 9 months and thanks everybody who decided to support her.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of goods

loans.name: Begmahmad

texts.en:
R. Begmahmad is 37 years old. He is married with four children. Begmahmad has been selling men’s shoes for 2 years. He began selling to acquaintances and friends, and after a while he realized that he had a lot of clients. So, he decided to rent a shop and establish himself in “Vahdat” market. He is a very enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead. His business has profited from his labor and he hopes to grow as a businessman. Begmahmad needs a loan of $900 USD, which he plans to invest in inventory in order to offer better service and variety to his clients. You can be an important part of the growth of this business. Today is your opportunity to help, have no doubt. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase inventory and working capital

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en:
S. Mehriniso is 46 years old, she lives with her spouse, and works every day starting very early in the morning so that she can get ahead and achieve her goal of having her 6 children successfully finish school and enter University. Her business is located in the central market of Dushanbe and she sells clothes for women. Thanks to the support of her spouse and her own effort she was able to expand her business, which began with little inventory and in a small space and now has a bigger space and a large clientele. With the loan of $ 900 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a greater variety of clothing styles, for a variety of occasions, and a few specific requests of her customers. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing for women in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Sirojiddin

texts.ru: Хайдаров Сироджиддин житель города Яван.Возраст 35 лет ,енат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет мойку в которой работает уже 2 года. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить новое оборудование. Оно необходимо для того,чтобы улучшить качество обслуживания. Таким образом он сможет привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кердит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sirojiddin H. lives in Yavan. He is 35 years old and is married with four children. He has a car wash where he has been working for the past two years. He is applying for a loan for the purchase of new equipment that would allow him to improve the quality of his services and attract new clients. He would pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase new equipment

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 37 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her family in Asaba, Delta State, in Nigeria. Rose operates her own vending business, and is requesting a loan to sell more provisions and food items. She would like to thank all her lenders in advance for their generosity and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and food stuffs to sell

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola is thirty-nine years old and married with three children. She sells clothes and gift items. She would like a loan to purchase a wider variety of clothes and gift items to sell. Shola thanks Kiva in advance for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and gift items to sell

loans.name: Muzayam

texts.en:
S. Muzayam is the humble mother of a family with two children and she works hard to educate them. She has worked in agriculture, along with her husband, for 5 years, to generate the family’s income. They work hard at growing vegetables, which they sell in the market. Last season was very productive, and after much effort, they had achieved a big harvest. Her husband went the market to the sell the crop of their labor. Currently Muzayam’s family has a financial problem and she needs help. The family wishes to continue planting vegetables and increase their capital to purchase more seed and fertilizer. For this purpose, Muzayam and her family is requesting a loan with which they would be able to improve their quality of life. Let’s help this family to remain strong and united. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Ada

texts.en: Ada is 28 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. She hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders and she will work hard to put her loan to good use.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Husnigul

texts.en:
Husnigul is a hard-working entrepreneur from Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. She and her husband have three children. She runs a business where she sells children’s footwear. Husnigul began her business 13 years ago and has run it with both extreme care and seriousness. Her daughters’ help Husnigul with her business. It is an important source of income for her family of five, considering that her husband does not earn enough money. Husnigul has requested a loan of $775 so that she can purchase more footwear for upcoming spring season. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business further and help feed her family.

loans.use: Purchasing the shoes for expanding business.

loans.name: Ismoiljon

texts.en:
Since he was very young, T. Ismoiljon has been in touch with the countryside. His family dedicated themselves to cultivating fruits and vegetables. Ever since he was young, he imagined he’d be in the business of selling produce. And, fortunately, he realized this dream. At the age of 26, he began to sell vegetables in small markets. Nevertheless, little by little, he saved money so he could set up his own shop. Thanks to his efforts and the love he has for this business, Ismoiljon’s business has been growing gradually. Nevertheless, Ismoiljon believes it is the time to inject more capital into the business so that he can buy at wholesale and obtain better prices. As a result, he is soliciting a loan of $ 1100 USD, which he will repay in 6 months. With your help, Ismoiljon will be able to move his business forward and offer his wife and five children a better future.
